reviews.text:
Definitely NOT a 5 star hotel.
Firstly, rooms are advertised both on the website and on third party online agents (Expedia-Orbitz) as being Garden view and they are not! We were given a first floor room right on top of the entrance awning, full of pigeons.
Upon complaining, we were very politely told: 1) that we should be glad to get a room in the renovation part of the hotel; 2) that we shouldn’t have used third party agents to  book a room.
The lobby of the hotel is full of luggages on hold, which projects a rather untidy impression as soon as you enter.
Our breakfast, of acceptable quality and nice park view, was included, yet the hostess tried a few time to have us sign a paper agreeing to pay for a “discretionary service charge”. I refused to sign.
The room has no safe deposit.
Elevators are always packed.
What a disappointment.
فندق لايرد الوديعه تم دفع مبلغ 150 باوند كوديعه ولم يتم اعادتها لي اكثر من شهر.  وكم شخص حصلت معه هذه المشكله.  لا انصح بالحجز فيه
reviews.textTranslated: Hotel does not return the deposit. The amount of 150 pounds was paid as a deposit and it has not been returned to me for more than a month. How many people have this problem with? I do not recommend booking it

reviews.text: Vip
Midden in centrum
reviews.textTranslated: Right in the center

reviews.text:
Had a mixed experience here. The Royal Garden is a 5-star hotel and my review is based on that. The pros: location is good. You’re right on High Street and literally next door to Kensington Gardens. Our room had a really nice view of the city but you can pay extra for a Garden view. The hotel is also a short walk (10 minutes) to Portabella Market. The bell-staff are good and helped with bags in and out. There’s a piano bar in the restaurant which was fun to sit in at the end of the night and hear some cover songs. Nothing exceptional but a fun perk.

Now for the not-so-good. The room despite its high price was very small and didn’t even have room to put a standard luggage suitcase. My wife had to put hers on the floor next to the bed and mine went on the only seat in the room. I think they could have laid the rooms out better. I would have preferred a less “fancy” hotel with a little larger room. On our trip it was the only Hotel I felt cramped and we both kept tripping on our stuff because it was so small.

This is also the first hi-end hotel I’ve stayed in that didn’t have an iron or steamer in room. And when I called to the front desk “all the irons are not available, and we don’t have steamers.” So I had to wear a wrinkly shirt to a nice dinner. Should be pretty easy to order a few extra irons, and to me that’s inexcusable at a 5-star spot.

The rooms are the worst sound proofing out of any hotel we stayed in our trip. We could literally hear the people in the next room talking, making noises, etc all night. The hallways each day were also littered with trash. I’m not sure if the hotel doesn’t monitor the hallways or there were just really messy people on our floor, but it smelled terrible and was nasty to look at peoples garbage all over the halls in a “5-star hotel”…every day of our 4-day stay.

Next, the staff members from concierge to front desk to bell-man were clueless about their location. We checked in late and I asked each of them if there was any food around the area. “Oh no it’s past 10pm”….”Not in London ha!”….”maybe an American diner about 30 minutes away”…Mind you it’s Saturday night. Well we walked out the hotel went one block west (2 minute walk) and found an awesome food market with everything from brick oven pizza to Thai food… And actually had one of our best dinners in London there! On top of that we went back to the hotel to the piano bar and guess what: yup the piano bar serves pizzas and snacks til 12am. No one in the entire hotel even knew about their own restaurant. Yes: We asked both the concierge and the front desk and neither knew. Again for a 5-star, not acceptable.

And probably the thing that really left a bad taste in our mouths was how the staff treated us. We had extended our room on our 2nd night with the front desk to add a 4th night. And then on our 4th day when the extension was to happen, our keys stopped working. We went to the front desk assuming they simply forgot to fix the keys, but when we arrived they told us they had a “priority customer who stays there all the time who needs the room”…so basically they were ready to kick us out for a more “fancy” person. And they had no rooms left. Seriously?! A 5-star hotel does this? It’s not a bad hotel but it’s not a good one either. I wouldn’t stay here again especially considering the price. I don’t feel there was anything 5-star about the experience.

Ein 5 Sternehotel kann nicht erlauben dass solche Ruhestörungen nach 23.00 Uhr geduldet werden - siehe video. Nun zum 2. Tag in Folge. Kleiner Makel wie der kaputte Fussboden sind kein Problem sprechen aber auch nicht für ein 5sternehotel. Dass eine verschlossene Durchgangstür vorhanden ist zwischen 2 Zimmern ist auch keine Entschuldigung. Korrekterweise muss ich sagen, dass das Hotel nach Überprüfung der Umstände ein neues (älteres u kleineres) Zimmer zur Verfügung gestellt hat, weshalb der Service eine gute Note verdient.
reviews.textTranslated: A 5 star hotel cannot allow such disturbances to be tolerated after 11 p.m. - see video. Now for the 2nd day in a row. Small flaws like the broken floor are not a problem, but they also do not speak for a 5-star hotel. The fact that there is a locked connecting door between 2 rooms is also no excuse. It is correct to say that after checking the circumstances, the hotel provided a new (older & smaller) room, so the service deserves a good mark.

reviews.text: No longer that good 5 star and becoming very expensive

I was expecting a good quality hotel but received a 1 star hotel experience.

Checked into my hotel room, the bathroom was dirty. Tissues down the toilet drain and towels on the floor

Our bathroom robes had big holes due to rips and they were extremely scruffy.

While sleeping on one of the days someone walked into our room at 8:55 am. When I woke up and asked who’s there, they immediately ran away. Reception claimed it was housekeeping but when I asked who’s there no one ever replied to me. Very unprofessional, I was startled and wasn’t able to sleep.

Ibrahim from reception gave us an upgrade to apologize for all these terrible experiences and provided us with an upgrade for a whole week. Felicity then asked us to leave on day 2, she literally said “a VIP is coming you must leave the room”. No guest should be told someone more important than you is coming and be treated like they’re second class. Felicity has no hospitality experience and honestly  this hotel deserves a 1 star for the level of housekeeping and hospitality I’ve experienced.
Clean, fancy. Amazing!
فندق جميل ونظيف وموقعه ممتاز
reviews.textTranslated: Nice, clean hotel and excellent location

reviews.text: Parking is a bit frustrating. Didn't recognise our number plate
فندف رويال غاردن يستحق خمس نجوم فعلاً فندق راقي والخدمة رائعة والغرف كبيرة جداً وقد كانت غرفتي ذات اطلالة رائعة أمام الحديقة انصح الجميع به
reviews.textTranslated: The Royal Garden Hotel really deserves five stars. It is an elegant hotel, the service is wonderful, and the rooms are very large. My room had a wonderful view in front of the garden. I recommend it to everyone

reviews.text: Wir waren in den Sommerferien 2023 mit 4 Personen im Hotel. Überraschend großes Zimmer im 5. Stock, tolle Aussicht auf den Park, Bad mit Dusche/Wanne/WC + extra WC, perfekt für 4 Pers., allerdings haben wir sehr eine Klobürste vermisst!! Ich weiß, dass das in höherpreisigen Hotels in London üblich ist, dass es keine gibt, aber gerade wenn man zu viert ist, kann das schnell unangenehm werden! Große Fenster, helles freundliches Zimmer mit räumlicher Abtrennung zur Schlafcouch. 2 TV. Sogar 2 deutsche Kanäle empfangbar. Personal durchweg freundlich und hilfsbereit. Nette PianoBar mit Livemusik während unseres Aufenthalts. Frühstück und Restaurant, sowie Fitness Center und Spa können wir nicht bewerten, da nicht genutzt. Sehr viele Einkaufsmöglichkeiten, Cafés und Restaurants fußläufig (Für Selbstversorger: Marks&Spencer Foodhall ist günstiger als der WholeFoodMarket ;-) ). Bushaltestelle direkt vor der Tür. U-Bahn 3-4min. zu Fuß. Dadurch grandiose Anbindung zum/vom Flughafen und ins Touristenzentrum (Bus Linie 9, wir empfehlen unbedingt die OysterCard zu kaufen!). Hyde Park unmittelbar angrenzend. Holland Park 10min zu Fuß. Fazit: super Standort für einen Städtetrip.
reviews.textTranslated: We stayed at the hotel with 4 people during the summer holidays of 2023. Surprisingly large room on the 5th floor, great view of the park, bathroom with shower/tub/toilet + extra toilet, perfect for 4 people, but we really missed a toilet brush!! I know it's common in higher priced hotels in London that there aren't any, but especially when there are four of you it can quickly become uncomfortable! Large windows, bright, friendly room with spatial separation from the sofa bed. 2 TVs. Even 2 German channels can be received. Staff consistently friendly and helpful. Nice piano bar with live music during our stay. We can't rate breakfast and restaurant, as well as fitness center and spa, since we didn't use them. Lots of shopping, cafés and restaurants within walking distance (for self-catering: Marks&Spencer Foodhall is cheaper than the WholeFoodMarket ;-) ). Bus stop right in front of the door. Subway 3-4min. on foot. This means great connections to/from the airport and the tourist center (bus line 9, we definitely recommend buying the OysterCard!). Hyde Park immediately adjacent. Holland Park 10 mins walk. Conclusion: great location for a city trip.

reviews.text: The location is cool, just perfect!

Very bad service. The air conditioner stopped working since the last night. They said that they fixed it but still it didn’t work properly. The staff were not helpful. They just gave us fans which weren’t helpful.

Not sure how this is a 5 star hotel... AC stopped working the day before a 80 degree day in summer, and the rooms already run incredibly hot (very poor air circulation). No response from front desk except for a fan that did not work. Far better options in London, do not waste your time.
very good in general but make sure they give you the type of room you booked.
Eddy and shasha where so Helpful and Delightful with me
Went to the origin restaurant  meal was great but had five different people serve us they got confused with order.

Good local, next to Kensington Palace Gardens and a short Taxi ride to St. Pancras Station and all local attractions. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The accommodations were comfortable and clean.  I would recommend the Royal Garden Hotel for your next stay in London.
Amazing service! Resto on top floor is unreal. Location is great too. Overall amazing hotel.
Fantastic location service and staff!
Positive: The friendliness of the staff. They all go above and beyond.

Coopering the service before 2020 and now the level of service went down.
We safer with the A/C up to last day. The room next door were very noisy we complained however they still same. Bad experience will not repeat this again. Bad communication

Unfortunately my experience was not great, i have stayed there for a week during my honeymoon and i have few items stolen from my room. My wife’s wedding ring was gone and the hotel didn’t do much… be careful don’t leave your valuables in the room nor the safe.
Amazing rooms.

I was robbed from my room! This is an atrocious hotel with utterly pathetic staff. I had to call them several times to let them know that somebody had stolen money from me they were incredibly casual about it like it happens all the time here. A police complaint was filed. I would not just staying here they are all thieves.

This review is based on my own experience and interaction with the staff.  Our party of 4, two adults and two kids, stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and we were not disappointed.  Even before our stay, I called the concierge, (Adan) last minute to arrange for a car service to pick us up at the airport.  Our flight was delayed and we arrived late in the evening but our driver was there waiting for us at the airport and drove us safely to the hotel in about half hour.  The staff were extremely professional and friendly.  Adan and Vivian at the front desk greeted and welcomed us immediately.  We got to the hotel very late and we were hungry so we ordered room service which hit the spot.   We rented the Royal Deluxe suite and were given a nice room, spacious with a king-size bed and sofa bed.  There's a big bathroom that included a shower and separate bathtub.  We had a great view of the park and Kensington Palace.  Breakfast was included with our room.  We took full advantage of it everyday and we were very satisfied. For dinner, we tried Min Jiang and Origin restaurant another night.  We enjoyed both restaurants but management at Origin restaurant went above and beyond.  Mauricio, and our waiter, Howard, took great care of us.  They were very attentive and the food was good too.   The breakfast staff were great as well.  Can't name them all but Alberto was one of the waiters who we felt did a great job.   Other notable names to mention are Ken, Naz, Marlon, Najir, Aimee, and Carlos.  Thank you all for everything and for being so pleasant.  Also can't forget the housekeeping staff who prepared our room and stocked everything we needed everyday.  Overall, service was great, location was perfect and we had a wonderful time. We would absolutely book this hotel again in the future.  Thank you.

The deluxe garden room is gorgeous.. very chic, simple.  View of the park is ethereal somehow. Service in the hotel is very fast, impressively.  A maintenance man came up within seconds of me suspecting my USB port didn’t work (though, it did work).  Beautiful to wake up at the park every day.

I have been regular at this hotel. Unfortunately the service has declined and some staff were rude and untrained. Rooms are not cleaned properly example shelves. Location is good. Rooms are good. Service is not good.

J’ai fêter mes 30 ans la bas avec mon mari,
Suite incroyable
Personnel à l’écoute et aux petits soins
Service 10/10 !

Merci du fond du cœur pour ce séjour que vous avez rendu magique 🙏🏽

Nous reviendrons !
reviews.textTranslated:
I celebrated my 30th birthday there with my husband,
Incredible sequel
Attentive and caring staff
Service 10/10!

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for this stay that you made magical 🙏🏽

We will come back !

reviews.text: نظيف يستاهل كل ريال غرفته واسعه السرير مريح جدا اختارو اطلاله على الهايد بارك 🥹❤️👍👍👍👍
reviews.textTranslated: Clean, worth every riyal, spacious room, very comfortable bed, choose a view of Hyde Park 🥹❤️👍👍👍👍

reviews.text: When I arrived at the hotel, it was pretty late. We had booked a room with twin beds (it was my brother and I) and instead, we had one single bed. We decided not to complain, because we figured everything would be fine. The room had no safe, and as an international traveler, the security of having a safe is pretty important. Again, we decided to say nothing. My third and final strike, was ordering food to our hotel and having Eddie, the rudest concierge I’ve ever encountered, throw our food away while we were on our way back to the hotel after a night out, after berating us. His tone was truly the lowest of lows and he made me uncomfortable to continue staying at the hotel. Eddie told us he didn’t think we’d like it and proceeded to throw away £42 of food. I spoke to two managers, who told me I would be emailed about this incident, never followed up. As someone who has stayed here before, I promise you it will never happen again. The way Eddie spoke to us, treated us, and then the way they handled the situation was the deciding factor in never staying here again. The service is astonishingly terrible and I was horribly disappointed.

similarHotelsNearby.name: Hart Shoreditch Hotel London, Curio Collection by Hilton
Mondrian London Shoreditch
similarHotelsNearby.description: Polished hotel with a rooftop pool

reviews.text: The front desk staff at reception was very helpful in getting me into a hotel room when I arrived early. After a 10 + hour travel day, it was the one thing I needed to start my trip right. Thanks to Eugenia, Turkyan and Jamil. The location was convenient in a central going out area of Shoreditch. Good amount of restaurants, coffee shops and bars within walking distance.

We paid £375 on our anniversary for a room that was disappointing. There were cleanliness issues and the room was generally a run down.

-The phone was disgusting, covered in some weird residue.

-The shower was loose and pulling away from the wall.

-The toilet seat was cracked.

-The bathroom walls were stained and marked.

-Bedside tables were water-marked and worn.

-There were no cups for tea/coffee and when we called housekeeping for some they never were delivered.

-The bathroom TV didn't work.

-The shaving/makeup mirror was far too low to be of any use.

-No usb sockets in the room.

Great location though!
Perfect location and a short walk from the city! Friendly staff, great breakfast, and spacious rooms!
Absolutely stunning hotel with friendly and helpful staff
Enjoyed the cocktails and cinema experience

Very disappointing, room problems 3 rooms in 1 night stay! leisure facilities not safe for solo women traveller? Room wasn’t as advertised, sky tv & phones didn’t work, shower overflowed, milk off, lockers didn’t work in leisure , hour wait for burger & chips. Safety of leisure facilities on -4 floor no staff no guests if problem with health or safety especially as a solo woman no one around to help.

This review is of the bar only.
£13 for a cocktail in a plastic glass! Not a great cocktail at that!
Couldn't get anyone's attention to place order, then they had to ask twice for a simple order from the menu.
Nice location but would not recommend
A brilliant view with friendly staff and access to the rooftop bar

Unfortunately I don't believe this hotel still meets the 5* standard. I was lucky enough to be travelling on business and stay here however I left thoroughly disappointed and have rebooked my next business trip to a new hotel.

The room I was placed in was run down with damages to the countertops, a leaking toilet and no lock on the bathroom door.

I used the pool and the signage was confusing when you get down to the lower levels and although they say you have to call for a locker code, there is no easily visible telephone on the spa desk and you have to go behind it to use the phone.

Overall I would not stay again unless someone booked this for me.
Great cocktail and cinema experience with free popcorn!

My family and I had an outstanding experience at this hotel. Every employee went above and beyond to make sure we were happy with every aspect of our stay. The rooms were very nice as well. We also loved the location of this hotel and only left our neighborhood when we went to a soccer game. We will definitely stay here again when we come back to london!
The room was quite spacious and nice . The breakfast is below average, not recommended. The staff are helpful .. location is reasonably good, one can get tube service within 10 min walk ..

DO NOT BOOK A PRIVATE EVENT WITH THIS HOTEL.

I held a private birthday event in May of this year at the Courthouse Hotel Shoreditch. They pre authorised my card on arrival, and said I wouldn't be charged. At the end of the night, they forced me to pay the remaining balance upfront, even though we had negotiated otherwise. I then checked my account the next day and found they had charged me twice.

Since May I have been chasing my rightful refund, and they still owe me a significant amount. Every time I call the office, the manager is supposedly busy, or not in office. Apparently planning other events is more important than rectifying their mistake.

As it has been four months, I am considering pursuing legal action, as I have no other avenue to turn to and this has been emotionally distressing.

I stayed with my daughter for an overnight break.
Staff were amazing so very friendly and couldn't do enough for you.
Room was clean and bed very confortable, would highly recommend.
The rooftop bar was an added bonus.

For work I visit multiple high end hotels over the course of the year. This is the best we visit, bar none. Between Chris (directory) and Nick (head chef) our stay is always impeccable, attention to detail second to none. I only wish we could use this hotel for all our annual engagements

Room was nice and spacious and clean. Location is central to shoreditch. Service was OK when I arrived, aside from the guy on the desk clicking his fingers at the porter to carry my bags. I didn't like that. The porter was more than helpful, brought things to room when asked and was pleasant to talk to.  But when I went to check out, nobody was on the desk, even after I shouted for attention. They take a £50 charge for damages ahead of your stay. I had to call the hotel after I left to refund this.
The breakfast was of OK standard, but as others have mentioned, I steered clear of the scrambled eggs, they did not look good at all. Wouldn't pay for for breakfast if I stayed again but probably wouldn't stay here again.

Fantastic rooms, very spacious and well kitted out.
Location is bang in the middle of Shoreditch, so quite lively on a Saturday night but you can't hear anything from the rooms. It does make it great for getting anywhere though

Located in the very heart of Shoreditch
Superb rooms with air conditioner
Really helpful and polite staff
Has a roof top bar with a good view
Has an essential shop very next to it
Has parking too

Cons-
Cannot be located easily as they don't have a separate board to highlight the hotel name

From the out side the building looks impressive and from what I saw from the inside it was tidy and clean.

The reception staff were relatively unhelpful as was the concierge. My room was very hot all night despite me asking three members of staff to look at the air conditioning. So I had a terrible nights sleep and for £389 I feel pretty unimpressed with this.

I also asked the staff for an iron and ironing board three times despite telling them I needed it urgently when I checked in.

When I got to my room there was someone from maintenance fixing a broken cupboard door. I wasn’t told anyone would be in my room. I waited ten minutes and he left after being unsuccessful in his attempt.

All in all the hotel lacked any sort of wow factor.

I won’t be staying here again.
Love this hotel! So clean and the staff are nice

Generally good hotel, rooms are spacious and generally in good condition. Breakfast of relatively good quality however could do with more options for coffee etc instead of only filter coffee.

Didn't get a chance to use facilities however they looked positive.

Service wasn't great at checkout, almost like my presence was a distraction.
Lovely venue for private cinema screening. Cocktails and hospitality all in place
Had a mid week overnight stay including breakfast. Great place and would stay again

We just came here for a cocktail and cinema afternoon.  The rooftop bar was good, but we ended up having the cocktail before the 5th and then was advertised to have it after.  That meant it was a bit rushed to get down to the cinema.
The cinema was clean and well maintained.  Staff were all pretty friendly, too.
There are amenities and facilities that should improve to make the tariff convincing.

Mooi hotel, nette kamers, elke dag een nieuw flesje water op de kamer, keurig schoon, vriendelijk personeel.
Bus stopt voor de deur, dus prima locatie om London te ontdekken.
reviews.textTranslated:
Nice hotel, neat rooms, a new bottle of water in the room every day, neat and clean, friendly staff.
Bus stops in front of the door, so great location to discover London.

reviews.text: Absolutely stunning hotel. Would 100% stay there again. The pool and spa facilities are beautiful.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Courthouse Shoreditch Hotel, and I must say, it exceeded all of my expectations. From the moment I walked in, I was struck by the stylish decor and the welcoming atmosphere. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful, and made me feel right at home.

The room itself was spacious. The bed was comfortable, the linens were soft and of high quality, and the bathroom was immaculate. But the real highlight of my stay was the rooftop . Overlooking the city of London, I felt like I was on top of the world. The view was truly breathtaking, and I spent hours just gazing out at the incredible skyline.

The hotel’s rooftop bar was the perfect spot to relax and enjoy a drink after a long day of exploring. And speaking of exploring, the hotel is located in the heart of Shoreditch, one of London's most vibrant neighborhoods. There is so much to see and do in the area, from trendy restaurants and bars to vintage shops and art galleries.

Overall, my experience at the Courthouse Shoreditch Hotel was nothing short of amazing. The staff especially Andres the concierge, and the location all exceeded my expectations, and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious and unforgettable stay in London.

Humm not sure what to make of this one rooms okay odd set up on the kettle nowhere set to plug it in ..

Restaurant area nice, breakfast not great certainly not worth the charge at best it was a 3 star breekie ..

Staff nice but place a bit souless

Still, recommend and good back story to place, and just across the road from spite fields, brick lane the bikers restaurant  and Boxpark

We stayed in another hotel in London and found that our details were given to this hotel. The same night.
This was Nov 2022
We reported the fraud directly to the hotel and our credit company
The hotel clearly allows fraud
We have spoken to the hotel on numerous occasions, they lie continuously, one staff member reported we stayed there, but couldnt find details, then they confirmed to Lloyds credit card we did , they can’t find your name on computer ? Can’t find email.
I wouldn’t trust this five star hotel
You speak to one member of staff they find your details and said they would send them by email, never received , then the manager daytime  Ash Mohammed can’t find anything and says you need confirmation number
That’s odd
This hotel is dodgy
Great staff, veeam event was fun
Top Top Hotel …!!

Visited with my sister for a Champagne afternoon tea. Had an absolutely brilliant day here. The tea was lovely. We had a selection of sandwiches, cakes, scones, raspberry & cranberry tea plus a glass of champagne. I can highly recommend this place.

L'endroit est très beau, les chambres sont spacieuses et la literie très confortable, le personnel est agréable. En revanche l'hôtel n'est pas à la hauteur d'un 5 étoiles. Informations incertaines sur les horaires d'ouverture du rooftop et des bars, petit-déjeuner avec peu de choix et produits de qualité très moyenne, quelques réparations à prévoir notamment dans la douche, chips en décomposition près de la table de chevet.
reviews.textTranslated: The place is very beautiful, the rooms are spacious and the bedding very comfortable, the staff is pleasant. On the other hand, the hotel is not up to 5 star standards. Uncertain information on the opening hours of the rooftop and bars, breakfast with little choice and products of very average quality, some repairs to be planned, particularly in the shower, decomposing chips near the bedside table.

reviews.text:
Gros problème de chauffage dans la chambre, mais le personnel a pu nous surclasser!
Hôtel très bien équipé et bien placé
reviews.textTranslated:
Big heating problem in the room, but the staff was able to upgrade us!
Very well equipped and well located hotel

reviews.text: Good sized rooms, massive bar... But only has booths around the edge

We had a Buy a Gift voucher for 3 courses and bottomless prosecco, plus a cinema showing. We attended on Sunday 29th January.
Positives:
Our voucher had expired due to Covid lockdowns and illness, and the restaurant manager still allowed us to use it.
Negatives:
The waitress didn't write down our order and didn't seem attentive. We repeated it twice and she still came back to check. This meant our order of cheeseburger with no salad or mayonnaise came with salad and lots of mayonnaise. We sent it back and said no mayonnaise. It then came back still with salad, no mayonnaise but also no cheese. We asked for cheese to be put on but the waiter who brought it indicated the kitchen was soon to close and wouldn't do it. We then went to the cinema portion of our deal. The show started late and kept freezing with a red screen. Everyone sat for 45 minutes with no communication from staff. When I eventually went to the projection room window and questioned what was happening someone finally came out and apologised and said there were technical difficulties; yes we know, we realised this 45 minutes ago! We were offered a free drink and I was told to use the email from my booking to rebook for another time. I don’t think I will, as the service was so bad and the film I wanted to see will not be on anyway.

The breakfast here is awful. It costs 22.5 pounds, and it literally composes of a few hot items that have clearly been sat there all morning. The bread was stale and the scrambled eggs looked revolting. Any of the surrounding places do a better breakfast and for less money.
espectacular todo muy limpio muy recomendable
reviews.textTranslated: spectacular everything very clean highly recommended

reviews.text:
Had afternoon Tea there it was a friends birthday thought they would have of made an effort gave her a free cake or decorated table
Plus they should have supplied more sandwiches too.

Cet hôtel ne mérite pas ses 4 étoiles !
Pas d accueil, pas de service,  personnel  insuffisant, manque d amabilité,  petit déjeuner  médiocre  non varié.
Hammam  ne fonctionne  pas,  ni jacuzzi, pas de ménage fait au spa.. nous retrouvons  le lendemain  nos serviettes  et  boissons  vides telles quelles !
Non concevable! Puis piscine non éclairée
Le pire nous avions  réservé  une suite, on nous donne  à  la  place une chambre  familiale  prétextant  que notre suite à été attribuée  à  des footballeurs...sans dédommagement ! Litige réglé avec insistance seulement le lendemain.
Une soirée  du 31 décembre  avait lieu dans l hôtel nous y étions conviés  lorsque nous y entrons nous avons été  dégagés  bien impoliment  par le directeur
Je ne recommande  pas cet hôtel  qui nous a presque  paru abandonné
reviews.textTranslated:
This hotel does not deserve its 4 stars!
No welcome, no service, insufficient staff, lack of friendliness, mediocre breakfast with no variety.
Hammam does not work, nor jacuzzi, no cleaning done at the spa .. we find the next day our empty towels and drinks as they are!
Not conceivable! Then unlit swimming pool
The worst we had booked a suite, we were given a family room instead claiming that our suite had been assigned to footballers...without compensation! Dispute resolved with insistence only the next day.
An evening of December 31 was taking place in the hotel we were invited there when we entered we were very rudely cleared by the manager
I do not recommend this hotel which almost seemed abandoned to us

reviews.text: Lovely place with lovely working people! Rooms are spacious, spotlessly clean and cozy, bathroom was clean and equipped with quality essentials. From the day of check In till we left our experience was incredible. Loved the place and it's phenomenal environment.
Ajoyib chiroyli ekan
reviews.textTranslated: It is very beautiful

reviews.text: A nice hotel, done to good standard. Lack of plug sockets. Very disappointed with the staff not returning my deposit for over a week. I chased it several times and was fobbed off to speak to my bank. Only the 8th time of calling they said they would send me a receipt of the returned payment which I didn't receive and then it appeared in my account. Not sure why it was so difficult.

Do not stay here! Everything you see online as “amenities” or “available” is either not in use or you have to pay for. It’s all a farce. No restaurant, empty bar, the cinema is only offered on Sundays, they had the audacity to charge £60 for half an hour of bowling, the continental breakfast is £17/person… offering the worst scrambled eggs possible… and either frosties or toast as an option. Don’t get me started about the cleanliness of the bathrooms. There is mold in the caulk of the shower. The icing after the ridiculousness of this hotel is the battery needed changing for tele remote. I am furious about this hotel and its offerings. Far from a 5 star hotel; I will never be staying here again.
Beautiful hotel so unique. Lovely rooms. Comfy beds and pillows. Great breakfast. Pool was cold. No soap in shower area for pool and shower was broken as was steam room.
Lovely rooms and attentive staff

Our experience was great the pool was amazing and all the staff was very friendly and helpful especially the beautiful muscle man that helped us with our luggage’s he is actually the best he was such a gentleman he seems so happy to help us and when the our Uber guy was getting upset he spoke to him and calmed him down told the Uber guy to help us out we was very happy with his service and we will go there again just for him ☺️

Booked a hotel room here ahead of my company's Christmas party due to its proximity to the venue we were at and also Liverpool Street station.

That night we were due to check-in (around 6pm) they called me last minute to say they have overbooked and they cannot offer the room anymore. This close to Christmas everything else nearby was fully booked or extremely expensive. They said the only thing they could offer is a room in Kensington (about an hour away from the venue we were at!). They claimed the other hotel was nice but in reality it felt a lot more like a crummy 3-star hotel...

I get that mistakes sometimes happen but they didn't really seem to care that much and they were doing this all so last minute. Also they didn't offer any kind of discount on what we were meant to pay. Especially annoying since we had to book new train tickets for the next day since it was nowhere near Liverpool Street.

Overall just bad management / poor quality.
This is an excellent hotel, unquestionably. But it requires a deep pocket to pay for it!

Nice place....room was clean n comfortable, staff were pleasant n helpful....they were also able to offer parking which was a major plus for me as i was driving from the midlands...nice breakfast also.
Gorgeous hotel with stunning rooms

Rude and undermining general manager, who doesn’t care about the health and safety of his staff. The staff seem over worked and underpaid for the time and effort they put into looking after the events. Food is over cooked, no flavour and is dry. Don’t come here if you want to enjoy your time
Great hotel, well located in a living area in London. A lot of nice bars, restaurants and clubs around. The room was really spacious, clean and well equipped.
Nice hotel overall, but showing its age.

We chose this hotel for it's location as a change from central London. It's an Ok hotel but not like any other four star hotel I have ever stayed in. On arrival there was no door man which isn't a criticism but there are steep stairs up to the hotel which some people may find difficult. Once inside there where 3 porters all just standing about chatting not one of them offered to help us they just pointed about reception and carried on with their conversation. The receptionist was slouched behind the desk looking rather crumpled, to be honest I wasn't sure he was the receptionist, however he was pleasant and checked us in, BUT, and this was a big but, he refused to give us our keys until we had agreed to have a £50 charge against out credit cards in case of damage to the room. I have never been asked for this before, especially in an establishment which is supposedly 4 stars. If he had said it was for any extras charged to the room then maybe but he was very clear it was for any damages we incurred. The room it's self was spotlessly clean and very spacious.  On the whole it was ok but not worth the money we paid.

No heat in my room; it was 6' C outside and not much warmer inside. Called down to the desk four times, waited an hour, and then gave up. I slept bundled in my overcoat. Mentioned it this morning at checkout and the clerk was incredibly dismissive.
Very disappointing for a 5 star hotel. The location, the bed and the pillows are pretty much the only good parts of the stay. Not good value for money at all.
Rooms were amazing, staff friendly and helpful.. busy location.
saw Tottenham team very nice

So guys came for the cinema and cocktails. Expecting to eat from the all day bar menu, but, guess what? There's no food. Went our in pouring rain to grab something but nothing local open for take away. Manager response; kitchen closed. My response; sort out your flipping website and REMOVE the menu. But by the way, if restaurant closed, how come you're making and serving afternoon tea? Manager response: blank. Rubbish service. Don't bother

Booked a room for the night. All residents bars and restaurant were booked out for a private party. Only water in the rooms. I was told to go out in the rain to find somewhere to eat and drink. If I wanted room only I would have booked a guesthouse. Security were appalling. Never again
Nice courtroom converted hotel. Good place for office meeting and parties
Helpful staff, impressive building. The hot buffet lunch was outstanding!

Only visited the rooftop bar, nice views but service was absolutely appalling waited ages for server to take drinks order and then a wait of 20 minutes for order to finally arrive, didn't bother ordering another round .

Pretty much everything about our stay was completely shocking so much so we immediately tried to cancel and leave on arrival ! Staff was absolutely shocking and very rude , I honestly have had a better stay at a holiday inn bargain hotel ! Shambles

My friend took me to this place for an afternoon tea Bday celebration, we phoned while on our way as we were running a bit late, by 10 minutes, and they said is fine. We arrived and the man in the reception desk show us were to wait, as we sat in the reception the same man came and told us to go into a room and wait there, we went into this room, this room is a very interesting dinning room, with a very nice bar and all detention cells decorated nicely, we took some pictures there while waiting. As half an hour past and no body has come to us we went out to the reception and asked the man what was going on, why the delay, he again asked as to wait and told us to wait in the same room, that was empty. We asked for the manager and a man called Richard came to tell us they had an emergency in the kitchen and there was no service, he asked us to reschedule and offered us cinema tickets, we declined this. The expirience was really bad given we were celebrating my Bday and had tickets to go to an exhibition after, so we were hungry and with not time to look for something else. Why did they leave us there waiting in an empty dinning room for so long?  Why didn't they tell us when we phoned on our way there? Why didn't tell us when we arrived?  How long would we have stayed there if we didn't asked? Really bad, not a good expirience.
This hotel is very beautiful 🌟😁

The room and bathroom size were very large for London (in my experience) over plenty of space to feel comfortable whilst staying there. Some bathroom fixtures were loose, and a light bulb was blinking - however this really did not impede on our stay in a noticeable way.  Also, the rooms were very quiet - which is surprising due to the nightlife available in the area as well as constant traffic flow. The reception staff were always helpful and had great recommendations. Breakfast was really good providing a large range of buffet options, and staff were on hand and there to help or keep supply refreshed. The Bar area was beautifully decorated, and staff would come in to serve you if and when required - great cocktails! The location is excellent for access to food, entertainment, transport and airports. Overall, very happy with our stay and would highly recommend staying here.

We booked a voucher for bottomless brunch + cinema at Courthouse Hotel Shoreditch via BuyAGift and it was the worst ‘voucher experiences’ I have ever had in my life.

We arrived 10 minutes early and the receptionist sent us to the rooftop bar. At the bar they didn’t know why we were there and after some commotion we were escorted back down to another bar elsewhere in the hotel, asked to take a seat and told that someone would come and take care of us. We waited for 15 minutes and no one arrived.

After it was clear we had been abandoned, I got up to talk to the waiter and was told that the movie was starting and we should go to the cinema right away. I asked about our brunch and prosecco. He said to ask about it after the movie, since otherwise we would miss it. I was quite concerned about this since we were quite hungry and thirsty at this point but we duly went down to the cinema and sat through the movie.

After the movie we were very hungry and looking forward to our food and drink. Again we talked to the receptionist and were told to go to the rooftop bar. We talked with the bartender, saying we were there for our brunch and prosecco. Unfortunately, we were told the chef had gone home and it was not possible to get any food. We were told we could still have a drink but at this point it was clear that the experience was irrecoverable and as we were very hungry we left.

We travelled an hour each way for this experience and it was extremely disappointing. We have attempted to get a refund but our emails have been ignored. Buyer beware.

Went to the cinema and cocktails experience here. Horrendous sound quality for the film itself, sounded like everybody was under water. Other people had same complaint when leaving the cinema.

Only 1 bar man was on to get the cocktails after (thankfully I was one of first at bar, but could see how long people were having to wait whilst I was having my drink.)

I did email the hotel to raise the concern around the sound quality but they haven't bothered to get back to me.
Terrible and unorganised. Staff were working very hard to deal with the madness caused due terrible planning.

Lovely hotel, clean and quiet even though its in a lively area. There's a valet who parks your car. Bathroom is huge, some of our party had never seen a bidet lol. Breakfast was lovely, buffet had a selection of hot and cold food and was tasty. We wanted a family room as our granddaughter was staying with us. But asking for the extra bed took up a lot of room in which was supposed to be a seating area. Should have looked more closely at the rooms and booked the suite that was made for extra beds. I'd recommend the hotel and stay again.

We booked an afternoon tea and arrived on time, we ushered into an empty bar where we waited to be seated for 20 minutes.

We were taken to a room where all the tables were dirty and eventually given a poor and limited choice of drinks. No decaffeinated Tea.!

Service poor and cakes and sandwiches average.

A total waste of time, I have now checked other reviews and found that at least their poor performance is consistent.

In all my years of London staycations I have never stayed somewhere so generous with the size of the rooms.

My partner booked a ‘standard’ room but I couldn’t believe how big the room was. It was the size of a suite with a mahoooosive bed, a gigantic tv with all the premium Sky sports channels, a huuuuge shower and space for a desk, coffee table, sofa, wardrobe, luggage storage, fridge, mini hallway from door to room inside room.

All the facilitates are amazing! We used the spa and had breakfast included. The also left a slice of chocolate cake in the room when we popped out.

Highly recommended over so many others. This is the new spot for us.
Superb clean and friendly 5 star hotel. Do not hesitate to book, the receptionist affair trikala and aurelie our stay so pleasant. I'll be back! ⚖️🥰
Thought the hotel was lovely and the staff were very friendly. Would definitely stay again!
Big room and very comfy beds. Location was great with bus stop right out the front. The gym and pool were an added bonus!

Just home from a really enjoyable stay at the Courthouse Hotel Shoreditch, excellent facilities, beds very comfortable, lovely breakfast, staff really helpful, especially Sarah, Millie, Emma,  Lucheria,, Brett, Nas, Tim and Andy

Had a great stay , spacious and comfortable room ,great facilities and staff couldn't have been more accommodating and went out of they're way to make my birthday a special one . Big thanks to sarah, Millie, Brett , nas and lucheria We will definatly be back.

Upon arrival the lobby was beautiful. Beautiful hotel. I am so glad that the owners have maintained the interiors and exteriors. The pool is beautiful. Service was great. If I could give more than 10 stars I would!
Great rooftop drinks and reception

We had an amazing time! The staff were friendly and approachable, particularly the lovely man that seated us for breakfast. The spa was lovely and relaxing, it wasn’t busy at all and features a steam room, sauna and pool which were all great. The room was lovely and clean, great amenities and the location was perfect - very good for visiting Shoreditch and the rest of London should you wish to. I would not be put off by some of the negative reviews! We loved it.
not even close to a 5 star hotel, ripp off
Excellent afternoon tea.
Went off for friends good service tucked away joints from the main road go again
Schlechtester Service den ich je in einem 5 Sterne Hotel erlebt habe. Defintiv nicht buchen.
reviews.textTranslated: Worst service I have ever experienced in a 5 star hotel. Definitely not booking.

reviews.text: Das Zimmer war nicht sauber, Flecken von etwas orange-gelbem mit Stückchen drin (vermutlich von Essen oder Übergebenem). Es war also nicht einmal staubgesaugt worden; dann wären zumindest die Stückchen weg gewesen. Als ich wieder auschecken wollte, hiess es seitens Manager, sie seien seitens Eigentümer nicht autorisiert aus egal welchen Gründen, die noch nicht begonnene Nacht wieder zu stornieren. Es würde einfach ein early Checkout belastet un d bezahlt werden müsste trotzdem.
reviews.textTranslated: The room was not clean, stains of something orange-yellow with bits in it (probably from food or vomit). So it hadn't even been vacuumed; then at least the pieces would have been gone. When I wanted to check out again, the manager said that they were not authorized by the owner for any reason to cancel the night that had not yet started. You would simply be charged for an early checkout and you would still have to pay.

reviews.text: A GLORIFIED PREMIER INN!! Shower over flowed everywhere, furniture is chipped and worn out, decor dated and really not worth thr money. Don't be fooled by the photos online and extras they offer.  Rude member off staff checked us out yesterday morning who really couldn't care less.

Worst hotel experience of my life. I was booked to this Hotel for a business trip. When I arrived the receptionist told me they did not receive any payment from the booking agency. I contacted the booking agency and was told they were trying to figure out things with the hotel and they were going to provide the payment method. However, when I told the receptionist this, I was interrupted by the hotel manager in a rude manner. He did not want to collaborate and was telling me it was my problem.
Eventually, I manage to do the check-in, but when I arrived at my room the hot water handler from the shower was missing and the water was boiling hot. I informed the hotel manager and he said they were going to send maintenance to my room. The next day I left for work and when I arrived back at the hotel the hot water handler was still missing and my room hadn't been clean. So neither maintenance nor cleaning staff went to my room.

similarHotelsNearby.name: Corinthia London
similarHotelsNearby.description: Luxury lodging with a pool & a spa

similarHotelsNearby.name: Urban Chic Serviced Apartments - Floral Street, Covent Garden

reviews.text: Amazing place!
Roubaram ou melhor furtaram uma bolsa no quarto do hotel e o hotel apenas respondeu pedindo desculpas! Simplesmente não vá a esse hotel
reviews.textTranslated: They stole or rather stole a bag from the hotel room and the hotel just responded by apologizing! Just don't go to this hotel

reviews.text: I mean come on , it's the iconic Savoy. A bucket list ticked of and simply wow. I've been waiting years for this and it was so enjoyable to do it with my wife. 22 years we've waited. Would I come back , he'll yes
Très belle endroit l'expérience était magique les prix est juste même si cela coûte environ 500£ par nuit
reviews.textTranslated: Very beautiful place the experience was magical the prices are fair even if it costs around £500 per night

reviews.text: Excellent place. Great Ambience and convenient location. Enjoyed my stay very much

I come back!!
My favorite Hotel in London!
Absolutely fantastic 👏

Was passing by to visit the place, my parents stayed there 20 years ago and somehow manage to meet the same doorman, it was a magical moment for them.

Obrigado, Senhor António

We went for afternoon tea, as a 60th birthday present bought for us by our children as a treat. We went dressed for the occasion, wife had nice dress and myself wore a suit and tie. absolutely amazed by people turning up in jeans and trainer's !
Food and waiter was absolutely amazing wow what a treat to have in London. But on leaving we were presented by a large bill from the waiter, we had a paid voucher which we gave to the front of house on arrival how really embarrassing for us in front of other guest we felt so small ! The restaurant manager quickly resolved the problem and apologised, but unfortunately spoiled the afternoon we were looking so forward to.
We wanted some help getting a taxi, but they were reluctant to assist.
besthotelexperience
Amazing afternoon tea and our waiter Mangesh was outstanding will be back again thank you

Incredible from start to finish! I was staying with my friend for her 40th birthday. What an amazing surprise on checking in to be told we were upgraded to the Savoy Suite! What a treat! The staff cannot do enough for you, and the extra touches are so appreciated, including Kaspar the cat and some Yorkshire Tea! Our butler was fantastic, and the whole weekend was like a dream! No wonder they are one of the best hotels in the world. Outstanding!
A very luxurious afternoon tea to celebrate a 40th birthday. Great service and more food than we could eat.

We went to savoy grill. The food was amazing. The staff were so helpful but be warned rd. £8.50 for 10 carrot slices and £23 for gin is very steep. Would recommend the food and experience but be warned there are hidden costs that you should be prepared for. Important question is would I go again
My answer is 100% yes
great room and excellent service throughout

Great luxurious hotel, lovely restaurants and bars. Staff are very friendly and helpful.
Great atmosphere and very cosy.
Didn't stay there only had afternoon tea but the atmosphere was lovely. Plenty to eat, cakes were amazing and sandwiches, were so tasty. Scones were lovely light and crumbly.
The restroom was even luxurious with lovely decor and lovely hand wash and hand cream.
Would definitely recommend it to anyone, I would definitely go back.
Location is brilliant right next to shops and near Charing cross station, on the Strand.

Fabulous weekend only spoilt by a couple of glitches which stopped me giving a full 5 out of 5…..but definitely rate a 4.8
Please experience The Gordon Ramsey 1890 Restaurant and the tasting experience, the rating is off the scale, really stupendous!
Wonderful time at the Savoy just a magiciacal experience 🍾
I tried very hard to find some thing to fault but failed abysmally!
Beautiful rooms, historic building, great restaurants, and amazing staff.

I would give the Savoy 7 stars if I could - nay, 10.  We stayed a week and it truly felt like home.  If my home were a five-star hotel.  The service is impeccable, the location unbeatable, and there is everything you could possibly want or need day or night, right there in the hotel.  It's a splurge - but do it!  You'll feel glamorous your whole stay.  My only complaint is our housekeeper left a lovely souvenir bookmark that my dog got the better of (after returning home).  I wish their website had a souvenir shop!  xoxoxo
Wow ! Amazing Hotel food is 10/10 definitely worth a visit.
Amazing attention to detail, extremely good experience, and a great once in a lifetime treat.
Cordial attentive staff, 3 Gordon Ramsey restaurants.

I always stay at the Savoy when in London. That is a lie. I wish I could stay at the Savoy in London. If I could I would stay somewhere cheaper and spend the money on beer or something fun. It looks great though, must be a nice way to spend money if you have it.

We had afternoon tea...the staff were kind enough to fit us in. We had the traditional afternoon tea with the special Savoy afternoon tea blend. The sandwiches and desserts were great and the service was excellent.
We went for tea, and it was a great experience! Almost a meal. Hotel and tea room very elegant.
I was actually working in the hotel down in the river room, so I can’t comment about the bedrooms, but certainly the staff were very helpful and attentive at all times

Went for afternoon tea.

We found the Menu somewhat confusing, but luckily our server was very helpful and friendly and recommended our chosen option.

We both had the £80 tea and for that you get sandwiches, scones and cakes plus tea.   What wasn't clear that was that it included extra servings of things that you may have particularly liked.  We did have a couple of extras but it wasn't clear that they would cost more money or not (they didn't).

On first arrival the piano was a bit loud, but when the room filled up the sound was absorbed more.

The total bill was £184 as service charge is added to the £80.   By any objective logic this is a somewhat crazy price for a few sandwiches and a few cakes.   But as an experience and it should be emphasised that experience counts for a great deal, then this should be considered as a great afternoon.
Beautiful experience with delicious cocktails in the American Bar
Uma experiência indescritível. Vale muito a pena conhecer.
reviews.textTranslated: An indescribable experience. It's very worth knowing.

reviews.text: Awesome amazing food and service. The experience was amazing!!
The Savoy is very nice, located in a great part of London.
Staff very warm and friendly and very efficient. We were guests at a wedding, and the venue and service throughout, was excellent
What an amazing experience.... afternoon tea was gorgeous. Staff were very professional  & knowledgeable.
If I could I would give 10 Star. You guys are so amazing . Wet enjoyed our stay and will be back soon.
I will never return again. The bed sheet wasn't even changed and the room wasn't clean

Savoy Grill, great experience, wonderful staff, made us feel truly welcomed.
Would go again.

absolutely incredible experience
from decoration, service provided, friendly staffs...
made my stay fabulous
Always a pleasure...

Perfect  location.great service
Luxurious  calm and just a nice place to relax.
Sehr gut geschultes und sehr freundliches und zuvorkommendes Personal.
reviews.textTranslated: Very well trained and very friendly and courteous staff.

reviews.text:
We dined at the Savoy Grill. The only negative was that it was too dark to read the menus that are thrust at you and several waiters try to take your order in quick succession.

Other, than that, it is an amazing experience with incredible food and amazing personal service. The Cote de boeff is amazing and the rum baba dessert will be flambéed at your table.

The American bar is indulgent and expensive, just why people go there!

Update. The River Restaurant is absolutely lovely. Friendly service and great food!

Heaven is a place on Earth.
Enjoy your visit and verify the experience by yourself.
Wow effect all the time!
Bis auf das Frühstück (nicht im River-Restaurant) alles perfekt.
reviews.textTranslated: Except for the breakfast (not in the river restaurant) everything was perfect.

reviews.text: Best wedding reception I've been was here.

The hotel and team our faultless. What can I say nothing is ever too much for the staff they go above and beyond everytime. Max at the front desk is always so welcoming and all the team. We look forward to are next visit to our home way from home. Thank you so much.

Of course expections were high we received a free upgrade to the chefs table experience as it was my brothers birthday,a quick tour through the kitchen first everyone stopped to say hello and into a private room where we could see the cooking taking place. The food was delicious I had the classic beef Wellington cooked to perfection and our waiter was checking on us throughout. The price of course was high but for a meal like no other at the infamous savoy it's worth it.

What a truly beautiful, elegant and iconic hotel. Sadly, I don't have any experience of their rooms or service as I was there for a meeting but it's truly stunning.
The staff I met were very pleasant and helpful.

Bel hôtel, la chambre était bien aménagée mais je m'attendais à ce qu'elle soit plus grande. Le personnel était très professionnel et très serviable. Toutefois, certaines choses ont besoin d'être améliorées :
- La chasse d'eau ne marchait pas correctement car il fallait l'actionner plusieurs fois à chaque fois que j'utilisais les toilettes.
- Le temps d'attente du room service était long car j'ai vraiment cru qu'on m'avait oublié. De plus, mon burger n'était pas 	assez chaud à son arrivée, et les frites étaient trop salées.
- La facture du room service présente des frais cachés que je n'ai pas forcément appréciés.
Malgré tout, le séjour s'est bien passé, et j'ai beaucoup apprécié le service de ménage du soir.
reviews.textTranslated:
Nice hotel, the room was well appointed but I expected it to be bigger. The staff were very professional and very helpful. However, some things need improvement:
- The toilet did not flush properly because it had to be flushed several times each time I used the toilet.
- The wait time for room service was long because I really thought I had been forgotten. Additionally, my burger wasn't hot enough when it arrived, and the fries were too salty.
- The room service bill contains hidden charges that I didn't necessarily appreciate.
Despite everything, the stay went well, and I really appreciated the evening cleaning service.

reviews.text: Was there for mums 91st birthday.
Schlechte Zimmer ist nicht die Reise wert
reviews.textTranslated: Bad room is not worth the trip

reviews.text: The Hotel Savoy exceeded our expectations in every way. I am a bit of a hotel snob, and was so happy that i did the research and booked a room there. The location is perfect, close to everything--yet pin drop quiet. The room was incredible. We were given an upgrade, without asking--and it was jaw droppingly beautiful. The food was seriously so good, it was one of our best meals in Italy. The service was outstanding. Everything about this hotel was perfect. I can't recommend this enough.
Good value location and luxury facilities.
Best place in London -unschlagbar! I would always want to come back to this one.
The best, luxurious hotel in Central London!
Everything is amazing with this hotel it deserves more than 5 stars 🌟

The Shangri-La at The Shard in London, staying in a room with an iconic view, offers a clear vista of the Tower Bridge and various important landmarks. The dinners and breakfasts provided by the TING restaurant are excellent. The front desk also offers service in fluent Chinese and English. Other Shangri-La hotels should consider this establishment's service standards as a worthwhile example to emulate.

At £1000 per night you'd think the staff would have been trained, but no, and that was in every department from housekeeping to reception, concierge, restaurant  and even finance where they overcharge and fail to credit despite all of the copious promises. And by the way who charges £20 for in room bottled water which every other decent hotel gives as complimentary? They think the view justifies lack of competency clearly, shame on the Shangri-La brand with a sterling reputation for excellence across Asia.
The pink afternoon tea was really lovely, and the view is spectacular. Definitely worth it, feels very special.

My husband and I spent 5 days here after several days being on a countryside road trip … from the first point of contact to the very last second.. we were so impressed with the level of service that was bestowed on us .. as well as all guests I am sure❤️ I would always make it a point to note staffs’ name when they gave me great services BUT HERE you cannot do that because the review will be filled with so many names.. every employee greets you and showed enthusiasm when in engagement! I was over the moon impressed with Ibrahim who upon noticing that my lighter went out of gas gifted me with his very own lighter😍 in between him attending to guests going up to the restaurants .. we enjoyed a delightful conversation.
Our room was magnificent,, the VIEW ALL AROUND including the bathroom .. OUT OF THIS WORLD MAGNIFICENT! This is the first hotel that we are asked when we would prefer to have our room cleaned .. WOW😍 there is a form you fill up to indicate your preferences on almost about anything associated with your room .. the human comfort factor was indeed a much thought process .. the heated toilet seats etc etc … there’s always fresh cookies or cakes in the room.. little things that matters really go a long way
Location is PERFECT … whatever mode of transportation, private or public… ITS HERE!!! So easy … LOVE LOVE LOVE and thank you for making our stay as one of our BEST EVER EXPERIENCE❤️  Oh! THE BINOCULARS IS AWESOME❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Nice

Easily one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in - be sure to book and check out the Sky Pool, it's a must!

The location isn't the best as it's a little far from the city centre, however there's a tubes station right next door for easy access to the city.

The Shangri La The Shard in central London is a real wow hotel to visit, really stunning views from the bar to the hotel rooms which are truly amazing, and certainly will be sending my clients here, fantastic hotel..

Helaas niet blijven overnachten in het hotel (staat wel zeker op de to-do voor de volgende keer) maar wel uitgebreid gaan dineren.
Locatie was fantastisch en zeker aan te raden om eens te bezoeken, echter vond ik het eten net wat onder verwachting.
Desondanks alles wel netjes verzorgd was heeft het niet volledig aan mijn verwachtingen voldaan.
reviews.textTranslated:
Unfortunately we did not stay overnight in the hotel (it is definitely on the to-do for next time) but we did have an extensive dinner.
Location was fantastic and definitely recommended to visit, but I thought the food was a bit below expectations.
Although everything was neatly taken care of, it did not fully meet my expectations.

reviews.text: Overall the experience was amazing. Hotel is very clean and tidy. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The views from the room/bars and pool are one of the best. My only downside would be the rooms need a little updating (apart from the bathroom). And if we wanted a top up on water it was a charge.

10/10. Stayed in one of the Iconic rooms and upgraded to a bathroom with a view. It did not disappoint. Yes the stay is pricey but it is so worth it. Service is fantastic, staff remembered us and asked us about our day and were happy to help with anything. We were able to use the facilities and I got a text after we used the pool to say our room was ready early and luggage already taken up. Cannot wait to go back!
Super location.
Incredible rooms with next level service not forgetting the spectacular views

We did not stay, but met a friend for drinks at reception. Everyone (employees) we came in contact with we're amazing! Beautiful place!! I was in awe. Only managed to get a picture of this beautiful rose on the reception table 😂
Beautiful skyscraper with the best views of London.

We had an afternoon tea via a virgin experience voucher. Good range of interesting cakes and sandwiches with a shard cake centrepiece. Great views. If you were paying for two, you’d get little change from £250!

Shangri-La The Shard is an absolute gem in the heart of London! From the moment I stepped into this luxurious haven, I was treated like royalty.

The view from The Shard is unparalleled, and this hotel takes full advantage of it. My room on the 41st floor offered breathtaking panoramic views of London, including iconic landmarks like the Tower Bridge and the Thames River. Watching the city come alive at night from the comfort of my room was truly magical.

The staff here is exceptional. They go above and beyond to make your stay unforgettable. Every request was met with a smile and prompt service. The attention to detail is impressive, making you feel like a VIP throughout your stay.

The rooms are spacious, elegantly designed, and equipped with all the modern amenities you could wish for. The comfortable beds provided a peaceful night's sleep, and the marble-clad bathrooms were a treat.

The hotel's location is also perfect for exploring London. You're within walking distance of many attractions and have easy access to public transportation.

In summary, Shangri-La The Shard is a true gem in London's hospitality scene. The combination of impeccable service, stunning views, and luxurious accommodations make it a 5-star experience that I would highly recommend to anyone visiting this Hotel.

We have been staying here starting September 13th and will check out on the 17th. Hotel is very clean and convenient. Staff is very courteous. I would acknowledge few people who helped us, Hasan in house keeping, Frendie at the gym who was very kind to assist with yoga mat and the highlight is Helga at the Ting restaurant. She has made our mornings so pleasant with great attitude, kindness and service of perfection

The service and location were incredible, and I highly recommend a stay here in a city view room, and visits to the pool, restaurant, and Gong. Simply wow, and had amazing staff who were genuinely attentive and wonderful. You could spent a week here and never get bored, even the rooms had binoculars to enjoy the incredible views.

Constructive criticism wise… the rooms obviously have amazing views, and we’re alright in terms of upkeep but you can tell it’s reaching over 10 years old. Guest services were not very responsive in the lead up to the stay, and there were a few issues during our stay, such as getting calls stating the do not disturb was on, so no cleaning would be done, when the DND wasn’t switched on, and small fixture issues. However, reception addressed these upon check out, and did not make a fuss when we removed the 5% room cleaning fee applied each day.
Aperitivo super panoramico..costoso ma vale assolutamente la pena
reviews.textTranslated: Super panoramic aperitif...expensive but absolutely worth it

reviews.text: Wonderful view!!! Great food and drinks

Enjoyed great weekend here
Beautiful
Absolutely awsome stay, it was everything we expected

Beautiful hotel. lovely modern rooms! The view is fantastic! panoramic view of london! The corner rooms are handy! 2 rooms next to each other so that you each have a room but still have the same entrance!
Simply stunning as you'd expect from a the Shangri-la hotel
A superb hotel to stay in while in London. Exceptional service, lavish rooms, and prime location. Highly recommended for anyone seeking luxury in the heart of the city.

Visited for a three course set menu which was a bit so-so experience. The food was just fine as the restaurant is more popular for the location and the view. The tofu was a bit of a let down. The main course portion was good enough; however, the starter was too small.
Great service and an amazing view.
The best hotel I've ever stayed in!

如果豪华高价格，与优质的服务和配套设施相匹配，是可以接受的，但是太出乎我意料和期待！我去过很多酒店，从来没有见到：香格里拉伦敦酒店给客人提供罐装水（一个瓶子反复用），如果你要原装水，就要10英镑一瓶。我亲眼看到打少卫生的人不戴手套，倒完垃圾桶就拿干净的浴巾，一块小脏毛巾擦很多地方，有一次给我送过来旧拖鞋（因为新拖鞋是捆绑在一起，很难打开，她给我的是3只，不是2双）。房间门的底部油漆涂料裂开卷起，感觉即将走进一个仓库，房间窄小！住一天$1200-$1300不包括早餐，很有名的下午茶：全都是高糖、巧克力，而且就几样，没有什么特别的！我住的房间可以看到伦敦的整个夜景，很漂亮！这一点是点赞👍！但是我要大家一定要小心，当酒店发信息问房间升级，一定要小心谨慎，我就是受害者！

I wrote a comment a few days ago. It was my personal experience. I don't know why it was removed.
If the luxury and high price matches the service and supporting facilities, it is acceptable.    but it is beyond my expectations! I have been to many hotels and have never seen it: Shangri-La London Hotel provides canned water (a bottle is used repeatedly). If you want original water, it costs 10 pounds a bottle. I saw with my own eyes that people who are less hygienic don't wear gloves. After pouring the trash can, they take clean bath towels and wipe a lot of places with a small dirty towel.

Once she gave me old slippers, because the new slippers were tied together, and she didn't give me a pair.

The paint at the bottom of the door of the room is rolled up. It is in disrepair for a long time. It feels like it is about to enter a warehouse.

Pay $1200—$1300 a day, not including breakfast.

Online introduction: exquisite flower baskets, romantic, famous afternoon tea: all high-sugar and chocolate snacks, and there are only a few varieties, nothing special。
but the price is very expensive.

my room have the view of the Tower of London and tower bridge. Only the night view is still good.

It's not that the price is high. The service quality and guest rooms of the hotel must be good.

There are many luxury hotels in London. I want to choose hotels with high prices and high quality. I hope it can help everyone.

Remind everyone: When the hotel sends a message to ask you to upgrade your room, you must be careful to avoid being deceived.！I am the victim ！！
There are also two excellent managers who deserve praise.： Jasmine and  stefan mueller,They work hard to help the guests solve problems. Thank them for their help.
