reviews.text: Breath taken

Great location. Really good rooms! Fantastic view out of the room if you book the right one. Unfortunately very bad service. Poorly trained staff. Some things are just funny (e.g. we got a birthday cake delivered to our room but no one of our family had birthday or ordered a cake) others are just unprofessional (e.g. housekeeping doesn’t care to knock or ring a bell but just opens the door and somehow is surprised that guests are already in the room). Management doesn’t seem to care. It is a pity. Other Shangri-La Hotels deliver the whole package. This one does not.
Beautiful view, will come back when better weather

Experience was very much in line with what you would expect from a Shangri-la hotel. Location in the Shard Tower definitely comes as an added bonus providing spectacular views on London. Room was nicely furnished, well-equipped and clean. Staff was attentive and accommodating. Loved the Pool/Sauna facilities with a view on St Paul’s. Good breakfast buffet that may need some improvement on the Asian food on offer.
The must try hotel. Best view ever.

Everything was just great from the beginning to the end:view, service, top!
Many thanks to our waiter, SYED, in the ting restaurant, it was great experience!
Wonderful experience! Had a lovely dinner at Ting; the service was exceptionally great.
Amazing views
Didn't stay in the hotel. Only visited the restaurant.

Lyxhotell med mycket trevliga rum och enastående utsikt. Fantastisk frukost med både buffet och möjlighet till a la carte beställning. Baren på toppen är underbar för en kvällsdrink. Poolen och bastun är fin med trevlig utsikt. Servicenivån är ok, men inte på nivå med andra Shangri-La i asien.
reviews.textTranslated: Luxury hotel with very nice rooms and an outstanding view. Fantastic breakfast with both a buffet and the option to order a la carte. The bar at the top is wonderful for an evening drink. The pool and sauna are nice with a nice view. The level of service is ok, but not at the level of other Shangri-La in Asia.

reviews.text: Ein sehr modernes und schönes Hotel mit gigantischem Ausblick und unvergessliche Badewanne :-)!  Personal ist super nett. Danke an Silvia💜!
reviews.textTranslated: A very modern and beautiful hotel with a gigantic view and an unforgettable bathtub :-)! Staff is super nice. Thanks to Silvia💜!

reviews.text: A must stay location. We had such a lovely time and the General Manager went above and beyond to help us during our visit.
景色優美 服務親切 居高臨下俯看周圍風景
reviews.textTranslated: Beautiful scenery, friendly service, condescending overlooking the surrounding scenery

reviews.text: My family and I were very excited to come to the Shangri-La in London to celebrate a birthday and graduation. We were supposed to go to Gong as we wanted to enjoy the views, but due to an unforeseen circumstance we were not able to go up. We had to discuss with the staff who were very stringent and not welcoming. We waited in the lobby for far too long until we went to their restaurant called "Ting" as a result. Honestly, did not have a good experience here. Yes the view was wonderful, but the feeling being there was not the greatest. There was nobody serving us for at least a solid 12 minutes. We waited a long time to simply get water. The drinks we had were not to the high-level we were expecting and ordinarily experience at the Shangri-La. We ordered some glasses of wine and the waiter seemed very inexperienced. He did not know of the wines we wanted and we had to point out the specific ones on the menu. We visit this hotel in many countries and this one particularly did not live up to the Shangri-La experience. It was surprising because we expected that in London of all places, this hotel would be of high calibre. My family is not happy about this experience.

Very, very much enjoyed our stay here some time ago. Amazing view, impeccable service and overall a great experience. Definitely recommend the afternoon tea, which was halal, and the restaurant also had halal options.

The room was amazingly luxurious and had everything you could have wished for. A must experience when you visit London.
What you would expect from a 5 star hotel
We thoroughly enjoyed our week stay with you. The views from our suite were incredible! Highly recommend the room service breakfast. Swimming pool, amazing views, and cocktails were our highlights.
The best views in London. Great breakfast and room service was excellent.

Had a few drinks there. Excellent location, staff are friendly and welcoming. Outside seating area is comfortable, as well as the inside seating area.  There are decent selection of choices. Prices are reasonable.
Enjoyed my stay

This hotel is definitely one of the best 5-star hotel I've ever stayed at.  The rooms are very spacious, the service was excellent, and the view and the amenities are just great.  For example, upon casually mentioning that we were here to celebrate my son's birthday at the front desk, we found two birthday gifts waiting for us in the room the following day when we returned from sightseeing.  Our two young kids also loved the pool, which has the kids hours, and my husband enjoyed the nice sauna at the hotel.  On top of that, the location is super convenient as it is right next to the train station and also a short walking distance to the Borough Market, where we visit almost every day.  We hope to be back there soon!
Amazing location and view from the restaurant
Service staff and food all superb, awesome staff, tea is not good for me as i am an Indian but coffee was good.

On the 1st of May, I checked into the hotel for 2 nights with my 2yo and 8 months old. At 21:15 someone, who clearly was a member of the staff as they had a key, entered my room without knocking. Not only was I in my underwear but my 8 months old baby was sleeping in her cot which was directly in front of the door. The door slammed against her bed as this individu walked in, waking up my baby screaming which I took an hour and a half putting to sleep. Being by myself with 2 under 3, the whole scenario was very disturbing.

This was unacceptable and extremely worrying. Never have I stayed in a hotel of this standard, got a suite costing thousands a night and had staff entering the room without knocking, at 21:15 at night.

I immediately emailed and called the hotel. Spoke to someone extremely condescending which told me with a patronising tone that « they were looking into it » and cutting it short with an « alright! Have a good night! »
Following the incident, I also received a response to my email. Simply justifying that the person who entered my room was « a security member who got it wrong » and they would offer me breakfast as a compensation. A breakfast which honestly was unnecessary as my babies do not eat it and my husband was not here. Poor compensation for such a prestigious hotel.

The next day, my husband went straight to speak to reception. Following his conversation with a member of the staff, we were moved to another room.

If it wasn’t for my husband, nothing would have been done and this wouldn’t have been taken seriously. Which is really alarming.

I am more upset and shocked by the response I received when I called shortly after the incident than the incident itself (because although it was really uncomfortable to have someone walked in the room, it was apparently the member of staff’s first week and mistakes happen).

But the response I received, however, was completely out of order and dismissive. And offering a breakfast (for 1 person) was insulting.

Shangri-La The Shard: Where Elegance Reaches New Heights

Farewell, skyscrapers of business and hello, Shangri-La The Shard—the pinnacle of luxury and a haven for those who dare to dream big. As I bid adieu to this bustling city, let me share the tale of my stay at this architectural marvel, where sophistication and breathtaking views go hand in hand.

Shangri-La The Shard, a sanctuary in the clouds where elegance takes on new heights. From the moment you step into the sleek elevator, you're whisked away to a world where luxury knows no bounds. It's like entering a realm where every detail is meticulously designed to impress, leaving you in awe of the sheer magnificence that surrounds you.

Let's talk about the accommodations, darling. The rooms at Shangri-La The Shard are an exquisite blend of modernity and comfort. From the floor-to-ceiling windows that offer panoramic vistas of the city below to the plush furnishings that embrace you like a gentle hug, every element exudes an air of refinement. It's like living in a contemporary masterpiece, where tranquility and indulgence intertwine effortlessly. And oh, the views! They're like postcards come to life, reminding you that the world is yours to conquer.

But wait, there's more! The hotel's amenities are a feast for the senses. Savor a culinary journey at the restaurant, where flavors dance on your palate and gastronomic delights await. Unwind in the lavish spa, where skilled hands transport you to a realm of blissful relaxation. And for those seeking an elevated experience, the sky-high bar offers a dazzling escape, where cocktails are served with a side of jaw-dropping vistas.

Now, let's talk about the service at Shangri-La The Shard—a performance worthy of a standing ovation. The staff members are the true stars of the show, seamlessly blending grace, professionalism, and a sprinkle of British charm. They anticipate your every need with an impeccable precision that would make even James Bond envious. It's like being treated like royalty in a kingdom of luxury.

In conclusion, Shangri-La The Shard is a destination that takes luxury to new heights, offering an experience that is as unforgettable as the views from its lofty perch. It's a place where elegance and sophistication reign supreme, leaving you with memories that soar above the ordinary. So, as I bid farewell to this haven in the sky, I carry with me the memories of a stay at Shangri-La The Shard—a chapter in my travel story that sparkles with wit, elegance, and a touch of adventure.

Paar dagen verbleven hier, 1 van de beste hotels waar ik ooit ben verbleven.
Qua uitzicht en gastvrijheid
reviews.textTranslated:
Stayed here for a few days, one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at.
In terms of view and hospitality

Club Quarters Hotel Trafalgar Square, London

reviews.text: Great location, friendly and attentive staff and the rooms were clean and well stocked. We notified the staff we were in town for a birthday and they went above and beyond to make my son feel special.
Absolutely lovely hotel. Excellent location, rooms are a great size, well maintained and beautiful. The stand out was the excellent service throughout the hotel - really made my stay!

Why can’t all full service Marriotts be like this one.  Yes, I paid for a great hotel and I got one!  Beautiful rooms, excellent staff, great bellman and bar staff. Never did we walk past an employee in the hall without being greeted.  Rooms are clean, newly remodeled and large. So tired of US Marriotts playing the price game.  The service has disappeared.  The road to COVID government mandated lockdowns is training.  Marriott this could be your model.

This has been one of my best hotel stays ever … staff was perfect .. hotel room perfect.. facilities perfect ..location ideal for exploring London … pool was huge and clean .. they had activities for my son where he got a really nice gift for doing a scavenger hunt mystery on the ground floor .. the room was super quiet.. furnishing stylish and comfortable… Will definitely stay again

My room is beside the  Westminster Suite and facing the Eye of London & Thames River.

I'm from Malaysia and not familiar with the English Breakfast menu and one of the stewardess briefs on the menu very well...

I'm just hoping their bellboy will be more respectful & welcoming guest with a full smile...
他们都是笑脸相迎！他们精心为我们准备了冰镇香槟精美甜品：）满意
reviews.textTranslated: They are all smiling! They carefully prepared ice-cold champagne and exquisite desserts for us:) Satisfied

reviews.text: We loved our stay on 9/10/23. The hotel has the best location; next to the London Eye and Big Ben. Exceptional service from Evad when we checked in. We also appreciate the service from Diana when she greeted us in the lobby and Barry, the bellman. Send our hellos to them if you can. We would love to stay here again someday!

We had an overall fantastic experience at this hotel. The location is great for folks that want to have access to the common hot spots as it's right next to the London Eye and across the bridge from Big Ben. But even better is that there is a bus station in front of the hotel and down the street is a major metro station so getting to the and from most areas was simple.

The staff was very friendly and welcoming and I thoroughly appreciated how they constantly greeted us with a smile and good morning/afternoon/evening.

We had a room that had a beautiful view of the river, London Eye, and the adjacent garden. Normally I would've been a little weary of a room that faced such a busting area but between the dual double-paned windows and the blackout drapes, we didn't hear any noise or see any lights when everything was closed/down. The bed was comfortable and was perfect for helping us fight jet lag, I fell asleep almost instantly after a long day of traveling and exploring the city. Everything in the room was clean and well kept; the toiletries were high end and you have access to the higher quality amenities such as robes, slippers, and a scale.

The club lounge was nice and served breakfast, happy hour, and snacks at certain points throughout the day which was lovely.
Gym is on the smaller side but was able to get the job done. There's also a indoor lap pool which is great for families or getting a good swim in.

The only two gripes we had were:
1) It took an hour for the bellmen to bring up our suitcases from so we unfortunately missed a dinner reservation because we couldn't change clothes
2) The hotel is very large, and there's only one set of elevators on one side of the building, so if you have a room on the opposite side of the hotel (like we did) you'll have a decently long walk just to get to the elevators to exit the hotel. A set of stairs an alternate entrance to the hotel on the side opposite the elevators would be a great addition if that is at all possible down the line.

Otherwise, I would certainly come back to this property and I look forward to doing so during my next trip to London.
I'm too poor ;(
My favourite hotel to stay while visit London the location is the best. The rooms very quite and fresh amazing views to the Big Ben and London eye

Just returned from our stay here and were completely blown away - everything was absolutely perfect!

The check-in experience is lovely, with a glass of prosecco and lovely staff, it sets the tone right away! Leena checked me in and was so kind, friendly and made us feel so special!

Our room was beautiful with an incredible view and a lovely welcome message for us celebrating our wedding. Within minutes of arriving in our room we were called to check it was ok and our bags were delivered - great service.

The hotel dealt with a serious food allergy absolutely perfectly, which we haven't seen before and it really helped us relax and enjoy our stay.

Turn down service was lovely, the room was really looked after and we got a stunning gift - thank you so much.

Breakfast was delicious and had so much choice.

For me the best thing about the hotel is the service, all staff members are kind, friendly, helpful and actually seem genuinely happy to be working there.

This is the best hotel experience i've had in a long time and we'll definitely be back - Thanks Leena for the unforgettable memories!
Great private GYM. Offers discount membership to local residents. Swimming pool  is full length.
Attended a half day conference. Everything was as you would expect from a five star hotel
Had an extremely pleasant stay. Very comfortable and always at your service

Inconvenient layout. Lounge is down the stairs in the basement. Rooms are meh. Bathroom light switch is outside the bathroom wall. TVs suck and can’t stream anything other than YouTube. Room service is super confusing but then you have to go to lobby to pick up door dash. Ice machines not on every floor. Prob wouldn’t stay here again.
Amazing location, a retreat from the masses in a sea of tranquility

Beautiful hotel and great location but. Or for the business traveler.
Very noisy due to extensive remodeling the previous fitness into rooms.
Besides as they are dismantling the previous fantastic fitness they are only offering a basic gym similar to Courtyard hotels; quite disappointed as they don’t even offer day passes for oval gym to offset

Excellent location & great service !!!
Close to:
Buckingham Palace
Westminster Palace
Big Ben
Westminster Abby Church
London Eye
And StarBucks 😂
Great value for money in an excellent location. The family room was relaxing and confortable, and the team at the reception was very helpful.

Incredible Marriott with Incredible Location

Marriott knows my dog is a licensed credentialed certified Service Dog for disabilities.

Low Points:
Thanks for a wonderful stay thanks to Phillip and Andrea.
“Charlie" at Security Saturday night blocked our entrance for 30 seconds with his hands across his hips saying “you’re not a guest here” (not asking first), as we arrived soaking wet in the rain from our long walk home, defiantly claiming “no dogs allowed in here.” Attendants in the M Lounge consistently telling me “but you’re not on the list” even though my key card allowed me access which Andrea consistently verified. The restaurant steakhouse told me they could not accommodate vegetarians easily. The very tall dark skinned gentleman who lurked around us every time we passed through the lobby as if waiting to throw us out (hotel security not knowing of service dog policy?). Amrie and my first check-in attempt asked me to pay my rooms but did NOT charge me for the additional night I added, making me have to go to front desk again and re-pay 7 hours later. Valentyna as one of the three trying to check me in 7 hours later tried upselling me both lounge access and breakfast included, repeating that I had neither despite the fact that Philip arranged something different with me earlier. She then insisted that “this would be for a coffee whilst you waited, not for your entire stay,” which was not true.

The hotel is so wonderful one just expects turn down service yet there is none...perhaps in the suites only?

The plastic artificial obvious grass in front of the front main spectacular entrance is just a shame and it lowers the quality of the property; even cement nicely shined would be nicer than investments in plastic these days.

High Points: My stay was wonderful because of Philip at the Front Desk and Andrea in the Lounge. Ample universal, international plugs by the bed except for USB-C. Tea kettles in rooms with real milk are a plus.

Unique Points:
Philip at the front desk should be a Front Desk Office Manager, not “just a front desk clerk.” I’m sure he’ll be promoted soon. He remembered my name, offered prosecco, gave me a tour, consistently checked on my stay, and welcomed me to contact him for future reservations (see below). I would come to stay at this property only and because he would look after my booking personally.

Every time you pass by after check in the front desk, you can have access to a glass of free-flowing bubbles champagne and water which is a REASON TO STAY HERE JUST BECAUSE OF THIS! ALWAYS WITH A SMILE WITH HELPFUL FEMALE STAFF AS LIASONS between waiting and the front desk as well. Incredible system.

Stunning views on Thames with one of the few last left grand dame hotels that's affordable is unique; and access to TWO bridges and the London Eye is incredible.

The M Lounge has breathtaking views. The Library version of M Lounge for breakfast is wonderful, and we had Jay on a "good day" and a day where he was "off," which we're all allowed.

When we finally got to the lounge for a snack that first evening, and finally had to prove myself deserving to be there, Andrea came over with champagne and said “we’re really glad you’re here staying with us.” That—and Philip’s welcome and the card I received from the hotel manager Meri K-- was the only single time we actually felt the spirit of hospitality of welcoming. At all other times it seemed we had to prove ourselves and my disability to be welcomed in this property. Not all disabilities are obvious, and staff must know this. Marriott knows my disability and has on record all of Biskits Guide Dogs International cards, which I’m happy to show any time I check in.

I want to return to the property for the quality of my room, for its location and view, and for the genuine care and concern I felt from Philip exclusively at your property from all hotel staff.
Hammer Ausblick. Beste Lage.
reviews.textTranslated: Great view. Best location.

reviews.text: No service to speak off! A staff forced into my room without asking or knocking, I yelled after I heard noises but she came in still. Complained to the front desk, a lady said would contact me after looking into it. Nothing happened days later. Called again the first person said they have my email wrong, blatant lie because they sent me an email on that day. The second person asked me why she came in if I refused. Good question, I wonder too. This is the view I got for King Room with River View which was blocked by machinery of the London eye. So think twice if this is what you want out of staying at a hotel. Totally outrageous.

Exactly what I was looking for during our brief vacation stay. The service was top notch starting with whisking our suitcases away while we sipped sparkling wine or water as we waited to officially check in. This is not your typical Marriott experience. You can stay in less expensive places, certainly, but for the price this is actually a great value. The rooms are beautiful, We requested a Thames River view, and we were treated to a view of Big Ben and Parliament as well. The London eye could be seen from the window as well and is an easy walking distance for a great photo taking experience. The food in the hotel restaurant was delicious although not included in the price for our stay. Still the dining experience, including the beautifully delivered room service, was worth the cost. Room service was so lovely I preferred it to the restaurant after a long day of site seeing. Americans will appreciate both tea and delicious coffee available in the room. This hotel is a rest up haven!

Shout out to Mohammad for his help when checking in, Phillip for patiently answering all our questions including those about currency exchange, and all of the staff that helps to make entering and leaving with baggage absolutely seamless!
Big and clean room, reception employees are friendly . The location is perfect. It’s beautiful and comfortable hotel. The breakfast is also good. I had wonderful experience there.
Excellent Hotel in the prime location, great view to london eye and Big Ben from the room!! Its like a dream place. The best service and good restaurants!! Really enjoyed!!
Thank you for the warm welcome

We came here for a weekend getaway. This hotel feels like a hotel of long corridors. The lobby is small and overall it lacks atmosphere. Check-in was slow but service was good. Where the service let us down entirely was room service and Gilroys.

Room service was cold and zero condiments were brought with our food. We ordered hot milk with our coffee and it did not arrive, when it finally did our coffee was cold. The room service menu is limited and not what you expect from a 5-star hotel. Cheap junk food.

Dining in Gilroys although the food was nice the service was extremely slow. Painful really, 35 minutes to get drinks. And after 15 minutes we reminded them and still it took so long. While the waiters are polite and friendly efficiency in service in lacking. Really not what you expect from a 5-star. The Marriott Edition is far superior although does not boast the same location it's worth the 5 star tag.
Perfect location that makes walking to many sites possible. There are great restaurants in the area and many Pubs to explore. I can't wait to return.
I have stayed at Marriott hotels for more than 2,600 nights, and I have life time titanium status with Marriott.  This location provided me with HORRIBLE service and there employees are RUDE.
Loved our stay. Location is great.

Thank you for the warm welcome, Yuri! We truly enjoyed our brief visit to the hotel! We were just exploring the hotel, when we walked past the Aquarium, and he was the first person to approach my family of 4 when we entered the hotel! He offered us complimentary waters, and local recommendations for dinner, Locale, an Italian restaurant less than 5min walk away! The hotel itself is beautifully grand and splendorous, in a warm and welcoming way!  After experiencing such a friendly service, we will definitely be back on our next trip to London! :)

An amazing hotel! Every single member of the staff was extremely friendly, helpful and professional. They went above and beyond to make our stay fantastic. Perfect location. We will only stay here for future trips to London. The restaurant inside the hotel is also very nice and the food is delicious.
Very good location.

Absolutely one of the grandest hotel I stayed in London (I didn’t stay that many though). Very elegant and yet stylish. Staff were all friendly, helpful and professional. The room is spacious, clean and comfortable!! Plus the front roll seats of the river is just unbeatable (if you get one which I didn’t…). Fully enjoyed my stay here and highly recommended to give it a try.
Customer service is top notch, hotel really cares about you here.

Hotel/staff  very much exceeded my expectations!!! My wife treated me to birthday/coronation celebration in London! We were blown away by the sincere hospitality, excellent food and the hotel itself was iconic! Ideally located at the heart of everything!
My disabled partner and I were discriminated at the lobby by the concierge staff.

Great experience. We didn't have a room with a view, but they do offer them at an up charge. And what a view it will be... Service great. Rooms are spacious, clean, and nicely decorated... wish we could have spent more time here...

This may be the best hotel at which I’ve ever stayed. It’s central to everything yet so quiet inside. The restaurant food is delicious! The customer service is outstanding. It’s also perfect if you’re in town to run the London Marathon because you can walk there from the finish line

We had a fantastic time here! Our suite was large and stunning, and we had the perfect view of Big Ben, Parliament, and Westminster Bridge. Westminster Abby is right there as well and Buckingham Palace is a short walk. If you want to be in the heart of the historic sites but still have a quiet, sophisticated hotel, this is a wonderful place to choose.

We are grateful for the excellent service as well; Eyad at the front desk was amazing. We checked in the day before Easter, and he had a wonderful Easter basket for our son, and when we got to our room there was another surprise basket full of goodies for him too! Eyad took excellent care of us throughout our stay and made our stay there all the more delightful.

So wonderful to be back at the London Marriott County Hall hotel.

This is such an amazing hotel from the minute you walk in the door. Every interaction with every staff member, from reception to breakfast to the Executive Lounge. Was first class.

The rooms are beautiful, spacious and well thought out. The daily house cleaning service was Immaculate.

The incredible staff. In the library for breakfast each day, Jay and Felicia were simply exceptional. i will miss this hotel and hope to be back here again one day

Die Lage des Hotels - direkt am London Eye und gegenüber vom Big Ben - ist unschlagbar. Wir wurden beim Check-In außerdem besonders überrascht und haben ein Update auf die einzigartige und wesentliche teurere Westminster Suite erhalten. Eine wirklich sehr großzügige Suite mit 2 Badezimmern, Esstisch für bis zu 10 Personen mit VIP-Blick auf Big Ben. Für uns war das eine besondere Erfahrung und auch das ältere Gebäude mit Geschichte hat Charme. Kids hatten im Pool (fast schon kleines Schwimmbad) viel Spaß.  Kurz und knapp: TOP!
reviews.textTranslated: The location of the hotel - right on the London Eye and opposite Big Ben - is unbeatable. We were also particularly surprised at check-in and received an update to the unique and significantly more expensive Westminster Suite. A really very spacious suite with 2 bathrooms, dining table for up to 10 people with a VIP view of Big Ben. It was a special experience for us and the older building with history also has charm. Kids had a lot of fun in the pool (almost a small swimming pool). In short: TOP!

reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel, primarily for the location, service, and value! If you're looking for the best Marriott in London, this is easily it. While the Westminster/London Eye area is very crowded, we still found the location to be perfect; it was unbelievably special to be able to see Big Ben out the window throughout our entire trip, rather than feeling like we needed to go out of our way to see it once or twice. There are bus stops right outside the hotel, as well as two tube stops: Westminster across the bridge, then Waterloo a block or so away toward the Eye. The hotel has trustworthy connections with taxi drivers, so we let them arrange taxis for us on nice nights out. We walked most places, though! The room itself was very comfortable, much larger than European hotel rooms in my experience, but the view of Big Ben and the river was spectacular. There are two sturdy umbrellas in the room, which was great, but the bellmen also offered us umbrellas when it looked like we needed them. We ordered room service from Gillray's twice, which was great both times, but we also had a delivery of a birthday cake, flowers, champagne, and a card, which was beautifully presented...they did an outstanding job and were right on time. As far as hotel amenities go, the gym was surprisingly large, the restaurants were good (better to eat out), and the M Club Lounge was outstanding! The service was one of the most memorable aspects of the hotel. A young woman in the lobby each day was so kind, even offering to take trash from our hands and dispose of it for us. All of the bellmen were great - they were friendly, took great photos for us, arranged taxis for us, and more. We spoke to a local who said that he and his wife come stay there each Christmas to enjoy the city - I thought it was great to hear that a local also finds this hotel to be great! One thing to keep in mind throughout your trip is safety: the entrance to the hotel is off the beaten track, which is nice for security, but be careful when crossing Westminster Bridge as there are con artists and pick pockets there regularly. Let the hotel arrange taxis for you, so you know they're safe! Thank you to the staff of this hotel for an incredible experience!

Weekend break, hotel is right beside Westminster Bridge. Great views. Lots to do nearby. Fab breakfast. Nice bar inside the hotel but £36 for 2 G&Ts was extortionate, even if they do bring your drinks to you.
The London Marriott County Hall is the historical county hall at Westminster Bridge on the Thames. An amazing property with two lounges, a restaurant, and bar. Fantastic service!

What a beautiful hotel! The staff were wonderful! There was a young women who was training and when we arrived she offered us a glass of Persecco  she was so nice! The room was so clean and spacious, the housekeeping staff where awesome! The breakfasts were Devine and so fresh the staff at Gilroy’s Steakhouse in the morning were so pleasant and helpful. The London Marriott courthouse Hotel is a must visit!!

Très belle expérience dans cette hôtel 5 étoiles !
Le personnel est au petit soin.
Une coupe de champagne nous a été proposée à notre arrivée.
Surclassement dans une chambre avec vue sur la Tamise, Big Ben et London Eye.
Les enfants ont même eu droit à un petit Teddy Bear au nom de l’hôtel.
Nous reviendrons lors de notre prochain passage à Londres.
reviews.textTranslated:
Very nice experience in this 5-star hotel!
The staff takes great care.
We were offered a glass of champagne upon our arrival.
Upgrade to a room with views of the River Thames, Big Ben and London Eye.
The children were even treated to a little Teddy Bear in the name of the hotel.
We will come back on our next visit to London.

reviews.text: Fantastic location, very clean and great service from staff.  Highly recommend having breakfast at The Library (M Club).

First I really want to pay appreciation for the front desk team
and reservation team.

Mar 01 around 14:30, my wife had to check in alone,
and the two male staffs at the front desk was so kind and
helpful. Due to sudden work issue I couldn't join  so my
wife had to visit alone, I did inform this to the front desk
and they were so willing to help... what really impressed me
wad they really had good intention to help. All the front desk
team was so professional and helpful

Also Ms. Leah who sincerely replied to my reservation request,
I thank you so much too

Great size room , decor modern .
Family room could use double sink .
Check in staff very bubbly and friendly
Noise of banging doors and air conditioning was a put off. They did check the air con but stated noise was normal .
Slept with it off , room got too hot .
Lovely view over the Thames and London eye .
Room service request  - difficulty communication .
Room far from lift, not certain if they have rooms for mobility issues .
Area fabulous , 10min away from Waterloo station .
Would stay again
Great location for New Year’s Eve!  Rooms overlooking Big Ben, in the London Eye are very nice. Staff can’t do enough for you & the location is perfect. The pool is an extra bonus.

We were upgraded to a beautiful room facing Big Ben and the London Eye. The room was spotless clean and well designed with Molton Brown amenities. The service at the reception and M lounge were all friendly and professional, especially Sandra and the Italian waitress at the lounge. However, the breakfast was a letdown. It’s too stingy not being able to choose more than one item from cold dishes, considering the portion of English Breakfast was small. Why I had to choose between a croissant or bread?

Great hotel in an historical building, great location, nice and friendly staff.

It's a large hotel with long corridors. Expect alot of walking if your room ends up at either opposite ends of these corridors.
Fantastic! That is all!

Years of staying at this hotel and watching Marriott strip amenities away while increasing nightly prices have left me with a sour taste in my mouth.  I've paid top prices to stay but now it's only for the location.

No mini bar, room service (in room dining) is completely gone unless you want to eat in a McDonald's type box and pay a huge fee just for the convenience. The pool may be going away,  the gym is being down sized (rumors),  the only thing left is the Library and Gilrays, without them would be no better than a Courtyard by Marriott.. (the Executive Lounge isn't too bad, used to be better) who wants to pay very high rates for a night of Courtyard type amenities.

Let's talk about staff.. the bar and restaurant staff are incredible. The concierge (gone as well), the door staff are amazing,  but the hotel staff (all temps) are completely clueless. I've been staying here for so many years and I just am sick at how bad it is. I used to think having a high tier in Marriott meant something.  I guess that's only back in the States now.

I never thought I would say this about my favorite Hotel in London.

The only reason the hotel won't change, is people are still paying for the location. One day it will stop. Marriott County Hall will probably never return to its formal glory, as an exec expecting the amenities I pay for I feel cheated.  It's a shame, it once was incredible.. not going to deny the rooms and scenery are incredible, access to the city is excellent. But when you've been staying as long as I have here for business and pleasure you notice the other things.

From check-in to check out can't fault it.
Special shout out to Adam at Reception.

Valentine 2023, great and spacious room wit great view of Big Ben and Parliament. Florentina and Andrea are truly best hosts. I feel better than at home - I don't think there is a better compliment! I can only recommend this place to everyone visiting London.

Absolutely the most incredible hotel, service and employees.  I had the misfortune of falling and required emergency surgery shortly after arriving in London.  Since we were already staying at this hotel, I used it as my base for my recovery time.  The staff was amazing, Jasmine even found me a physical therapist to come to the hotel to work with me.  Barry, and Sabi took us under their care, and they handled ever situation that came up during my stay. Taxis were there and ready anytime we needed them.  I couldn’t think of anything that they missed.  I look forward to going back there when I can do some touring and not just staying in a beautiful room.  Absolutely loved the pictures on the walls.  If you’ve stayed there, you know what I mean.  Kudos to this hotel and their outdated staff!
Amazing place to stay. All the stuff was nice and helpful, but Andrea from MClub is a true, shining diamond! :)
Majestic. classic and well maintained. The River view room was an absolute perfect spot to watch the fireworks and had a great view of Big Ben and parliament.

Great stay and the feeling that from the very moment you entered the hotel you felt a family atmosphere.

Thanks to Nithan and Michael for their help during the night many times! You are amazing guys!

Will definitely be back here again.

Our stay did not start well. A few problems with the room and especially with the view made us not fully satisfied.

The time of arrival and being greeted by the reception itself was not the best time for us, but we understood - Christmas time is not the easiest time for the reception.

Apart from the very beginning, we would like to thank Pauline, who approached our problem very professionally and very friendly, and after a while we received a great room and our stay began to look even more than great.

A pleasant surprise was the fact that we found a Polish-speaking receptionist who helped us find the perfect place for a family dinner, as well as helped us plan a day with many attractions that we had no idea about, and because my wife is Polish, it was a great help for us .

I hope that the huge amount of our suitcases, which you helped us with at the end, did not tire you out and this small tip together with our wishes made this Christmas time nicer for you. Thank you Michael.

Coming back to the hotel itself - the rooms have an amazing view, the beds are very comfortable, it's very quiet and the place is very child friendly, because ours were very happy.

We have very fond memories of the time spent in your hotel and hope that we will be able to visit you again sometime.

I highly recommend!

An ideal hotel for couples and families with children.

Thank you all for making our Christmas so wonderful.

Best regards,
Velasco family.

Magnificent hotel in ideally central location, unfortunately I was ill during this trip but the beautiful view from the room and the excellent room service still managed to feel like I was on holiday, the staff are fantastic and very attentive. My wife still managed to see a lot of London with many attractions only a short taxi ride away or within easy walking distance,Well worth the price.
Nice hotel with nice bar
日本には無いロケーションで荘厳です。良い空間です。
reviews.textTranslated: It is a majestic location unlike any other in Japan. It's a nice space.

reviews.text: We stayed here NYE night and it made for a great stay. Highly recommend room 606 (a deluxe room of some sorts) as it had a great view of the London Eye, Jubilee Gardens, and Belvedere Rd, which is the green zone for any fireworks tickets purchased. We could have enjoyed the fireworks from our room but wanted to get out into the crowd and enjoy our fireworks tickets. The hotel staff was beyond amazing and provided all its guests with wristbands for ease to navigate through the neighborhood on NYE. Cannot recommend this hotel enough from the wonderful staff, rooms, food, and location. Great place to stay for NYE!
Only the location was good everything else was terrible

I wish I could give more stars…..
Staff were amazing - helped me plan a proposal , there was Champagne , balloons and dessert left in the best room. They were amazing and made a special occasion even more special.
Amazing - Thank you
Service missing the mark for an elite branded hotel. Food definitely subpar. Not recommended.

موقع جغرافي فائق الروعة و الجمال بالقرب من كوبري ويست منيستر ، و لندن آي ، و يطل علي نهر التايمز ، و يطل كذلك مبني البرلمان الإنجليزي و ساعة بيج بن .

Beauty beyond description..
Wonderful architectural style..
Beautiful architectural designs..
Accuracy
cleanliness
System
Professional management..
Spaces..
green
trees ..
An extremely wonderful and beautiful geographical location near the Westminster Bridge and the London Eye, overlooking the River Thames, as well as the English Parliament building and Big Ben.

reviews.text:
Romantic 🥰 moment at the afternoon tea ☕️ with a lovely over looking view of the Big Ben tower
Awesome 🤩

Normally our stays in Marriott Hotels are good. The room was lovely as was the view. Unfortunately Christmas dinner was very disappointing especially paying £130 per head. It was dry and not very warm not worth even half the money. There was no excuse for such a bad Christmas dinner especially as the kitchen only concentrated on this food. Even one star is too much for the poor quality of Christmas Dinner

Excellent spot- right next to Westminster Abby, the Parliament,  Big Ben, close to all other attractions.
The staff is so nice and kind
Drinks great
Good ambience
Pool is awesome
Comfy rooms

The hospital is right across. However if you do need to see a doc I would recommend going to a private hospital in/out in 30 min.
Ubers are so efficient, clean…
מלון נפלא במיקום מצוין. חזרתי לפה בפעח השניה בזכות שירות נפלאחדרים מרווחים ובעיקר בריכת השחיה על גג המלון. קבלנו חדר צופה לנהר ולביג בן. מדהים!
reviews.textTranslated: A wonderful hotel in an excellent location. I came back here a second time thanks to the wonderful service, spacious rooms and especially the swimming pool on the roof of the hotel. We got a room overlooking the river and Big Ben. Amazing!

reviews.text: Hotel and room are nice but the service was poor

Avoid this hotel if you want your money’s worth and a 5 star experience. I wanted to give this hotel a chance. Let me start that my rate for a regular room was more than 500 pounds per night. I split my time in London between the Hilton Conrad and County Hall Marriott. I will start by saying that the County Hall Marriott IS NOT a five star hotel. I wish I had stayed at the Hilton Conrad the entire trip. There is an adequate attempt at checkin, but behind that, the hotel falls FLAT. It is in a great location near the London Eye and Westminster Abbey. On checkin, they offer a glass of sparkling wine. They do have a bell service. I am a Marriott Gold member and requested an upgrade as my status grants FREE upgrades if available The person I asked, prior to checkin and at checkin refused at all cost to grant an upgrade. Be only tied to make me pay for upgrades. I told him that I wanted to have access to the M Club as an upgrade because I was gold, which has NEVER been a problem anywhere else. He did we can do that for 80 pounds a nights. So I asked if I could be upgraded to a river view, he said no. The then tried to give me a “garden” views, which is worse as that is a “NO VIEW” there. He was called into his managers office who instructed him to give me a river view as an upgrade. It was NOT that difficult. I tipped the attendant handsomely despite his lack of customer focus.

I went to the room which was mediocre for at “5- star hotel”. At 500 pounds per night, I would have expected more, but it gets worse. I started to take a shower and there was no shower gel in this expensive hotel. I only had one very small (US Half-Dollar Sized) piece of soap. Again, this is it 5-star. There was no wet bar. There was nothing that one would expect for the price or star rating. I requested two shower gels for my two day stay and they brought ONE!!! I laughed.

The steak house at the hotel is OK, but not worth the price. My un garnished steak was ok and the potatoes were undercooked. I didn’t complain as my expectation of this Marriott were shot!

Given the fact that my time was off, I was awake at 1:30 AM and really wanted a Diet Coke. I went to the lobby and inquired, where I could get one. At first they stated that they had Pepsi in the M Lounge and I was hopeful I could get one. I told them I was not given access, thinking they could go get me a canned

PEPSI. They told me I could walk down the street to a 24 hour store. Unbelievable, this actually happened at my 500 pound per night hotel without soap.

Overall. I do not recommend this hotel. I would rather stay at the Holiday inn. This is not a 5-Star hotel and is much over priced for the value.

Absolutely awesome hotel

The staff is friendly, helpful and thoughtful. The rooms are great and comfortable after a long day of seeing the sights. It’s also in an excellent location with some of the most iconic views of the city right outside the front door. Couldn’t recommend it higher.

similarHotelsNearby.name: The Soho Hotel
similarHotelsNearby.description: Stylish lodging with dining & a spa

similarHotelsNearby.name: Urban Chic Serviced Apartments - Shaftesbury, Soho

reviews.text: Didn't stay
Good food and reasonably priced set menu.

Been here for some amazing cocktails and for an afternoon tea brunch.
I really enjoyed, the service was an absolute best and the staff as well.
lovely staff

Have had a couple of events on the rooftop, lovely venue.
On a colder night when heaters are on its still amazing.
Super
Gabriel was in an incredible host for bowling, very kind and looking out for feryone!!

I simply asked if l could have a quick look at the facilities with a potential booking in mind. I was met by a very rude and reluctant reception manager, who said l could only check out the facilities if l was a guest . How do you know if you want to be a potential guest if you can't view what is on offer?
I was struck by his rudeness and felt very comfortable.
Not a great first impression.

Its a wonderful hotel with a very vibrant vibe.  We are enjoying it very much and want to make it our regular stay while in London. However, if there is anything that can be improved to make it even better is housekeeping, I believe housekeeping should not just be only changing bedsheets and disposing garbage, but to tidy up the room and to make the room like home for the people who stays in it, such as folding up clothes on the sofa, tidying up the table because not a day our coffee table was wiped, putting a cloth under the toiletries in the bathroom, putting back the slippers and hair dryer, we stayed for a week and not a day our bathtub was cleaned after our usage, replacing the laundry bag, there are many more that can be improved in regards to housekeeping to make the stay even better, thats hospitality, to provide guests a wonderful feeling of “Home”.
Not the coziest of places and quite noisy too. Good service and good afternoon tea.

המלון הכי שווה!!!
בהגעה למלון שודרגנו ללא בקשה מצדנו וקיבלנו חדר מדהים ביופיו!
החדר ועיצוב המלון היה מושלם: המיטה הייתה נוחה ומפנקת, כל האביזרים בחדר היו מפנקים ומאוד יעילים, כולל חדר אמבטיה גדול ומדהים! הנוף לחצר עם כל הירוק השרה אווירה מאוד נעימה, כולל מוסיקת הרקע שניתן היה לבחור.
הצוות בקבלה, כולל הבל בויס והקונסירג' היו מאוד שירותים, מחייכים, עוזרים בכל דבר - פשוט נהדרים.
ולסיום - ארוחת הבוקר - מושלמת!!! אין מילים! צוות נותני השירות (המלצרים והמארחים) נתנו שירות מעבר לכל ציפיה !!
ממליצה בחום להגיע למלון המקסים הזה.
reviews.textTranslated:
The best hotel!!!
Upon arrival at the hotel, we were upgraded without a request from our side and received an amazingly beautiful room!
The room and hotel design was perfect: the bed was comfortable and luxurious, all the accessories in the room were luxurious and very efficient, including a large and amazing bathroom! The view to the courtyard with all the greenery created a very pleasant atmosphere, including the background music that could be chosen.
The staff at the reception, including the Bell Boys and the concierge were very helpful, smiling, helpful with everything - just great.
And finally - the breakfast - perfect!!! No words! The service provider team (waiters and hosts) provided service beyond all expectations!!
I highly recommend coming to this lovely hotel.

reviews.text:
Wow.
An absolutely beautiful hotel in the beating heart of London's arts and shopping centre. Seconds from piccadilly circus. 5 minutes from Oxford Street. A very impressive decort, exceptional customer service. I was here to host a film Premier.
Amazing bar area with a huge selection of wines etc. If you're going to eat try the Korean style cauliflower, it's amazing.

Ham Yard Hotel offers a charming London escape. The stylish decor, vibrant ambiance, and attentive staff create a delightful experience. The central location is ideal for exploring the city. The rooftop terrace is a hidden gem providing stunning views. A must-stay for those seeking luxury with character.

The hotel, located in the vibrant Soho neighborhood, is known for its unique decor, incorporating contemporary and artistic elements. The rooms are comfortable, and the attention to detail in the design is impressive.

The service is generally considered to be top-notch, with attentive staff members who strive to make your stay enjoyable. The hotel's amenities, including the rooftop terrace, cozy library, and the beautiful courtyard, create a wonderful atmosphere for relaxation.

The location is a significant advantage. Being in the heart of London, you'll have easy access to theaters, shops, restaurants, and many attractions. It's a great base for exploring the city, and you'll be surrounded by the lively energy of the area.

However, please note that experiences can vary, and I recommend checking more recent reviews on trusted travel websites or platforms to get the most up-to-date and detailed feedback from people who have stayed at Ham Yard Hotel in London.
Wonderful afternoon tea. Beautiful place.

Family afternoon tea party 🎉
Much confusion and stress trying to sort how to order
Minimal choice of sandwich type
When it came the tea ☕️ itself was a long time later and extra hot water had to be requested
The sandwiches were meanly filled and bread was stale 😬
Not what you expect for the price!
Scones cakes 🧁 and the tea were very good 😊
Best food in down town..  Special thanx to Safa and Kasha
Amazing
Ville ikke servere andre enn hotellets gjester. Vist ut av restaurant.
reviews.textTranslated: Would not serve anyone other than hotel guests. Shown out of restaurant.

reviews.text:
Lovely dinner oustide. Really good service.Not cheap but not unreasonable.
Reduced selection of vegan options. Now only one starter and one main.
A few years ago I had a whole menu.
Amazing hotel in the center of the area. Has a bowling alley and a cinema area.
Had a work conference here and the hotel is the funkiest yet poshest hotel I’ve ever been too. The venue was incredible and the service was outstanding. Also, it has a four lane bowling alley in it.

The hotel is centrally located, close to all shops and theaters. The hotel itself is beautiful, the outdoors seating is so relaxing. The food served was very nice. You should try the black margarita 🍹

Went here for a product launch for work, so didn’t actually stay the night. That being said, the facilities are great, the food is exceptional and the location is perfect with only a 3 minute walk to Piccadilly Circus tube station
Amazing hotel
Beautiful hidden away bar in a busy area.

One of the most  intricate, beautiful, aesthetically designed hotels in London. Chic clientele and a good, distinct selection of alcohol. Everything from the art to the furniture to the service and food was lovely. Cannot wait to return.
Had High Tea.
What a fabulous, find great boutique hotel. Great location, wonderful service. I’m coming back again.

I recently moved to the UK from NYC and having frequented The Crosby Hotel and The Whitby, I was excited to pop into The Ham Yard after visiting an art exhibition there.

I was going to get a quick drink and snack before heading back home to Surrey. I was seated outside and it took about 10 minutes for the waiter to take my order. He seemed unfamiliar with the menu so I assume he was new. After I ordered (a non-alcoholic drink and a cheese plate) I proceeded to wait another 20 minutes while all of the people that came and sat after me received their drinks. The waiter paid no notice to me. I eventually just flagged him over and told him to cancel my order.

Is this just how hotel service works in the UK? I was shocked and will not be returning.

Also I would suggest that if you have a new staff member at a more upscale hotel that you have a more experienced server with him or her to ensure your customers receive the service they deserve.
Boujee
Looks lovely
Went for a seminar downstairs. Funky cool hotel. Decor amazing. Location really nice. Pretty awful coffee though

the rooms, we had a luxury suite, are as expectet hotel super nice and well styled but we did not fellt the charming coziness as we suposed to do here, its more like you are the cash cow, we did al lot of her hotels allready but this is the one we probably will not book again
Service does not match price category
Wonderful front patio. Also has a rooftop terrace.

People who are going to stay at The Ham Yard are probably not the type who read reviews about The Ham Yard. But just in case your assistant’s assistant is reading this review, I’ll say that this is easily my favorite hotel in the world. The staff isn’t just wonderful in all departments, they actually anticipate your needs and take care of you. Staying at the Ham Yard is the most effortless experience imaginable. It is how all hotel stays should be and, as such, is the measuring stick by which all hotels should be measured. The only hotels I’ve ever seen come close to The Ham Yard are their sister hotel The Covent Garden Hotel and the Hotel Palácio de Vilapanes in Seville.

I don’t want to belabor my point, but the rooms are perfect (with the most wonderful RikRak amenities and the softest sheets and towels), they genuinely make traveling with toddlers a dream, and the dining room and bar are fantastic. High Tea at the Ham Yard is a delicious, luxurious experience not to be missed.

I cannot wait to have my assistant’s travel assistant book another stay soon.
Afternoon tea in restful gem in heart of Soho, a delightful and tasty way to ease the mid afternoon blues.

It was a birthday drink treat..
Fabulous venue. Excellent service.
Would recommend 👌

No respect for the NHS. A woman collapsed and our friend who’s a junior doctor spent 30-40 minutes with the manager helping the bar and the manager to look after her. After helping endlessly to put them at ease, one of our party politely suggested that it would have been nice to offer the doctor something to say thank you for being on hand out of hours, we were told he shouldn’t have bothered and wasn’t needed the whole time. We were then instantly told to leave. Clearly don’t give a cr*p - disgraceful.

A lovely 'buzzy' place to drop in for a drink (good cocktails) and the restaurant has the same ambience, wide menu and food perfectly cooked.  I've been  there at times when one would expect it to be overcrowded- but whilst it maintains that 'happy place' ambience, I've always found seats - at the bar or tables.  For a bar just off Picaddilly Circus, that's unusual (and nice).
Perfect spot for tea, comfy seating and easy access to everything central.

イギリス旅行の際に、是非とも本場のアフタヌーンティーを体験してみたいと思い、子連れなのでどこに行こうか迷っていたところ友人の勧めもあって、こちらのホテルのアフタヌーンティーに決めました！
ホテルの雰囲気も良く、ドアマンの方、サービススタッフの方皆さん対応接客もよく、アフタヌーンティーセットが運ばれてきた後も、写真撮りましょうか？と気遣ってくださったり心地よいサービスでした😊

店内はいつくかの空間に分かれていて、バースペース、ガーデンスペースなどとティースペースと分かれていたので子供がいて少しぐずっても過ごしやすかったです。
そして、念願のアフタヌーンティーも、ケーキも甘すぎず美味しく、サンドイッチもサーモンサンド、ツナサンド、たまごサンドやチーズサンドなどいろんなお味を楽しむことができました。
アフタヌーンティーセットのみであれば40ポンド、スパークリングシャンパン付きは53ポンドでした。（2023.3.22）お値段も他のティーサロンに比べ良心的で大変お勧めです❤️
reviews.textTranslated:
When traveling to England, I really wanted to experience an authentic afternoon tea, and since I was traveling with children, I was wondering where to go, and based on a friend's recommendation, I decided to have afternoon tea at this hotel!
The atmosphere of the hotel is good, and the doorman and service staff are all very friendly and helpful. Even after the afternoon tea set was brought to us, we asked if we could take a photo. It was a pleasant service that was considerate 😊

The store is divided into several spaces, including a bar space, a garden space, and a tea space, so it was easy to spend time with children even if they were a little restless.
We also enjoyed the long-awaited afternoon tea, the cake was delicious without being too sweet, and we were able to enjoy a variety of sandwiches such as salmon sandwich, tuna sandwich, egg sandwich, and cheese sandwich.
The afternoon tea set alone was £40, and the one with sparkling champagne was £53. (2023.3.22) The price is also reasonable compared to other tea salons and is highly recommended ❤️

reviews.text: Amazing
My chauffeur couldn’t find any where to park had to walk
Really lovely for afternoon tea, I love the staff , young and experienced. The champagne wasn’t the greatest but the coffees and delicious mini cakes made up for it

One of my favourite restaurants in London. Beautiful space and fabulous interior design. Staff are always very warm and welcoming, making guests feel very much at home. The reservations team are on the ball making it such a breeze to call up and book. Food, drinks, service, and ambience - Ham Yard always delivers.
Staff and service were top notch (as were rooms and food). We’ll be back.

Love, love, love this hotel.  Our room was uniquely decorated, spacious & bright.  Staff throughout the hotel were welcoming & friendly.  Breakfast buffet was excellent & the wait staff helpful & efficient.  The roof garden/bar area is gorgeous.  We loved the two almost secretive lounge areas with their fireplaces & luxurious, warm decor.

The main bar was lively in the evenings & the front desk staff were consistently helpful.  I look forward to a return visit.
Excellent afternoon tea.
Went for a conference. Nice location.

Had brunch in the restaurant with friends and our newborn son. Great menu, delicious food, fab service where staff were more than accommodating of the needs for a table big enough for the pram and discreet enough for feeding my baby. 4* only on account of the prices for the portions, which could have been more generous considering.
Absolutely  stunning 😍 ✨️ place
Fabulous hotel restaurant, great decor and atmosphere, good menu, tasty food and good portion size

Went for some drinks
Bar staff were brilliant, attentive, talented and meticulous
Drinks were exceptional, delicious and price as expected
We always enjoy the Ham Yard experience and will continue to come back

Had a meeting with my agent here and I liked the atmosphere and I felt relaxed all throughout the meeti g. I ordered a ginger and lemon tea and that was literally what I got. A lemon and a tea in hot water for £6.50. I'd leave this place for business meetings but just to relax, read my book, and have tea or coffee, I'd go somewhere else.
I was served by Paul who is a Luggage Porter, he offered us an amazing service and we felt very welcome! Highly recommended.
Pain to get in and out of

Was here for a Course, so didn't stay in a room. Staff were lovely, food was great and good service.
The High Tea was everything it was billed to be. We went on the later side and had an opportunity to speak with their wait staff, who were well-travelled and interesting.

Came for lunch on Saturday food was super. So much so we tried to bring family members the next day for spot of lunch before a matinee. Unfortunately turned away with 20 empty tables...

Ended up down the road instead. Disappointing after a great first meal to be let down...

Good location, but recommend the company’s other hotels. This one’s a pass.

reviews.text:
The Covent Garden Hotel is a home away from home and I now stay there every time I visit London.  The Seven Dials location is perfect for dinner, theatre and interesting shops (and only 10 minutes on the Central Line to the City for work) and the decor and attention to detail are simply stunning.  There seems to be very limited turnover of staff and it’s great to see the same friendly faces on every visit.

I’ve lived in Asia for more than two decades, and throughout that time I’ve always said that my favourite hotel is the iconic Mandarin Oriental in Hong Kong. For me the Covent Garden Hotel, while clearly very different, is now its equal.
Has a fantastic visit
We had à drink in the evening in this charming place. Service was great

Had a fantastic lunch at the Brasserie last week , my youngest is gluten and diary intolerant and the staff were wonderful, they had superb gluten free bread.  The eggs as you can see below were light and fluffy cooked with no butter.  The avo on toast was also superb.  We popped up to the library upstairs after lunch for a little R&R it’s an awesome area to unwind.

Wonderful location
Staff lovely
Bed so comfortable
Main menu food, 3 out 5.
Breakfast buffet delicious. Service we were disappointed on the whole because of the cost of the hotel we expected perfection and it wasn't.
Tourist place beautiful place artists playing music .magic ...diversion...tube station.Aple shop.....
Ótima!!
reviews.textTranslated: Excellent!!

reviews.text:
A little haven in a very busy society.
The team at the Covent Garden Hotel provide that quintessential extra service that creates a warm a welcome ambiance
Mary, and the team in the cocktail bar have delivered a home for home theatre,  that allows a relaxed and comfortable aura away from the bustle of the city outside
Kudos to the team and colleagues

Good place to meet suppliers in a nice hotel venue.
Good service by the hotel staff.
Small rooms, ridiculous small. Take the bigger rooms
The atmosphere was perfect for a lovely evening dining experience. The staff and service are 1st class. Very well made and delicious dishes served.
Great service in a beautiful and fun area. Very pretty to look at whether indoors or outdoors.
