Very nice
Impressive stay, location and staff highly recommend
Cocktails as good as ever and lively atmosphere
Superlichte. Hotel niet veel soeps. Geen ontbijt meer.
reviews.textTranslated: Super light. Hotel not up to much. No more breakfast.

reviews.text: Home .
What a good day out

As a writer, I've been blessed with having traveled all over the world. I have stayed in every type of accommodation, from Hostels to extreme luxury. Covent Garden Hotel was far and away the best overall experience I have ever had. Our arrival, me and my 83-year-old Mom, was anticipated, welcoming and we were made to feel like royalty from the moment we stepped out of our car and onto the property. Every staff member I spoke with told us how lucky they were to work there, which was reflected in every detail of the flawless service they provided. After a day out, walking back onto to property felt like coming home. Their dinner and entertainment recommendations were spot on. Because of the wonderful experience we had, we are looking into adding a few days to the end of our UK trip, just so we can return to the Covent Garden Hotel. A special shout-out to Mikey, Patricia, Agostinho, and Nicky for making this very special Mother-Daughter trip one we will never forget.
Didn't stay. Just had a drink. Many different bars. Nice happy staff. London prices.
Not as busy as before covid but still vibrant and nice.

Only dined here and had evening drinks after theatre. Great service very friendly,welcoming and professional 👏  very accommodating with menu choices. Lovely relaxing ambiance . Rooms look great too but I haven't had the need to stay

I went to the hotel for afternoon tea, the setting was lovely. But the afternoon tea was average. The scones were the best, the sandwiches were not very well filled, had the crust on and I told them I don't eat beef but they still brought me a roast beef sandwich! Won't be going back.

title: The Langley, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Buckinghamshire

reviews.text:
Staff are very kind and friendly. The hospitality is great. The building is so clean, the park is very quiet. We enjoyed walking in the park in the morning, it was amazing. And the spa is wonderful too !
We enjoyed staying at this hotel so much.
Amazing experience as a simple walker to end up at the terrace of the hotel restaurant with our dogs enjoying a fabulous lunch! I would like to thank the staff for the warm welcoming 😊

This is a small but beautiful estate next to a park. The building structure is handsome and ornate without being ostentatious. The interior is newly remodeled so the room I got was wonderful with a seating area. The bedding is fantastic. There are two restaurant choices. Any bar within this property with I think 50 units max. In the basement there is a gym, pool and spa. Next to the main building there is a heated outdoor pool.

The only reason I did not give this place five stars is because the service is inconsistent. I think the intention is to go above and beyond on service but the the quality of service is lacking, something that can probably be rectified through better training. For example, I had to call three times over 9 hour. One day to have my mini bar addressed. The mini bar was not working. After the first call. No one showed up. After the second call someone may have showed up. After the third call, they decided to move a portable fridge in the middle of my hotel room. A picture is included. It was not a solution fitting a self-proclaimed luxury place. Another example, I sent out my Blazer for cleaning. It's a new blazer I bought on the same trip in Paris prior to driving to London. The blazer came back worse than I sent it out. Full of white lint from somewhere. With the interior wrinkled probably due to the handling. On another day during my stay I sent out a white shirt to be clean and folded. It came back hung and not pressed. A picture is included as well. There are many other examples but I think you get the point. On the brightest side, some of the staff do try to go above in the eye. For example they helped book a restaurant reservation for a group of 10 just hours before dinner. Another example, I was given plenty of help trying to print.

Overall, a nice place to have a business meeting for a few days or a getaway. I would come back but I hope the service improves.

One star for the beautiful surroundings and its location. Unfortunately our whole family stay experience at The Langley was downgraded in the end and it became very unpleasant for our family holiday: Apparently the hotel only make effort to serve you if you’re able to pay for the entire property and they’ll kick other guests out.

We had an evening flight back home from Heathrow on the check-out day and the day before I was about to ask for a babysitter for our boys so that me and my husband could enjoy the SPA after check-out in the afternoon. When I approached the reception desk, the lady told me: oh but nobody is allowed to be here tomorrow. At first I was confused. It turned out that on our check-out day, someone bought the entire property and the lady at the reception literally told me: well you know when you’re spending that much money, you don’t want someone else to be here. The way how she talked, sounds ridiculous indeed.

Later I figured out that the hotel required all the guests leave by 12 noon and all the facilities (restaurants, bars, spa, public grounds etc.) won’t be available for use since they need to clean the entire property. I once again asked to speak to a manager and expressed my concerns, as I felt rather unpleasant because nobody informed us regarding this issue before and we only found out the day before; meaning we will have to find elsewhere and other entertainment before our flight at our own expense as we weren’t able (and not welcomed) to stay on the hotel premises.

The manager was arrogant as well, her first response was and insisted that we didn’t “lose” anything because the policy is that the check-out time is at 12 noon. There’s no service recovery for us, even if it’s completely the hotel’s management fault as it failed to give us the notice promptly, the attitude I learned from The Langley is: We have another guest paying a lot of money so other guests need to leave.

The next day, we drove back with the taxi to the hotel and we were waiting for our stored luggage to be delivered to us. It took a few minutes longer and while we were waiting, our taxi driver was asked if he could drive his car further away back to the main gate since the wedding couple is soon arriving.

Surely, someone could spend their money and rent the whole property, well then since the one who spends the most money matters most, may I kindly advise that the next time, let your guest also pay the extra to rent the night before, so you’re assure of that no other guest will be on property.

A guest is a guest, you shall show your best; no hotel should ever classify their guests base on the amount of money they spend, every guest shall be treated equally and with respect. Shame on you, The Langley.

We had a great stay. Staff was great, room was clean and nice and the food and drinks were great; there was just one thing that really bothered me...

Behind the outdoor pool is a small pen with two pygmy goats. Feeding, grooming and keeping the pen clean were all A+, but as a person who has had pygmy goats, it was clear that both were depressed since they do not get out of the pen to run free and play (there are dogs everywhere here).  I've never seen two young goats so docile. Of course they perk up if someone has food but I visited them multiple times...they did not know how to play like regular goats and their demeanor was strange as though hey were sedated.

Goats are very playful and lively creatures, love humans and are sweet natured. To be hidden behind the pool and the 10' hedgerow is cruel enough, but these creatures deserve better than a lovely little prison pen. Filling their mental health needs is a must as well. Additionally, there was one peacock left out of 8 (I was told by multiple staff members) because the foxes had killed the rest.  If I had known animals were being used as entertainment I would have not booked here. I do not believe people are booking this beautiful hotel because there are two pygmy goats behind the pool.

Langley Management: please find other ways to entertain children at the hotel and find those goats a good home where they can run and all-around healthy.
Great one night stay before flight back to U.S. Will return next trip. 20 minutes from LHR.

A beautiful luxury hotel on the most amazing grounds. Perfect getaway to relax and enjoy the countryside just outside of London.

Paulo on the front desk was so pleasant, despite it being around midnight. He very kindly carried our bags up and checked us in with zero hassle.

The room was one of the main highlights. Staff went above and beyond to make it special with the turndown service and welcome drinks in the room. Very comfortable and a beautiful view.

Breakfast was wonderful with an amazing view. The fresh juice variation was very refreshing. A halal meat option would’ve been nice but not a requirement at all.

Paul from housekeeping was very kind, helping us with fresh towels. John from the front desk also was very helpful and kindly brought us fresh ice for our drinks. Robin kindly helped as well over the phone. Even Abby in the spa gave us a lovely little tour with such friendliness.

Biggest of thank yous must go to Kerena. She went above and beyond to make this stay very special. Her and I were in contact for weeks before my stay to ensure everything was perfect, and it was. She arranged a few specific things that were required and made it no hassle at all. Could not speak any more highly of her and the service provided. Looking forward to more stays at the Langley!

A cosy place with welcoming staff.

We came for dinner, the food arrived in good time. Nice flavours as expected from fine dining.

5/5

A service in the restaurant was subpar - dishes were replaced with once not ordered, and they charged a different price. The waiters forgot to bring sauces and starters, and getting their attention took a considerable amount of time.

The nice side, the SPA was a pleasant experience!

This isn’t a cheap experience but it’s one of the few hotels in the English countryside that really deserves the label “luxury”. Everything is maintained to a high standard and the pool, gym and spa facilities are incredible. The outdoor pool is amazing!
The food is the only disappointment as it’s merely “ok”. Breakfast is very pricey and apparently not included in the room rate. My Full English was so-so and the Bircher Müsli was…well, something altogether different! Still doesn’t detract from an otherwise amazing short stay.

Fantastic stay, this is the second time at The Langley. It is most definitely the best option for this area. Stayed in room 53 which is out of the main hotel - cute cottage vibes with country views! Room service was 5-star ... try the Arancini and Cold meat cuts with Gnocco fritto!

Stunning when the sun is shinning however still excellent on the drizzlier days. The grounds are great for walks, bike rides, with a beautiful outdoor pool and if you're lucky you can meet the pygmy goats - Nutmeg and Cinnamon! All the team at the hotel are super helpful, kind and attentive, Jana on the front desk is extremely delightful in every way and Adam (on his first week) was such a pleasure to speak to!

Available spaces for laptop working which is ideal.

Beautiful spa space (sauna, steam, indoor pool) with a great gym (ski erg, rower, sled, squat rack which was a treat as not all gyms have this!)

Highly recommended!

Thank you!

This hotel is stunning from the moment you drive down the long wooded driveway. The hotel is set in the middle of bliss. The rooms were not quite what I was expecting for the money - although nice they weren’t as grand as I imagined BUT that didn’t really matter as the spa, food and service is what you realise your paying for.

I’d highly recommend The Langley to anybody wishing to enjoy a relaxing weekend in pure heaven. I’d also recommend the orange blossom massage and the exfoliation treatment.
Exclusive, remote, and peaceful. Amazing staff.....Adele, Alex and Ale were superb! The rooms are renovated, but the castle's charm remains. Will definitely visit again!
Beaitiful hotel in  a great location. Fabulous food and service. Loved our stay.
Very nice place

Came here for a birthday lunch. Very nice, all you would expect from a high end hotel location. The grounds are very extensive for walks after a meal.
Dined in the Cedar room which has some good outdoor tables and seating too.
A luxury place with the best service, a beautiful garden and SPA centre
Lovely place.  Nice food

Firstly, I'd like to start by saying I never leave negative reviews and It has been several months since our stay as I wanted to reflect on our time there and also contact the hotel first, which sadly I haven't heard back from...so here we are!

We booked this hotel for our wedding night last June, to stay after our small ceremony. We booked dinner for that evening and also a spa day for 2 the following day to truly relax and enjoy the weekend.

We had a few drinks as we arrived, it was a lovely evening so we sat on the terrace. The gardens were very bog standard, just fields with some hedge borders around which were pleasant but generally feel like a lot more could be invested in the gardens for such a luxury hotel.

Dinner was nice but the atmosphere in the dinning room was incredibly flat, almost awkward. There were maybe a dozen tables but you could have heard a pin drop. There was no music or ambiance, it was very strange and we quickly finished our meal and headed to our room.

As we arrived in our room, there were rose petals on the bed which was a nice touch and a bottle of red wine with a note to say 'congratulations!', we opened this and settled into our evening- this wine appeared on our bill the next day which was a shame.

The rooms were comfortable, boutique style. You couldn't see out of the window so it felt dark but it was clean and the bed was nice. We paid extra for breakfast in bed but things like sauces/ drinks didn't come up with the breakfast.

The most disappointing part was the spa experience; this was not cheap and we have visited many leading spa's around the world but this certainly wasn't luxury. Firstly, there were several children in the spa which we weren't expecting for a luxury spa. We have our own children and of course love all children, but this took away from our relaxing experience when being splashed on our beds. Again, there was no relaxing music, no spa smell- it actually smelt of bleach which was really strong. Not what you'd expect. No water or refreshments were available in the spa area, nor any reading material. We headed outside to the pool area, this was incredibly dirty, with quite a thick layer of sediment floating on top of the water, it looked like it hadn't been cleaned for weeks. The shower was out of order next to the pool so we couldn't even wash after getting out. The sunbeds were worn out and looked even mouldy in some areas. There was electrical extension leads visible as well as some tools nearby to.

We each had a massage after, which was honestly really un enjoyable. The therapist was nice enough but I walked into the room and it was bright lights and again no atmosphere. The massage wasn't relaxing at all, the girl kept putting her elbow in my shoulder blade which was agony! Again, I regularly get massages at Spa's whilst away and i've just never experienced one like this before.

The general look of the Hotel was pretty poor when you look closely- The finish on the paint is incredibly messy, there was still lots of red spray paint on the lovely stone steps in reception. Just loads of snagging we noticed which added to the disappointment.

Finally, our bill upon check out was £1353.50 which we would have happily paid for our wedding night, had the hotel lived up to expectation and its 'luxury' name. It was far from this!!
I did email the hotel my thoughts before posting this review, but its been months and I have not heard back. I would never stay here again especially as its expensive and doesn't compare with some other gorgeous hotels in the area!
Great service
Nice place to relax.abit expensive big huge garden all around    I love it
Absolutely awesome 👌

We went for afternoon tea for my friends birthday. The main building has an impressive set of Italian style steps leading up to a grand entrance. Fabulous for wedding photos.
The staff were very attentive and professional and couldn't do enough for us.
The afternoon tea was of an excellent quality although on this occasion the scones were a tad dry. The rest was delicious. They kindly brought out a plate with sweets and a candle with happy birthday on as well.
I would definately recommend a visit, the gardens must be lovely in the summer.
Wow love it

Stunning location and pleasant, attentive staff. We stopped for an afternoon tea which we enjoyed but the bread of the cucumber sandwiches was dry & stale and the tea was weak. The staff replaced the tea without hesitation. The cakes, scones and jams were, however, 5 stars!
Weitläufige Anlage, sehr imposantes Haus, sehr freundlicher Service
reviews.textTranslated: Spacious complex, very impressive house, very friendly service

reviews.text: I came here for a spa morning (9am - 1pm) and was blown away by just how amazing this spa is - the best I've been to by far and I've been to a lot of spas! Firstly, the grounds and hotel building itself is stunning. I was walked to the spa by a gentleman on reception, which was a lovely touch and was then met by a very friendly spa receptionist. Once I was shown to the changing rooms, I was pleased to see that they were big, super clean and gorgeous. The spa itself is stunning and even has a women's only area, which is amazing! I used all of the facilities alone which was dreamy, as they told me they limit numbers to ensure it's never crowded. The staff are super friendly and go above and beyond to make you feel welcome - it was my birthday and they even prepared a little birthday treat for me 🥰 Lunch was delicious and included the biggest, tastiest Tiramisu I've ever eaten! I've already started looking at dates for coming back. I had a 90 minute massage which was also incredible. 100% recommend - I will be returning 😊

Wow! I was on a half spa day (1pm-6pm) and honestly I can walk away from the experience saying that it is the best spa I have been to! The service and attention to detail throughout the day was unmatched by anywhere else I have been too. The 1hr 30 minute treatment with Diana and Alayna was the best full body massage we have ever had! They took so much care in carrying out a pre-treatment consultation followed by the best massage ever! Would highly recommend the Langley Spa, it is pricey however you pay for quality. I would definitely return.

We had an amazing 3days (and 2 nights) stay at the Langley. We stayed from 29th-31st Jan ‘23. When we first arrived on the first night we were quite tired from driving all the way from Edinburgh. The staffs and receptionists greeted us with happy faces and makes us forget about our tiredness. Thank you to Stuart for kindly helped us with our massive and many luggages. On the next day, we had a lovely breakfast and the staff there were all amazing, happy and funny-they recommend us take the bike and tour around the ground-which was an amazing experience. We love our room, the pool, and especially the ground. They even allow us to check out late bc our flight was going to be at night, so we got to stay till 5 pm. Special thank you to Wendy, Shirley, and Stuart for making our last stay in London very memorable. We’ll definitely come all the way from Malaysia to experience the hotel again
Had afternoon tea. Very professional and polite staff.

A very beautiful hotel.
We went there for lunch in the Cedar restaurant inside the hotel, the service was great and the food was good.
The hotel is very well maintained, clean and very beautifully decorated.
Surrounded by a very huge landscape of gardens and trees.
Definitely worth visiting for a quick getaway in the nature.

Luxury 5 star spa hotel with added benefit of the beautiful surrounding of the Langley park. Spa and swimming pool are brilliant and one of the best we have been. Rooms are spacious, clean and modern. staff are very polite, welcoming and always have smile on their faces.
Few things to mention that are outstanding Clementine Martini cocktail at the Churchill bar and the carrot Ginger soup which is divine. We will be returning soon
Great suite with nice view from the second floor. Enjoyed the spa facilities and the restaurant

A stunningly beautiful location. The service was excellent from the moment we arrived to the moment we left.

The hotel itself was maintained to a very high standard with excellent decoration.

The staff were polite and very accommodating.

The hotel has two key dinning areas, the Cedar restaurant, with formal dinning tables. The second is the Churchill bar a more relaxed area with your traditional bar style seating (sofas, lounge chairs, etc.). I cannot fault with both served great food with drinks. However, the Cedar does require suitable smart casual attire.

Overall a brilliant experience, only drawback, was our first day with a rude breakfast staff member, thankfull we did not see him again for the rest of our stay, and it would be wrong to mark down the high standards of everyone else.
Great facilities and afternoon tea, recommend!

Unreal hotel. My mom and I stayed 1 night here on our UK road trip. The property is gorgeous, the hotel itself is crazy beautiful. Every person who worked there was so nice to the both of us. I even got nice room upgrade to a cute suite. The bed was comfortable, the room was cozy and the shower was amazing. We love a waterfall shower.
Would definitely stay here again.

The breakfast in the morning was delicious too!

Afternoon tea - beautiful location, incredibly decorated bar and restaurant & lovely afternoon tea with great drinks selection, champagne option, and tasty foods savory and sweet options. Fab service - a great day out in a lovely location!
If you like peace,quite and away from hustle and bustle from busy days......this is the place .
The environment is wonderful, the spa is first class. The gym is quite something too. Food is very good, rather than superb. Would definitely visit again.
Excellent  spa and gym area. Good bar for cocktails and food

Loved our stay here, great welcome from the staff, nothing was too much trouble. Spa was amazing. Food and drink was way beyond our expectations but as expected you do pay for the privilege. Worth every penny. We'll return.
A LUXURY HOTEL with a Breathtaking view, scenery and vast Parking at front. A must visit if you can afford £££.

Beautiful hotel. Enjoyed visiting during down season and enjoying a casual cup of tea and cake, or walking around the grounds. However during the summertime you cannot even drive near it without a reservation and you will be snubbed and turned away…
Stayed twice now such a stunning setting and perfect for a short getaway
My wife and I had a spa day at the hotel. It was excellent. Hannah and Dawn were great and both massages were perfect. We'll be returning.

I celebrated my birthday here in December and the whole experience was truly amazing. We booked a Spa Day which included treatments, use of all the facilities & afternoon tea. Loved every minute and would certainly revisit. Thank you
Beautiful 😍

Loved everything about this place. It is so beautiful and like something that was captured from a fairy tail or Bridgerton 😂🤦‍♀️ It is also perfect for weddings. I booked for 1 night via spabreak which I regret, hopefully I will go back soon. Me and my mum loved our spa treatments very much and I appreciate that there is a women’s only section. The staff are friendly … overall a great experience.

Sunday 25 Sep. We had a luxury tea. A wonderful experience. The service was impeccable. No detail was overlooked. Sumptuous teatime treats.
Will definitely recommend

I cant fault the service
I had a massage by Millie... I have to say she was faultless
All the staff were so welcoming
I left there totally recharged (which was very much needed)
It's so nice
Excellent hotel
Excellent hotel & service

Came upon this property by accident whilst walking in adjoining park. Fully restored country house with a lot of history. Beautifully and very tastefully done. Were shown around and made to feel very welcome. Intend to go back.
Amazing hotel - loved the afternoon tea and spa

A place to admire.
They describe the building as palatial and i could not agree more,  it is very beautiful, sophisticated and demands your fullest attention.

From the anticipation through the grand drive way into the property, the incredible water fountain at the entrance and beautifully landscaped gardens your eyes and treated to a unique blend of opulence, deco and beauty which I am sure will envoke an awe inspiring experience.

I visited for a meal with my wife and children.  The service was on the whole amazing. I mean amazing. The staff are in the background but will actively engage with their guests should anything be required. Hats off to the staff and management for getting this just right.

The food was high quality, well presented and scrumptious.

The Langley deserves five stars, it really should, however I felt I can not extend the extra star on this occasion.
1. Our server, who was also allegedly the bar manager, was ill equipped to provide assurance with regards to the claim the food was halal  I.e. when questioned how could we be assured the food was halal and merely responding that the hotel was owned by a Lebanese business man and leaving it as that is simply not enough and to be honest pathetic! If you do not know surely you would offer to find out perhaps? which he was unwilling to do and seemed to think his answer would quite obviously be enough.
2. Unfortunately the same server seemed to have a chip on his shoulder or something as he came across cold and arrogant which made us all feel a little uncomfortable and dampened this part of our evening.

Perhaps this was our bad luck, perhaps he was having a bad day as all the other servers and staff we met were incredible and very welcoming. I don't know.

Nevertheless the Langley is worth your time and needs to be appreciated.
Great meal. Great service.

been here multiple times. fantastic hotel, the spa is incredible and never busy, breakfast is great too - all the staff are helpful and accommodating. easily the best hotel we've been to in england. only minor issue is that the room service menu does not have a lot of variety, would appreciate more chicken dishes!
Rude staff

Extremely well maintained hotel and grounds. Outdoor pool, indoor spa, afternoon tea and rich history - The Langley doesn't disappoint!
You can wander the local grounds or take one of the complementary bikes out around to see the wider Langley Park, whichever way you go the surrounds are a lush paradise of well kept gardens.
The afternoon tea was great, the sandwiches were exceptional, cakes and scones were nice but given the extremely broad selection, the tea itself was a little underwhelming. Besides this, the service is fantastic; staff are outgoing and friendly. A great spot!

Planned a staycation here with a 9 month baby. Had high expectations due to the positive reviews but this will be our last time. Service is great, attentive but it’s not baby friendly. First of all, Baby cot mattress is the cheap sponge one covered with white plastic. It’s definitely not breathable hence not safe. For a 5 star hotel that provides guests comfortable pocket spring mattress with goose down duvet, why isn’t it possible to provide safe sleeping options for babies?? Secondly, the in-room fridge doesn’t work. Sent an engineer to fix it but still not working. So drinks in the bridge is room temperature and can’t store baby food. Thirdly, stay away from suites on the second floor. The ceiling height in the middle of the room is so low that if you are 180cm+, you will hit your head easily. Lastly, called the hotel to book an early dinner. Was told the earlier slots at 6:30pm are booked. When we arrived at the hotel at 7:05pm. There was only one table with the rest completely empty. What is this? Stayed in many 5 star hotels in the U.K. and around the world and this is the worst experience so far.
Had a fantastic meal at Cedars restaurant, service was excellent, exceptional, quality superb, fantastic evening
Helpful considerate staff. Very tastefully converted manor house retaining much of it's original charm

Revekka was my mums therapist but my mum isn’t very good with technology so she wanted me to write this review for her. She said it was the best massage she has ever received in her life and she has had many! Revekka was very kind and really made her feel comfortable. Fatima the spa attendant was also very kind and always went out of her way to help. Monika in the spa lounge was so so attentive and provided the best service.
Menu change food not like before

reviews.text: Did not go

All I can say is WOW! My family and I loved staying at this property. Everything was excellent (rooms, food, pool, spa, views, etc). Also, special shout out to Stewart and Norman for making us feel so welcome immediately upon check-in.
The langley hotel
Beautiful grounds, fantastic food and outstanding service. Be careful booking via the Fork though as the bookings don't always go through!
Espetacular
reviews.textTranslated: Amazing

reviews.text: Fantastic
What a beautiful place
Marvellous experience staff couldn’t have been more helpful
Excellent hotel all around, highly recommend it.
Great experience - Spa was amazing as were treatments

Spent 2 nights at the Langley for a family celebration event. Driving into the hotel along the tree lined private road was very pleasing. The welcome was top notch with front of house staff making us feel very relaxed and cared for. Our room was luxurious - with every attention paid to the smallest detail. Sky TV included for those who don’t want to leave their room. Food was excellent, so was the service. 
 
I used the gym which was surprisingly fully equipped for a hotel gym! We spent time in the pool, jacuzzi and sauna. 

The hotel is set in very scenic surroundings, where you can go on walks taking in the flora and fauna. 

All in all, a very enjoyable stay. If you’re looking to treat yourself and get away for a weekend or so, the Langley hits the spot.

Stayed here after our holiday for a place to relax and recharge before heading home.
From checking in to checking out our experience has been perfect and we will definitely be back! Special mention to Alex at the bar and Sam the local for making us feel welcome and for such a brilliant night!
Looks fabulous 👌

reviews.text: I wouldn’t stay at this hotel again and I wouldn’t recommend it. It feels like somewhere that is trying to be as cool as The Standard, but is failing on all points. The lobby is ok, the bar and restaurant areas are nicely decorated, which we could see clearly because over a space that could host 300 people there was one table of 3. It had zero atmosphere, which you could say was because it was a Sunday, but that’s just not true of that area anymore - the other side of Liv St st. is always buzzing. As one of the other reviews said, the rooms have tried to be too clever for their own good, the humble bedside lamps flicker because the control panels, situated everywhere and will keep you awake, must need some kind of mad charge that simpler things don’t. We tried for 20 mins to close one of our blinds using said panel, which stuttered down the window about 1/5 of the way before we gave up and accepted it was broken. The Junior Suite is a decent size, good bathtub, but current expectations for 5* are sorely lacking. The Bang & Olufsen TV is 00’s style over substance and is like having your first freeview box 15 years ago. The remote was rancid - god knows how many years of grime were in those buttons. Toiletries nothing to write home about and are hugely wasteful single use plastic and synthetic feeling/ scented. Staff lacklustre and unhelpful, spa facilities not all in use - and been closed for at least 2 weeks so not a priority to get up and running for guests who have booked hoping to use spa facilities - cost of living affecting everyone, I guess. There are far superior hotels in this area and I would definitely give this place a miss. In my view it's barely a 3* let alone 4* and not even close to a 5*.
Lovely bar staff

I had an extremely disappointing experience during my stay at the South Place Hotel in London, which is advertised as a luxurious five-star establishment. My experience was far from the expectations associated with such a rating.

Upon our arrival at the hotel, we were taken aback when we were asked to pay a deposit of 125 euros. This was surprising because I had already paid for our room using my Amex card through their online booking system. However, to our dismay, when it came time to place the deposit, we were informed that they did not accept Amex. This was frustrating, but what made matters worse was the receptionist's insensitive comment. The gentleman, who had a receding hairline, condescendingly remarked, "You do realize you need to enter the correct code." This comment was not only unhelpful but also humiliating.

Our experience continued to deteriorate throughout our stay. The hotel was hosting a wedding event at the same time, which led to several disruptions. Throughout the night, boisterous wedding guests repeatedly banged on our door, making it impossible to get a good night's sleep. While I understand that weddings can be festive affairs, this level of disturbance was unacceptable for a purportedly upscale hotel.

The following morning, due to our sleep-deprived state, I called the reception to request a late check-out, asking for an extension until 12:30 instead of the standard 12:00. This request was reasonable given the circumstances, but it was met with reluctance and a lack of understanding from the hotel staff.

The most distressing incident occurred upon check-out. We had left our seven bags in the hotel's storage area while we explored the city. However, when we returned later in the afternoon, eager to catch a train, we were handed only six of our bags. It took me a moment to realize the missing bag was my briefcase, which contained sensitive documents and my laptop. When we initially entrusted our bags to the hotel, I had explicitly emphasized the importance of handling the briefcase with utmost care. To my shock and dismay, the same receptionist who had taken and returned our bags asserted, "Sir, I can assure you that we did not receive a briefcase from you." This statement sent me into a panic, as the briefcase was vital for my work. In my state of distress, which must have been evident, I implored her to recheck. Reluctantly, she walked towards the storage room, and after an agonizing wait, she reemerged with my briefcase. This entire episode left me feeling highly anxious and frustrated.

In light of these numerous disappointments and inconveniences, I firmly believe that I deserve a refund of approximately £350 as compensation for the subpar service and the anxiety I experienced during my stay at the South Place Hotel. This level of service is not in line with the standards expected of a five-star hotel, and I hope that my feedback will prompt improvements in the future.
Didn’t stay for the night. Just conference, but was pleasantly surprised how good it was.
Attended a meeting/conference at the staff were very friendly and helpful, faculties were clean and well-sign posted and the catering was excellent!

Saturday Night stay. Location good for Spitalfields Market, seeing some of City buildings. Hotel modern, design led sadly by idiot designer. Good size rooms, ridiculous touch sensitive controls for lights, some of which seem impossible to turn off at night. Triumph of design over function.
Very pleasant staff, we enjoyed our stay.

This is an okay hotel, but definitely not 5-star. There are many flaws: room lights switches itself off all the time, Airco stops working whilst not on the auto or eco setting, showering in the bathtub, £5 for a bottle of work sitting on the desk, more. Price, quality not in balance!
Pleasant experience, attentive staff.
Room is just ok, Wi-Fi signal poor, no view, also expensive, not worth it.   Also, got haunting experience!
Would recommend this place to anyone. Everything you would ever need , even a dyson hair dryer . Staff went above and beyond to help with anything.

Stayed here 4 nights, checked out 8/31/2023, the staff was amazing! Staff was extremely helpful, Anna and Haytam where stellar! Very nice location, close to underground, Liverpool Street and Moorgate. Room (301) was very roomy, clean, large shower. Cleaning staff was available almost instantly when we asked for additional water or lotion, etc.. The breakfasts where a la carte, everything we ordered was very well prepared, glad we had the breakfast option included. Nice restaurants in the building along with a few very busy and good pubs very nearby. Will definitely stay here again.
Very much a 5 star hotel offering 5 star experience 👍

There were 3 of us - we ordered an overly expensive Rose Mirabeau wine at £48. I asked for an ice bucket.  We got the ineffective wine cooler and some ice cubes. No offer of water like other bars. He poured out 3 large glasses which always annoys me particularly when the wine is not properly cooled. We topped up the rest ourselves. A large Arab family with children installed themselves right next to us, using our chairs with help from the waiter. We were unable due the noise to continue our conversation so we moved. We moved the glasses, the hopeless cooler and the unreplenished ice cubes ourselves. There was plenty of room in the bar but no one helped us. He only managed to pour out the very last drop of wine of course because he wanted us to order another.
For this great service they added on 15% £7.20 for service which was non existent.  I was with clients so I did not challenge it. So the bill was £55.20 for a warm bottle of average wine.
We won't be going back

I do not recommend this place as a five-star hotel. big leak in the ceiling which is star dropping on our clothing and backpack. And the restroom mirror was broke from the side and they charge 250 for the glass of 20 cm mirror.
Fantastic hotel, beautiful rooms, amazing staff who cannot do enough for you! Great central location, absolutely loved it 😊
Amazing stylish hotel in this perfect location. I had few meetings here so far and i could not to share this review with all of you

Absolutely loved our stay here. I think the photo's on the website (and the website itself) need an update, because in reality the hotel and room looked so much better. The bathroom in particular was so lovely as well. Staff was also super friendly, the young woman at the reception with straight bangs and long reddish brown hair deserves a raise, she went above and beyond.
I had a beard trim at Ted's Grooming Room up the road whilst my son and my wife had glasses of wine here...to echo an earlier review..ok it's London...but expensive.
Nice modern room.

Terrible experience for my wife and I. Our TV does not work. Our shower door does not close. Our bathroom had no fresh toilet paper. When we asked for more to be brought, a nearly finished roll was delivered to us. Our Air Conditioning does not stay on despite setting at temperature. It instead turns to off after the motor runs for a bit. We went to the front desk to ask for assistance but unfortunately they only have specific windows when they can service their guests. Very unfortunate to call this a 5 star hotel…terrible customer service
I went for an event, central place, well connected, good food, I liked it.
A good place for a weekend in London which is close to transport and plenty of restaurants.
An okay venue, but plenty more better in this region
Very kind personnel! Thank you gentlemen from the reception for helping me so much! I was lost without you!! Strongly advised!
Just had a few drinks. Nice location. Perfect for a casual drink with mates in a comfortable environment.  Bit pricey though, over £15.50 for a Jack and Coke.

Nice room, great location for Broadgate Circle - however the gym has old and dirty equipment and having just received the invoice which includes a £50 intimacy kit charge for which no explanation has been given I would avoid - the customer service that surrounds the booking is pretty shocking
Hotel na wysokim poziomie obsługa profesjonalnia,miła .Pokój wypełni wyposażony w różne udogodnienia.Śniadania przepyszne.W pełni polecam
reviews.textTranslated: Hotel at a high level, professional and nice service. The room will be filled with various amenities. Delicious breakfasts. I fully recommend

reviews.text: Hotel spełnił moje oczekiwania wysoki standard  miła obsługa. Śniadanie rewelacja 🌟 Dziękujemy  za miłe  przywitanie szampanem
reviews.textTranslated: The hotel met my expectations high standard friendly service. Breakfast sensational 🌟 Thank you for the nice welcome with champagne

reviews.text: Great venue for corporate events. Spring and summery vibes. Really lovely staff
Very nice place
the worst ever hotel, do not stay here. terrible management and unethical policies.
Very bad hotel, don't stay here. Horrible customer service and lying management that seeks to steal money for services not rendered.

We had a reservation here that we requested to cancel when my dad got COVID. The hotel refused to cancel the booking, suggesting guests should stay here when they have COVID. They went on to lie about how they handled this. Very dishonest, do not book here.

We had a booking here for my husband’s work trip through a third party site. When he got COVID, we submitted a cancellation request, which the hotel did not respond to. They have since been unwilling to issue a refund for the cancelled stay, as apparently their policy is that guests with COVID should stay at the hotel. The manager with whom we were in contact was dishonest about the whole dealing and has completely stopped responding whatsoever. We highly recommend you steer clear of this cheat establishment unless you want to live alongside sick guests and deal with dishonest management.
Only visited for lunch. Food fine, had to send wine back it was corked, and over warm! Second glass was fine, no offer of bread had to request this to go with the marrow bone.
Really enjoyed my stay here with my son. Fantastic service from every member of staff we came into contact with. Breakfast is excellent. Room is quiet and very comfortable
25 quid for a single g&t and a Guinness. Nothing wrong with them except the price.

Only giving a star at all because the room was nice, however unfortunately this really doesn't make up for the dreadful service and we would definitely not stay again. On arrival we were told our booking could not be found, we showed confirmation email and booking reference but still could not be found. After some time we were then told our booking was there but under a different name, one that didn't match our details on booking. There was no apology for this mistake on their behalf. Our room wasn't ready, so we checked in and came back later. When we came back we were handed a key card, not told what room number or how to find the room or any details on breakfast the next day which we had paid for or details on checking out. Ultimately there was no communication and no welcoming/friendly experience from staff. Breakfast the next day was no better, we had to ask for drinks and then waited over half an hour for a relatively simple breakfast in a very quiet restaurant. Lots of extras in the room, but most have to be paid for in addition to the cost of the room, which we felt overall was not worth the price.

This was my second stay at the South Place Hotel, and most certainly will not be my last. My wife and I came to London for a New Years Eve getaway. After looking at a lot of other hotels in London, we had decided nothing looked as good as what we experienced at this hotel during our prior stay. This hotel is away from a lot of the hustle and bustle of London, but that is part of what makes it so special. The rooms are spacious and clean. There are a lot of places in London that have a good location and room quality, but I think what really sets the South Place Hotel apart is the quality of it's staff. Everyone we encountered was extremely helpful and kind, from the staff at the front desk to the waiters at the Chop House restaurant that is connected to the downstairs lobby. I want to give a special shout out to one of the bartenders that had taken care of us at 3 Bar (also located within the hotel lobby). Santiago was probably the best hotel bartenders I have ever come across. In fact, bartender is probably an insult. He is more of a mixologist. We were totally blown away with the drinks that he made for us. After a few rounds, he had made some suggestions of other drinks to try based off what we were drinking. He knocked it out of the park with every single drink, so much so that I had to get a few of his recipes so that I could make them at home. We ended up not bothering to drink at outside bars or restaurants because the best bar we had found was right downstairs from our hotel room.

High prices, based on location some will say it's okay

Good service, good food, lovely atmosphere
Fabulous 7 course taster menu. A must try.
Great hotel overall
We were in the bar area. Location is very central and bar looks nice. Service a little slow but very nice. My food was good (smoked salmon), I didn't like the beetroot salad.
Ok hotel na dobroj lokaciji
reviews.textTranslated: Ok hotel in a good location

reviews.text: Our stay the south place hotel was incredible. The staff were extremely attentive and nothing was ever to much. The rooms are well appointed with luxurious amenities. Great small gym. The restaurant food was awesome and the bar was allot of fun. A big thank you to Santiago, Naomi & Arif all great assets to the hotel team. Thank you for making us feel so welcome.

Service was excellent. Welcoming was excellent. Very nice rooms. Front desk staff were impeccable. A person called Luca helped us out. Luca was very kind, nice and helpful. They need more staff like him who help the customer nicely with a smile

Avoid avoid avoid.

We paid many, many thousands for a Christmas meal here. The service was awful, the food options incredibly limited (turkey, or vegetarian?), the food quality average at best, the drinks options insultingly poor (oh no, this bottle on the back bar isn’t for sale to you), and the wine I’d be disappointed at for a tenner. I’m disgusted at for the £50 we’re charged.

Pretty expensive all things considered but thought I’d give it a go. All the furniture in the rooms is “futuristic but back in 2005” - after turning on the TV I couldn’t figure out how to turn it off again, and it took ages to figure out how to close the blinds to block out the bright street lights outside, and after that I had a pretty annoying 20 minutes trying to figure out how to turn off all the lights. Avoid unless you’re into spending lots of money to sleep in your own personal escape room…
Great ambience and sophistication
great location. stylish. room was luxurious and clean, staff are amazing.  breakfast was delicious.  hope to stay again, thank you

Nicely presented room with modern comforts: coffee machine, mini bar, safe, slippers and dressing gown etc. but no view at all. Service in bar and Chop House restaurant very poor eg. Not asked if we want more drinks and given spoon to eat cheese. Most staff seem very inexperienced and for this reason it's not the feel of staying in a top hotel but is superficially very smart.
Very classy, comfy hotel. Lots of space (for London), modern with friendly staff and excellent lobby restaurant
Great Location between Moorgate and Liverpool Street. Good food, comfortable chairs, good talks

I had interview for  waitress with restaurant manager today.she was late and even did not give any excuse.For the whole interview ,she even didn‘’t give a smile.I cannot feel any professionalism from her.I even don't know how she can provide good service for guests，by her impolite and serious face and tone？
Crazy expensive but nice

Very nice hotel, 2 minutes walking from Moorgate tube station. The hotel has two bars / lounges on the ground floor, and a Michelin star restaurant on the roof. The team is very welcoming, the elevators are large, and the rooms quite nice. What I liked most is the presence of an iron which allowed me to have a well ironed shirt the following day. The bed is large, and there are many drawers with a lot of space for arranging knees own stuff

Stayed on a ‘package deal’ (£550ish; room, tasting dinner & breakfast) - it seemed to be the same cost as room, tasting menu and breakfast separately so for ease I just booked that option.

Whilst the room was great, I found the staff very condescending.

Our main frustration was that we didn’t get the full tasting menu experience, only 5-dishes. It seems like for the package you don’t get everything included, frustrating as this was the main reason we booked our stay.  Additionally, the front of house staff hadn’t reviewed our booking with us or given us the chance to spend additional so we could get the full experience.

We left feeling like second class citizens, which I know sounds a bit dramatic with everything that is going on in the world but the way we were treated just didn’t measure up to what we had seen online.

I hate to leave a slightly negative review, but I wouldn’t go back.

Despite this, the saving grace of the hotel is that the restaurant; the food we did have was delicious - and you can certainly see why it is so highly rewarded.
Located in the city. Hotel for corporate clientele. Busy bar. The Reception team are friendly and helpful. Parking is tricky to find close to the hotel. Lots bars and restaurants close to the hotel.
Great hotel

Stayed 2 nights. Quality of the room was fantastic. Air con works well, great bed, great bathroom, all modern controls. There were some fairly obvious scrapes on doors + floor. Gym is great. Service is a little dry, but the manager of the restaurant, and the women at the front desk of the restaurant were great, everyone else didn’t seem to care. Food is really poor for the price point. Lift card doesn’t always work. You’d come here for the atmosphere and to be seen, not for the service or food quality.
I had a terrible experience. The management is unable to provide a solution when the room is clearly defective and doesn’t make any commercial gesture to make up for the mistake.
We had a product launch there yesterday. Great venue with lovely inner garden

We had booked for an event to take place at the hotel on 21 June 2022, but the worst public transport strikes in the UK since 1989 mean that unfortunately nobody can get there. The hotel does not consider this to be a good enough reason, not covered under force majeure, are refusing to be flexible and are taking 100% cancellation fee - even with an offer of additional dates booked. Do not recommend as an events venue.
Visited the bar late night and the kitchen closes at 10pm which is a bummer. We ordered the cold sandwiches which were edible but wouldn’t be back. Bartenders were very hospitable and friendly!

reviews.text: It was such an amazing experience. Staff super friendly, the food and drinks delicious and the environment very calm and relaxing. Can definitely recommend.
Great hotel in wonderful location.
Amazing service and mouthwatering food

Overall the facilities in the hotel are nice, but I had hoped for more. The room we were in (Deluxe King) was not one of the rooms pictured on the website. And personally, I found our room’s decor to be somewhat outdated and had a cramped feeling because the ceilings were quite low. The other issue I came across was that the hot water in the bath/shower was very difficult to control and at times would suddenly become scalding hot. There also seemed to be a nest of pigeons right outside the room and so early in the morning (5am) we were woken up by the squawking. There were some nice touches to the experience, like a welcome-box of shortbread cookies which were delicious  and sweets at turn down. Finally, location-wise, if you are looking to take public transport, it is a bit of a walk to the nearest underground. There is a bus that goes by but it’s quite slow.

Impeccable British hospitality. I genuinely feel like I've been served...the Sage Bar has best cocktails, recommend Chasing Dreams. Doorman is helpful, funny and always smiling. I got the very BEST concierge treatment. Front desk was exceptional. Was upgraded to Tudor Suite without even asking. I'll be back...with friends!

The staff here are experts in hospitality, the best of the best. We enjoyed our stay here very much. From walking into the hotel, we felt welcomed and taken care of. After checking in, we were given a tour of the hotel, and were offered welcome drinks. The entire team was very professional and knowledgeable. They were always just a phone call away and would get your requests sorted. The amount of attention they put into the little details really made this place stand out.

If you are looking for a home away from home, this is it!

Outstanding customer service. Started our honeymoon trip here and the staff and facilities were amazing. A special shout-out out to Steven, the kindest concierge/door man, for the most welcoming/warmest person during our stay. We loved your top hat too! Thank you for making us feel so special and helping us hail a cab.  -The Jays

I wanted to commend the professionalism of the staff in particular the empathy when we were affected by late flight cancellation. They understood our frustration and offered their best support for extra day accommodation and even champagne helping us distress. Their caring and smiley faces made a big difference in  customer experience during our stay.
Great service

Wonderful service and breakfast.
Always  a pleasant experience. We love that the staff are like family to us. Every room we have experienced are always comfortable and pleasant

Beautiful hotel with lots of history and character. The service is excellent.
The restaurant and Pub should not be overlooked.
Good nice very clean and good people

I grew up in London and now live in Marin County, California. We came to the Milestone for our 50th anniversary. Our experience at the milestone was outstanding. The room and facilities were first class. What really stood out was the personnel and the service. These people were so gracious, knowledgeable and helpful. We will never forget the service and kindness we were shown. I could name people but I’m concerned I’d miss someone. Location was a real plus. Right across from Hyde Park and its beautiful gardens and paths. If possible try two of their recommendations, Memories of India, and the Chinese restaurant atop the Royal Gardens hotel across the street. Get the Beijing duck. Unforgettable. A+++ for the Milestone.
Wonderful classic hotel in my local neighbourhood.  Meet friends here for their great coffee, super home baked biscuits , very friendly and courteous staff.

A truly stunning Hotel with outstanding service.

The entire staff didn't miss a beat at the Milestone !
From being warmly greeted upon our arrival via airport transfer to front of house staff, conceirge team, breakfast and restaurant staff ... all were of a high level, customer focused but with a certain calmness and warm attitidue which never left us feeling like we were just a number within the Hotel.

We were initially taken aback but then very appreciative to recieve a generous room upgrade for our stay as a family of three which was a split level that was beautifully and elegantly styled, very quiet ( considering if overlooked Kensington Gardens with the main road below ) along with being well appointed, generous size on both levels of the room and very comfortable.

The decor & styling throughout the Hotel encourages you in a way to go for a wander and discover what the next hallway shows ( for example ) or what the next main room has been styled like along with the cool artwork situated throughout. We felt this keept us engaged and feeling comfortable within the Hotel.

The Breakfast was plentiful and could be well catered for any requests & we did also book in ( and would highly recommend ) the Sunday Roast in their restaurant also !

It was an incredible stay and we can't thank the staff enough for making it so.
The afternoon tea here is really good. The person who served us was really helpful
Came in 2022 and had a great stay. Price is quite high. Felt like a place to call home for my trip!

Words cannot fully describe the superb service and facilities of the Milestone Hotel. We (my 2 daughters, my husband, and I) were treated like royalty. The staff is polite and courteous, friendly, polite, and helpful. I like to thank everyone and give a special thanks to the concierge J. He was able to find a candy that my daughter was looking to get in London. I also like to thank everyone who greeted us and provided us with an amazing hospitality with a smile every time. Afternoon tea is incredible.

We had afternoon tea there, the service, environment and food were all good, you can refill food as well, but they will only give one set of sandwiches and pastries for 2 people to share when asked for a refill. the teapot was leaking when I tried to pour more tea, so I think they should renew some of their teapots.
Very clean

My girlfriend and I had an lovely time in the bar two days ago. We were sat in the conservatory where atmosphere is genuinely cozy. Especially I would like to praise Viki (our server). She made sure that we were looked after warmly. Her presence made us super welcomed and engaged throughout our whole experience; clearly a person with great knowledge in hospitality and bar industry as such. Drinks were super delicious too. I would recommend the strawberry one, Viki's own cocktail (Matcha, if I am pronouncing it right), and chilli sour.

Thank you Viki once again, and we hope to see you in the future.

Stayed 7 days in Residence 6.

Service: The service is clearly top notch.  There was never a moment that someone was not available to answer a question and they answered it well. One time over 7 days I was slightly disappointed and that was only because I was trying to order food after the posted end time on bar food when room service was available. Really, a me problem.

Location: I had not stayed in Kensington before.  I had always stayed to the East in central London. Had no idea what I was missing. Great experience. Less tourism and more high end living.

Room: so hard for us with two parents and 4 kids.  But the room delivered.  It involved a cot only because we got offensive lineman children.  I slept in three different beds (parents) and all were great. I had to navigate to find the perfect flat pillow (stomach sleeper) (me problem).

I could not have been happier with our stay and deeply thank all the staff (so many good people).  We will be back and maybe next time for a month. Week was not enough.

Thank you Laura Madrid for again finding an epic place for us. You impress everywhere we go.
Very nice hotel. Excellent service. Perfect location for exploring Kensington Palace and the London Musuems.

We had a walk in breakfast in Milestone few days ago, so we’re not one of those guests who could get room upgrades or chocolate covered strawberries in case of a dissatisfaction which is a norm in hotels in Kensington area.
Being someone retired from this sector, and as a writer now, I couldn’t keep myself from writing this review.
During our breakfast, there was a constant panic mode in the restaurant and tense feeling; even though the staff was trying to do their best. It was very obvious that the staff was under pressure and suffering during their marathon in and out of the kitchen, and to the other room they serve breakfast, to bring the food as fast as they could.
We could see them sweating, miserable.
You can also hear the constant banging and some crashing kind of noise from the kitchen.
These all give you a sad, as well as a rush feeling which tells you to finish and leave.
Milestone is serving a good breakfast, but I don’t think people like us who are neighbors would enjoy it when it was obvious that they don’t take care of the wellbeing of their employees. Everyone knows that this sector is suffering and if you want to see why it is suffering arrange a visit to Milestone for breakfast.
Good luck to all those amazing women that served us.
Fanatiskt afternon tea, en examensgåva till en vän som precis blev klar med sin läkarutbildning. Blev en girls weekend till London.
reviews.textTranslated: Fanatic afternoon tea, a graduation present for a friend who just finished medical school. Was a girls' weekend to London.

reviews.text: I had a lovely impromptu visit and dined in the Stables bar. Angelo bar manager made it a point to address myself and all clients by their names and gave a very personal and attentive  service. Excellent customer service thank you 😊

This hotel is superb-from the staff, service, food, atmosphere, rooms, and the facilities- 10/10. I am a travel agent from the states, and I will be sure to recommend this hotel to all my clients. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to experience London charm, it will be one of the best decisions you made in coming to London! Thank you Andrew and the Milestone staff for everything!

I will never stay anywhere else in London after our stay. The milestone hotel was OUTSTANDING. Our room was beautiful, great location, but most importantly the staff were top notch. They were the main reason our stay was so fabulous. We appreciate everything they did and will return very soon! Highly highly recommend!!!
The High Tea was a great experience.
Lovely weekend hotel, a superb little restaurant with snug bar. Attentive staff. Great location for an art event across the street in the park.

This is a grand old hotel.  Frome the first day we walked in, it felt friendly.  Everyone was friendly and fun. Steve (the Doorman), Steve (concierge), Dino, Renato, Tim (the Doorman), Grant, Fran, and Claire were some of the funnest. The afternoon tea was grand, and their signature sandwich was very tasty.  Compliments to the Chef.  This is one of the places that we will try to come back to.
PASSENGERS lovedit6

This place is truly special, they know how to look after you! From the moment you stepped in you feel a sense of belongings. Met with some of my favourite people: Pranav, Tom and of course Mr Pike. It was all worth going back! Many thanks ND
Slice of English luxury
I was only in the stable bar. It was beautifully decorated and cosy. Fantastic drinks.
Had tea and cake .Nice little hotel . Reccomend the cheese cake
Nice hotel

Unreal service and hospitality. All the staff is professional, helpful, and ready to adjust and accommodate. Bartenders and servers in the Stables Bar are dope as hell. If you're reading this, go here, be your full rich and fancy self, tip the staff more than you think you should. You have it, they deserve it, simple as that.
We had tea at this hotel and it was a wonderful experience. We will return.

A really great and unique boutique hotel. Exclusive interior. Really outstanding service from check in to check out. Even the cleaning lady comes several times a day. The evening turndown service with candle in the bathroom was really nice.
Also the breakfast is absolutely recommendable and everything was really delicious. Especially the vegetarian selection.

We would really recommend anyone looking for a special hotel in London to stay here.

The only criticism is the dinner (a la carte). Here we had the feeling that the prices are a bit too expensive for what you get. Wine prices are absolutely fine. But especially the vegetarian selection is not very large. And with a fructose intolerance it becomes difficult. The staff has always tried to find a solution however. Nevertheless, for what you get compared to other exclusive and Michelin star restaurants around the world, it is simply too expensive.
Came here for old fashioneds and was not disappointed. Will be back!

From the moment we arrived the service was outstanding. And I mean outstanding. The staff are obviously well trained in provided an excellent customer experience. And they do it in a cool London way. If you know you know. I have absolutely nothing to fault and would highly recommend 👌🏽👍🏽

cozy hotel , the staff are so friendly
its an old hotel but its clean and everything was great in my visit 👍🏻
unfortunately I didn’t take some pictures
Afternoon tea was lovely - amazing service and attention to detail. Delicious food and knowledgable staff. Definitely recommend.
Fantastic hotel. Friendly professional staff and really great location.
One star off because pre paid fruit bowl was missing on arrival. And breakfast fruit bowl was sour, unripe. The yoghurt was served in a pudding bowl.

The afternoon tea here is one of the best experiences you can have in London. They have a variety of different themed rooms for you to dine in so you can have a new environment each time you visit. Their menu is flexible as long as you give enough notice for any dietary restrictions.
One star off because the fruit bowl requested wasn't there. The fruit was unripe when it did come, and the fruit salad for breakfast was sour.
Wonderful Christmas💗🎄

Everything is perfect about the hotel.
Service is like 100 stars, not just 5.
One of my favorites great old school lunch too in elegant restaurant

Absolutely fabulous hotel with an exceptional afternoon tea and London’s hidden gem, the Stables Bar with a cocktail menu to rival anywhere in the capital. The Milestone is as quintessentially English as it comes and the service is always five star.
Right outside Hyde park. Accessible to the tube so you can visit everything in London. Great, friendly service.
Best location, incredible service. Thanks.
Tea time 🫖
Really good hotel!

We stayed at the milestone for two whole weeks. And to be Frank I was a bit skeptical staying for a long period of time in a hotel that’s new to us. However, this hotel exceeded every single expectations we had. It’s a nice British boutique hotel, with a fantastic location and an outstanding service and staff. Every single employee we encountered went above and beyond to make sure we are satisfied with our stay. Everyone was so friendly, professional and helpful. Their afternoon tea was to die for as well. We had few requests prior to our stay, and when we arrived the staff made sure everything is in order to our liking. This is a true 5 stars hotel. We can’t wait to go back!
Superb! Excellent! The best!

There was a small mishap in my reservation, but the staff was so accommodating and kind, I was never worried about my stay there. Truly a 5-star hotel in my opinion. Staff was super friendly, helpful, and kind. The room was amazing…luxurious, beautiful, posh. Turndown service every evening with candies left on the bed. As a woman traveling alone, they made me feel safe, welcome, and looked after.

Champagne afternoon tea service was amazing!! Be prepared to eat a lot. Tea was fantastic…I miss it already.

Dinner at Chenestons was ok. The food was well prepared, but the choices on the menu weren’t anything I was excited about.

Cocktails in the lounge were the finest! Angelo is an amazing mixologist; incredibly creative and knowledgeable in his craft. Their smoked old fashioned is a must have. And ask Claire to make a hot toddy…you won’t be disappointed!

The breakfast was equally amazing as the tea service. I had the smoked salmon scrambled eggs on toast. So delicious!

The hotel is right across from Hyde Park which has numerous walking paths for a leisurely stroll after breakfast or afternoon tea. If it’s a rainy day, their doorman will set you up with one of their umbrellas.

The concierge staff was very helpful and kind. One man asked for reservations for somewhere that served beef Wellington for him and his wife. The concierge called around, found a restaurant, checked on available reservations, let the guest know, and booked it for him. They'll call taxis for you, set up tours, etc. Excellent customer service!

We had drinks at the Milestone hotel bar and the experience was top notch. The mixologists  Angelo and Lilio made the experience extremely special. Their knowledge and passion for cocktails is superb. We'll be back!
Sat at the bar with Angelo and Lilo, we had an evening to remember. Thanks to the Italian duo for the cocktail experience 🙌
My daughter and I had afternoon tea today. What a lovely experience. The staff were amazing. Will definatly be back soon. Thank you so much

A fantastic stay, not only a hotel but an experience. For once we are not in a international, tasteless hotel but a realy british style hotel. I loved the decoration, i really enjoyed the quality of the employee very polite and always here to help with a slight "old british style" which i really enjoyed. A big thanks to the team.

The Milestone hotel was my home during Notting Hill Carnival 2022. I‘m glad I found this small jewel, which is as luxurious as it is cozy. My room was very beautiful, clean and tidy. The daily cleaning was very attentive and thorough. The interior is stylish and beautiful
The 24/7 room service with delicous dishes saved me sometimes when I got back hungry. Next time I hope to explore more of the culinary possibilities as they look promising, but during Carnival I was often just exhausted when returning or too late.
The Spa is basic. There is a Finnish sauna and a pool with a counter-current system. It‘s definitely not a wellness hotel, but completely ok to relax a bit. Thanks to the exceptional service, they managed to organise a wonderful sports massage on a Sunday at very short notice for a very limited time slot. This was more that you can expect and it really saved me so I was fit for the Monday parade.
The best thing at the end. The exceptionally friendly and attentive service, which I have never experienced in this way before combined with a big dash of British charm.
Thanks to everybody there and I really hope to return soon. I can absolutely recommend the Milestone.
فندق خمسة نجوم كلاسيك
reviews.textTranslated: Classic five star hotel

reviews.text: Amazing service and cakes, all the staff were very friendly
Best afternoon tea in London
We had Afternoon Tea in the Tea Room. Awesome experience. Staff was very friendly and took great care of us. Thank you for our great experience having Afternoon Tea!
Afternoon tea

A truly *perfect* hotel experience, with some of the warmest, most personal service we have ever received! We stayed in July/August for five nights, dined in the restaurant and also had afternoon tea.

There are so many things to celebrate about this gem of a property -- a generous room upgrade, fantastic breakfast in the beautiful Cheneston's, above-and-beyond turndown service -- but one fun anecdote in particular: my son mentioned to one of the staff members that his birthday fell during our trip and we would be taking a steam train outing to celebrate. We returned home on his birthday evening to a birthday cake, a steam train toy, and a very sweet personalized birthday card signed by 15 of the staff. My son was so overjoyed and felt really special! We've barely departed but our whole family cannot wait to return. We love staying in different properties when we return to cities, but in London we will absolutely come back to the Milestone!
Ashwini should get a raise for keeping up positive spirits
Beautiful hotel in a fantastic location. Staff were super friendly (especially the door staff) thank you
Beautiful hotel, amazing service, we had a great stay, staff was very welcoming. Highly recommend!
Лучший отель в Лондоне! Спасибо!
reviews.textTranslated: Best hotel in London! Thank you!

reviews.text: Wonderful hotel, great staff breakfast is fantastic. Just felt so welcome.

The best high/afternoon tea you will get anywhere! The atmosphere was next level, very intimate, quiet, and relaxed. The staff are exceptional and the food was simply delicious. This has to be the best hidden gem in london!

title: Great Fosters - part of The Alexander Hotel Collection

similarHotelsNearby.name: The Runnymede on Thames Hotel and Spa
Foxhills Country Club – Golf Club & Resort

reviews.text: Starting with the very warm & helpful front staff. Specially Kazi helped us throughout from the beginning to end . Helped my handicapped mother to get inside the Hotel, to find the ladies also get in the car at the end .  Bless him. Excellent garden views. Other staffs were all very pleasant too. We used to live on this road and stayed at the hotel for a week for the Hampton Court Flower Show and to visit old haunts and friends before. This time was for the afternoon tea . It was little slow service but enjoyed.

Visited Great Fosters for an afternoon tea. Welcomed at the door and shown to the very homely afternoon room. We were shown to the last table available, which denotes its popularity. Made our choice of hot drink and then delighted in a glass of champagne as our beautifully arrayed tea tower was put before us.  Sandwiches, scones, patisseries all perfect. The icing on the cake was a gentle stroll around the amazing gardens.  Knott gardens, Saxon moats, sunken tea Garden, rustic arched wooden Bridge over reflective water. You need to see it in person to appreciate what dedication and love has been spent on this place.

Stunning hotel, with hundreds of years of history.  Beautiful grounds.  Delicious Sunday lunch, with two good slabs of beef, roast parsnip, roast potatoes, carrots, greens, cauliflower cheese and a big Yorkshire pudding.
Top notch service! Great hotel and food
Booked a function room and found everyone very attentive and helpful throughout from first enquiry through to afternoon tea and staff member bringing "lost property" down to car park..

(+)

• Service was very good! The guys at the bar are super nice and friendly.

• The hotel is beautiful; nice terraces, bars, and gardens.

• EV chargers available

(-)

• The breakfast was massively underwhelming and it’s not worth £20 whatsoever.

• The spa was fully booked on Saturday and shutdown on Sunday which doesn’t make any sense.

• Pillows are super uncomfortable and too high, I couldn’t sleep well.
We attended a wedding here and it was beautiful.. the setting, staff, and food were all brilliant..! 👍
Beautiful building and garden 👍🏻Nice rooms.Service was ok but food Could be much better.
Great place, lovely food and very friendly staff.

Exceptional Hotel
The standard and service of this hotel is high quality the history of this building is enough to appreciate were you actually are. With outstanding service from the staff it provides a must stay if you like to be waited on hand and foot. If your a polite and curtious person, it's a mirror imagine of that, i recommend this hotel as King Henry thought it was okay also.
Scott Ruttley
Terrible experience. Staff fighting in front of guests made us just want to leave. We couldn't wait to get out.
Fuimos a tomar el té. Excelente servicio. Ambiente distinguido y atención muy cordial. Maravillosos jardines.
reviews.textTranslated: We went to have tea. Excellent service. Distinguished atmosphere and very cordial attention. Wonderful gardens.

reviews.text: Our agent booked us at Great Fosters for the night as we connected from Gatwick to Heathrow. With no expectations we were completely charmed by the architecture, history, English country garden  beauty, the decor and mostly, above all, the staff who were to a man/woman, friendly, helpful, obliging, kind and best of all, had senses of humour. We look forward to returning on future trips to and through London to this exquisite oasis.
Food  was great. Management was terrible, front of house so rude. I left and will never go back
Did an afternoon tea, was ok

You pay 5* prices and get 4* service, at a push. We were checked in late and had to wait about, they 'hoped,' they could get us a pool towel or even an extra towel.
Taps and coffee machine were broken.

However, a lovely pool- but very busy. Beautiful setting.
They charge enough, you should get what you pay for!

We had a confirmed booking with Great Fosters for several months. It was booked for a special occasion and we had made plans to have dinner at the hotel for a celebration. Two days before arrival hotel cancelled due to overbooking without any apology or effort to ensure we had alternative accommodation. Over booking while you have a confirmed booking is not acceptable and is very poor service. My party was very disappointed with this outcome and the total lack of any consideration from the hotel. We planned that stay for a long time and the disrespect and disregard to the plans we have made was v disappointing. We shall not be using this group of hotels again.

Very nice hotel, restaurant was very uncomfortable as the evening was very warm but no Aircon in the restaurant, £48 for a streak!!!! Food was good but extremely over priced, reception was very inconsistent information from receptionist changed from one to another, was charged on my account for a service that already had been paid, was told manager would investigate but never heard from anyone.

Pool towels had poo marks on them and need upgrading, Not sure if I would go back or recommend.

Stopped for a early dinner to let the rush hour traffic subside on the M25 on our journey back from Devon. The food and service at this Tudor mansion is of a very high standard and the building and grounds are immaculate. We had a walk around the grounds before our dinner making it welcome and interesting break from driving.

Amazing afternoon tea!
Fresh food and very good customer service from Alvya!
Thank you very much for looking after us 🤗🤗🤗
A beautiful area, amazing price! Even in summer with wasps flying around they have quick ways of dealing with them which I was surprised about. Honestly 10 out of 10

We've just returned from a truly perfect weekend at Great Fosters. Our stay was nothing short of extraordinary, leaving us with such special memories. We stayed in the stunning Panel II Suite and felt like King & Queen!

The grounds are so beautiful, we explored for hours, it felt very private and we found the perfect spot for a picnic before heading to the pool for an afternoon of relaxation and a dip in the heated pool.

For dinner, we treated ourselves tp the 7-course tasting menu at The Tudor Pass, this was an experience we won't forget. Alex deserves his Michelin star and I have no doubt he will continue to rise.

Thank you to all the team for a magical weekend getaway!

16th Century Premier Inn .. Just awful
1 night b&b stay in august (£400 a night..)
