Starting with the good, and it is limited. The building and particularly the garden / grounds are pleasant to walk around and there was clearly a desire from the staff to try and help you enjoy yourself. Many of them are very young and inexperienced teenagers there for summer work.
The negatives are unfortunately extensive sadly, firstly the whole plot is next to the m25, the end of the garden is about 20m from the motorway and it is extremely loud and for me noticeable throughout the property even towards the far end. This ruins the garden completely. We spent the afternoon in the outdoor pool area, its not just tired its pretty much falling apart. The prices are eye watering and service was poor, always forgetting items and one staff for about 20 ppl all waiting and waiting for a drink. After a warm white wine out of a cheap plastic cup we tried the food, the sandwiches could have been something from a motorway stop. We ate in the evening in the standard hotel restaurant, and this is where it just went from bad to a bit of a scam.  The dining room tables are plastic, no tablecloth and several very young clueless waiters bringing in cold food that would barely pass in a Wetherspoon but of course all priced as though it was a central London fine dining experience. Fish and chips with undercooked potato and a duck leg in a strange lentil soup thing. It was a cross between dog food and school dinners. More warm white wine. We couldn’t finish any of it and went to bed quickly. Cant imagine what the 'Michelin' star lot were getting next door presumably from the same kitchen.
Final straw was waking up at 4am to the sound of the roaring m25 in a rock hard Ikea like bed wondering how it all went so wrong.
This hotel had its prime a long time ago and the new owners are I expect either trying to recover their costs, perhaps still form covid, or trying to make a quick profit. There is no way this is close to 5 star and i think it would struggle to even reach 4.
I rarely take the time to leave a review but just felt this was so bad i needed to warn others, i can see one or two others from the posts have had a similar experience. Strongly recommend you give it a miss !
Truly lovely gardens and outdoor areas ! Unexpectedly beautiful and pleasantly surprised by the outdoor swimming pool area. Very friendly and cosy. British style. Would visit again.

Had a superb Sunday Lunch. For me the beef was excellent  however the vegetarian options and servings were less than desirable  we still had a good experience but was disappointed with what was served up for my wife .

Went for lunch. This is a beautiful Hotel, however they really need to do something about the carpark, which is like going off road.  Lunch menu was a little underwhelming as was the service on this occasion.

Overall, this was a very disappointing experience. We paid £365 for one night, including £80 towards dinner, and breakfast. The hotel is marketed as being a 5-star luxury hotel, but it simply isn't. As a hotel experience, it's not even 3-star. I feel like we were deceived and we paid well over the odds for the experience we had. This was especially upsetting as we were celebrating our anniversary.

The good:

- The grounds are absolutely beautiful and well maintained. You can enjoy a nice walk around the gardens and there's lots of interesting outdoor artwork to enjoy.
- The building itself has plenty of history and is certainly charming.

The meh:

- The outdoor pool was okay. It was nice to be in a heated pool outside, but it wasn't particularly clean. Several of the 'fresh' pool towels were very clearly stained. They had large orange patches on them, which was the rust from the sun loungers. Why are these towels being put out if they're covered in stains?
- The bar by the outdoor pool was mediocre. They didn't have fresh juice; it was like a carton of juice from Lidl. I expected a lot more from a 5-star hotel. Not to mention that everything drink comes with a 12.5% service charge. If you fancy a pint of London Pride, it will set you back £9.

The bad (everything else):

- The room. Room 18 (Judge Doderidge) was very small and particularly hot. I'm willing to overlook this given the age of the building, but be prepared to get very hot in the summer. The bedsheets were visibly stained in multiple places, which was not nice, and certainly not 5-star.
- The service. The staff were very inexperienced and did not look like they knew what they were doing. It was almost as if they were playing dress-up. At dinner, there was one older Italian waiter bossing around the younger staff, while he did nothing but chat with clientele. I found it very telling that, as we checked out, they didn't even ask how our stay was! Surely that's the first thing any hotel asks. It's almost like they know it's bad but they'd rather bury their heads in the sand.
- The food. Probably the worst thing about the stay. The Estate Grill is essentially selling overpriced pub food. My partner ordered the haddock, but the menu didn't mention is was battered, so it was just bog-standard fish and chips. I also noted that the online 'sample menu' was a lot more elaborate than the actual menu we received. The breakfast was worse. Watery scrambled egg, hard sausages, and the fruit was tasteless. I've had better breakfasts at a Premier Inn.

Overall, I cannot recommend this hotel. It's a real shame as the grounds are beautiful and the building is fantastic. However, the service and food offered fall far short of 5-stars and the price for the stay was far too high. My suggestion to management is to properly train your staff and make some serious upgrades on your food offering. There also needs to be some reinvestment in the pool area and much better quality control on cleaning standards. The hotel has the potential to be great, but at the moment it's really disappointing. The website and pictures are very misleading.
Visited for a pool day - the service was great, the pool is large and heated which was perfect for the weather.
Stopped for lunch, great food and staff👍😊
Had Sunday lunch in the restaurant. Excellent service and fantastic food A1

Lovely hotel, the grounds are amazing. good service, young staff so need a little bit more experience but this comes with time.
The pool is fantastic, even on cold windy morning the pool is heated so it’s a must!!
It’s our 2nd time staying and I’m sure we will be back.
A really beautiful place to be, both inside and out. Shout out to Rhea who was an excellent host for my cousins wedding.

Excellent food and service. Very knowledgeable chefs in Tudor
The air conditioning in the room was not working so it was a little too hot to sleep comfortably.

Paul who helped us with our luggage and Fernando who helped us with our booking were very good
Had lunch in the Estate Grill (we had a voucher). The food was good & and service, but as we were the only ones there not surprising. Very expensive!

Dear Great Fosters! Thank you for a truly incredible stay. The hotel is beautiful, familial, quaint and picturesque. For me, what made the biggest difference was the staff. In particular, Jessica, Fernando and Prem went "Above and Beyond" to make sure I felt completely comfortable, happy and at home. I'll certainly return! Thank you. - Chris
Beautiful place to hold a wedding or other celebration as long as you don't mind paying £8 for a bottle of Pride.

Update
So I took my 5 star to 1 after an absolutely appalling evening here.

My Mother  wanted to treat my sister, BiL, my gf and me to a nice meal, obviously attending also.
Previous occasions have been good, hence the booking.

Imagine a scene, any scene from Fawlty Towers, and it would of been apt.
The list of issues are too long for this and are better served to the hotel for them to deal with.
Service - awful, waiting for menus, waiting to asked what we wanted, 1 hour.
Waiters reaching across other people of the party.
As for the food, rubber steaks, no veg.

I will leave it there, but I will NOT be going back.
We should've gone to the Dumb Post near Calne, would of been half the price and better service and quality food.

My previous review when it was good.

Was treated to lunch for my 50th by my girlfriend.
Really nice steak and veg. Desserts were superb too.
The amaretto Alexander cocktails were good, had 3!
Looking forward to having an afternoon tea there in the summer.
If the afternoon tea is as good as the lunch, it will be good.
Great outdoor pool!

Went for afternoon tea. Lovely room and building but tea was a little disappointing. We asked to have a sandwich replaced and told that was not possible. Scones were overcooked, pimms jelly not very nice and lots of people were leaving theirs too. Little cakes were ok but bit disappointing.
The food for afternoon tea was wonderful but the service I have never seen so bad for years... You get better service in a McDonald's with a number on your table
Just beautiful
Extraordinary mansion converted to a wonderful hotel. The biggest drawback was the food at the main restaurant (not the one star on site smaller restaurant - which we didn't try).
Positioned as a luxury hotel, I was surprised to experience such poor service. The team explained that they had a wedding to attend to, as if that excused poor service to the other paying guests.

A very good spa day but nothing to do with the actual spa.

The staff at the pool Tony and Matt were lovely; very kind and attentive, they provided excellent service and are really good at their jobs. The pool area is beautiful and luckily the weather was hot so it felt like a holiday.

The hotel receptionist whose name I didn't get but had lovely eye make up and an Australian/NZ accent was great, super friendly and genuine.

The spa experience was very underwhelming. The therapist doing my treatments appeared to be in a bad mood until my treatments were over. She made no conversation with me on the walk over to the spa and when I tried to talk to her she didn't respond. I had a 55 minute massage and 55 minute facial and by the time she left the room only 90 minutes has passed, so 20 minutes of treatment just never happened.
I have had a lot of treatments in a lot of spas around the world and I have never had a massage where the therapist didn't ask what kind of pressure I would like or if I have any areas of concern. She didn't even ask if the pressure she was applying was okay (I could barely feel it). At no point, did she massage my arms or hands so it just felt unfinished. For my facial, she didn't ask what skin type I had in order to customise it, again, something I've never experienced before in my life. I've also never had a facial that didn't include a shoulder and chest massage while the mask is applied. While the mask was applied she very very gently rubbed my face over the top of the towel that was on my forehead. It was quite a weird feeling to be honest.
I left the spa with a very thick residue of product on my face that I had to wash off in the bathroom because it was in chunks all over my face.
I would definitely come back here again, but only for the pool experience, for the price I paid the spa was very unsatisfactory

Wow!  Stayed here many times over the years and Great Fosters keeps getting better and better.  The rooms, the service and the building are just amazing.  We had just come from a tour around France visiting the chateaux and gardens in the Loire, but the gardens and building here are in the same league.  If you want a unique hotel experience that’s convenient to both Heathrow and Windsor, forget the boring Marriott and other chains -  make sure you check out Great Fosters!

Stopped in for a light bite to eat 2nd June, and apart from finding the bar menu had dumbed down since our previous visit 10 days before. Gone were the smoked salmon sandwich and the rare roast beef, replaced by coronation chicken and egg mayonnaise with watercress options.

Hey ho, gave it a go, and don't bother would be my advice. The watercress was missing from the egg mayonnaise sandwich. Don't understand how a Michelin star restaurant can't get 2 ingredients into a simple sandwich. So started on the coronation chicken, and the brown sourdough was robust to say the least. After pointing out the issue with the watercress and had that provided, we then found the egg mayonnaise sandwich sourdough was downright stale. I cannot see how any kitchen, let alone one for a five star establishment, can't tell when bread is stale. Hence the public negative review.
Lovely venue
Excellent in all ways
I would give sux stars if I could😄

Very bad service overall. they didn’t come to clean your rooms even though we were staying for 3 nights.The grill restaurant booked us a day before and the manager named Louis made us wait on door for 20 min even though there were tables empty in the restaurant, when I asked why are we waiting at the door he said I am too busy to accommodate you so you have to wait until I am free. He was extremely rude and had no courtesy at all. Totally disappointed with their service and staff was unprofessional and incompetent.
Amazing place

Amazing venue and everyone should experience it. However rooms old and dated (partly excusable as built in 1500). Not excusable was distinctly average (being kind) food in main restaurant and entry level staff in all areas. Of the dozen or so staff interacted with only 3 or 4 were of an acceptable level of competence.
We went to a wedding events open day, prior to a wedding that's booked for next year.

We had lunch at the "grill" restaurant and I don't know how to put it other than a rip off. The food was over priced as well as the wine and not nice at all. I had a burger for £26 that was supposed to be wagyu and beef brisket but I am pretty sure it wasn't anything else than a burger patty from Aldi or Asda, the fries were old and reheated. The patty was overcooked and honestly you can get a better burger at McDonald's for £3. The pate we had a starter wasn't even a pate and more like a cold meatloaf. I give 2 stars because the service was good and the outside seating quite nice.

I booked a romantic weekend here for me and my other half, we phoned to ask for early access to which we had to pay extra which is absolutely fine but we got to site and the room was not ready. We had a fantastic time there, drinks were very expensive but as to be expected. The problems came in the morning when the breakfast did not arrive to our room as they had missed our breakfast door hanger so we asked them and they brought our breakfast, I ordered eggs royale and the poached eggs were hard with no hollandaise. I would definitely rate going here, but unfortunately the service was not up to par this time.

What a hotel ,16th century Manor House, we were told it was Henry Viii hunting lodge.
Rear gardens are beautifully laid out, with a moat.
The wooden bridge covered in wisteria looks amazing.
We ate in the The Tudor Pass what an experience, 7 course food festival. Chefs come out on each course to explain the dishes which was a nice touch.
The food was amazing .
Drinks were not expensive.
There's a spa and swimming pool.
It is a pricey but I think you get what you pay for
Staff were attentive and polite, nothing to much trouble.
A definite special occasion hotel,you won't be disappointed.
I play at weddings here but the staff are lovely and the venue is beautiful.
Beautiful hotel with so much history, it was amazing to wander around the incredible gardens.
Champagne Afternoon tea..though my son and daughter in law had their wedding there 2 years ago . The bridal suite is stunning .

Setting is lovely no complaints, food was great and the cocktails were too. Disappointed on the day of our visit the hot tub was not working nor was the heated pool heated however the manager did offer us a gesture of goodwill and the rest of our stay was lovely.

Amazing experience as usual . Great service and wonderful seating area,the gardens were pristine.Have been here many times Introducing friends to this fabulous Hotel and it's afternoon tea. The only down side this time was being asked to pay extra for more  Sandwiches ......I was very disappointed, would rather have paid slightly more for the afternoon tea in the first place.
We always have a wonderful experience at this wedding venue in Surrey! The staff are amazing, the food is delicious, and the function room is perfect for dancing the night away. Highly recommend!
Beautiful hotel and very good customer service

Stunning hotel! We had afternoon tea, then spent a few minutes walking around the grounds. It was fun spotting the pieces of artwork everywhere.

The afternoon tea was wonderful. We only stayed one night, but the service both at the hotel and the restaurant was amazingly friendly and prompt.

The bed was, unfortunately, sloped quite dramatically back towards the pillows so we ended up sleeping ‘upside down’. It’s a very old hotel, so we understand.
Lovely afternoon tea. ☕️
Great hotel with rich history; only 10min away from the Heathrow Airport.

The staff urgently needs training in hospitality because they don't do anything and the hospitality is far from perfect. As for the food, substandard.
Breakfast was too sad for words.
Great experience. Friendly staff, excellent service and lovely gluten free afternoon tea. The best in the area. And I have been to a few.
Went for a wedding beautiful venue. Place is very lovely and lots of places to have pictures. Would highly recommend.

We were surprised at how far this pricey hotel fell from our expectations. My wife and I enjoy staying at top-tier hotels and resorts. Admittedly, perhaps 5-stars in the UK is a completely different standard than 5-stars in the U.S. where we are from, but this felt like a mid-range hotel operation that is not worth the cost.

We had several issues arise during our short Friday-Sunday stay that, in sum, detracted significantly from what we hoped would be a relaxing getaway.

ROOM (3/5):

The property includes a main house and a number of smaller houses. In an attempt to be future-leaning, the rooms are equipped with Google Home devices instead of phones. Unfortunately, our device was not working and we were informed by the staff it was unable to be repaired. This was our only connection to the front desk, so when we needed anything we would have to walk outside in the cold and/or rain to make the request then walk back.

Our room was nicely renovated, with a very comfortable bed and bedding, deep tub and fine shower. Odd things malfunctioned: the towels are hung on a warming towel rack which did not work. I was also disappointed that despite the Smart TVs in the room, they do not allow for casting from a device so you can stream your own shows.

We wished the room could have been cleaner. Nothing horrible, but there were cobwebs dangling from the ceiling in both the bedroom and bathroom and the walls quite dirty. I would also recommend management install USB-compatible outlets for the benefit of international travelers.

SERVICE (1.5/5):

Service is what makes all the difference in a resort setting because you’re stuck on the property. Despite the costly ₤450/night stay, we found service lacking. Let’s get past me having to take my own bags to my room as I’m not above some exercise.

We ordered room service once using the QR Code in our room - again, admirable attempt to leverage technology, but execution was frustrating. After about 45 minutes waiting, we asked the staff if our food was on the way, and apparently the QR Code in our room sent the staff to the wrong room. They delivered our food after we inquired and straightened things out, but the ice cream was in a puddle and hot items were cold. A very disappointing ₤70 meal where we discarded half of it.

The room service mentioned above was ordered Friday evening, but the trays and dishes were still outside our door when we checked out two days later on Sunday morning! No one had come by our room once during our stay. On Saturday we informed the front desk our trays hadn’t been collected and I was actually shocked that on Sunday it still hadn’t been done. Completely disgusting to leave old food to rot in a hallway for two days.

We requested luggage racks so that our suitcases wouldn’t have to be sprawled on the floor and we were told they didn’t own any. This might be the first hotel we've ever stayed at that didn't own luggage racks... We also requested additional coat hangers be delivered to our room which never arrived.

Walking through the grounds, you can’t help but notice dozens of rat traps prominently featured throughout the property near every doorway. I wonder if the apparent rat problem has anything to do with the room service food being left out for days at a time?

FOOD (1.5/5):

The food quality was disappointing. Our first meal was lunch and the cheeseburger was overcooked and incredibly dense, bun stale, and everything on the plate lacked flavor. The person at the table next to us sent his burger back twice; we opted not to make a similar scene. And the table itself was dirty with breadcrumbs everywhere, I swapped the napkin for one next to me because it looked used. Most items we ordered during our stay we did not finish, although the fish and chips was quite decent. Desserts were bad across the board. Rather than looking forward to meals, we were dreading finding something we might eat. We did not dine at the Tudor Pass, but it seems like that’s the only food service this resort cares about. The Estate Grill and bar clearly need some help.
Beautiful property and great location!  Spectacular grounds!

Lovely outdoor swimming pool. Historic building and grounds.
Great wedding venue.

Lovely period building with good restaurants and bar.
Beautiful gardens and well run hot
Beautiful place and Great Service.  The ambience just right too.  If you want to impress someone for a meal, this is the place to go.   The building is stunning!
Fabulous luxury hotel close to Londons Heathrow Aiport , great food, great staff , great service and lovely surroundings,  first class .

Looks great, falls short where it counts.  I probably would have rated the hotel itself if it weren't for a bad experience at the onsite grill.  Our first room, the AC didn't work.  Our second room the lights flickered constantly, the sunroofs didn't open, the floor creaked everywhere like your grandmother's attic, and the shower was cold for 10 full minutes.
The grounds are lovely.  Truly looks amazing even in the rain when we were there.  The grounds and building look VERY luxurious.
The staff was ambivalent and lacking.
Stunning place to visit. Went for afternoon tea for a birthday. Will definitely be back in the summer to admire the rose garden!

This is an exceptionally beautiful hotel. We only came here for a meal but it was very lovely and relaxing sitting overlooking the fountain. Staff were very friendly and professional. The grounds are stunning and sprawling. Modern sculptures against the traditional topiary and gardens contrast so well. Dog friendly. Lots of parking spaces. A hidden gem.

We stayed on Saturday night for a birthday treat. The building and grounds are just beautiful. My feedback I hope is helpful to further tweak and enhance the experience of guests.

I was a little disappointed with some details which I’ve listed out below.
1. The room was lovely but, we found rubbish left from a previous guest. Only 2 small cartons of uht milk in the room is very tight
2. Cocktail bar, very slow service, I had to go and ask twice to be served after waiting 15 minutes, it wasn’t busy
3. The sofa and accompanying chairs in the bar were dirty and need cleaning
4. When our bar snacks eventually arrived after a 40 minute wait there was no apology. The waiter then dropped half the crackers on the floor, he didn’t replenish them
5. Dinner was excellent, great service and the food was very good, but breakfast was not great. Again we waiting 20 minutes for someone to come and ask us for our tea order, we also ordered poached eggs, these eventually arrived cold and looked like some sort of aliens lifeform. Breakfast items not replenished. Only baked bean juice in the pot, no pasties. Mushrooms tasted like they had just be dug up, very muddy. A 3/10 for the breakfast im afraid.

Given the above I didn’t think it was good value for the price we paid for the room. Sorry.
Fantastic hotel, food delicious. Rooms big and spacious and very well decorated. Would stay here again and recommend to anyone.
Unique and beautiful property, excellently managed by professional staff who made the stay completely comfortable and enjoyable. Thank you!
We went for afternoon tea,  which was lovely. Very well looked after.

As a professional wedding videographer at Vic Rivero Films, I've had the pleasure of filming many weddings at Great Fosters Hotel. I can confidently say that this venue is one of the most breathtaking locations I've ever seen. Set amongst 50 acres of stunning gardens and parkland, Great Fosters is a dreamy setting for your wedding day.

One of the things that sets Great Fosters apart is their commitment to hosting just one wedding each day. This means that couples can exchange or renew their vows in the majestic surroundings of The Orangery, without any distractions or interruptions. The reception drinks in the Painted Hall are a truly memorable experience, with the elegant décor and stunning views creating an atmosphere of luxury and refinement.

Finally, the historical Tithe Barn is the perfect location for your wedding breakfast, providing a warm and inviting atmosphere for you and your loved ones to enjoy. The attention to detail and exceptional service provided by the staff at Great Fosters ensures that your special day will be truly unforgettable.

I would highly recommend Great Fosters Hotel to anyone looking for a magical wedding venue. Whether you're planning an intimate ceremony or a grand celebration, this hotel will exceed your expectations and create memories that will last a lifetime.
Enjoyed Afternoon Tea, Great food and service. Hotel set in beautiful surroundings

Went for afternoon tea, the food was great; the sandwiches were completely delicious and more were provided when we devoured them rather quickly. The scones light, and the cakes were fantastic. The tea menu has become smaller, but there were a couple of types we hadn't had before that we tried. One negative, despite booking in for a specific time, the service was very slow, 45 minutes for food to arrive and 25 minutes for the tea! Don't ask for a coffee, though... the wait was worse. It was great coffee, but my husband was convinced they had to be waiting for the beans to arrive at Heathrow as it took so long to get to our table. Having said that, the staff were pleasant and helpful... just not very speedy.

Disabled access is not clearly signposted and while it must be accessible by law... I'm not sure if I'd used my wheelchair I'd have made it in. There are no disabled parking spaces marked out.
A delightful afternoon tea in a sumptuous setting with attentive and professional staff.

Absolutely not 5 star service. Came for a Valentine’s Day meal, our coats weren’t taken, our menus were put on the table before we’d even managed to sit down, they’d run out of the set menu starter because of “walk ins” despite us having a booking, no one then bothered to check on us following receiving our main at any stage and we were never offered any drinks top ups. After waving a manager down to clear our table I’d confronted them about the poor service to which the response was “oh really?” with no offer of apology. Ended up having to wave someone down for the bill, again with no apology what so ever, we had to then stand up and walk to the front to pay our bill (in a 5 star restaurant?!) to which the manager round the corner started to speak poorly of us and had to be told to be quiet by a waiter as we could hear him! Then met with 2 argumentative managers that said they’d take the service charge off, which is optional anyway?! Extremely disappointed, what a wasted valentines meal!
Beautiful with rich history.

similarHotelsNearby.name: 100 Queen's Gate Hotel London, Curio Collection by Hilton
similarHotelsNearby.description: Upscale lodging with a lounge & dining

similarHotelsNearby.name: Radisson Blu Edwardian Vanderbilt Hotel, London
similarHotelsNearby.description: Elegant hotel with chic dining & a gym

similarHotelsNearby.name: Eden Plaza Kensington
similarHotelsNearby.description: Laid-back hotel with a contemporary bar

reviews.text: Just amazing !!!

Perfect location and very nice staff, but the rooms are small, the bed is way too near the wall, the mirror is in the closet and the breakfast was poor. I know it's a boutique hotel but it doesn't looks like a 5 stars hotel, but you pay for the location.
Loved the decoration and location, the room was small but comfortable. Didn’t get to try the breakfast.

Whoever decorated this hotel must have had a lot of fun because it is an unexpected collage of objects, colors and shapes.

The hotel staff was very attentive and the bartender was a riot.

We had a room with a small terrace and full minibar. Only complaint is that the lighting over the sink is inadequate for make-up/shaving.

Breakfast was excellent.

Stayed for almost a week. I felt uncomfortable in the hotel, but besides that, I just expected more from a 5 star hotel. If this place was advertised as a 4 star, my review would be higher
The hotel sign is in a strange angle, such as you can only see it if you are right outside, so the hotel might be hard to find if you don’t look at the number.
The elevator is very small, a bit too small for an entire hotel.
The room was very small, which is kind of expected in London. However, it was the distribution of the space what bothered me the most. The bathroom was huge, yet there wasn’t a lot of space to place your cosmetics. The mirrors were small and positioned in a way that a tall person would have a hard time staring at them. The worst about the room was that the closet was small, and that one of the doors was not openable because it would hit the night table. This is a fatal design mistake and it made me extremely upset. It was so hard to get things in an out of the closet. Inaceptable for a 5 star hotel. The bed was comfortable
Breakfast was very nice. However, if you wanted a latte, you had to pay for it. I couldn’t believe it, you are giving me all the salmon I can eat but you are going to make me pay a latte? Well it is what it is.
Muy bueno...bien localizado y bien decirado. Desayuno normal.
reviews.textTranslated: Very good...well located and well said. Normal breakfast.

reviews.text: Dropped in for happy hour cocktails (2 for 1). Friendly staff, decent cocktails and the alcoholic rainbow wall was striking and fun
Idealy placed for public transports (tube south ken), the museums and Hyde Park.

Excellent location on a fairly peaceful street right in the heart of South Kensington, stone's throw from the tube and museums. Loads of bars and restaurants nearby. Staff were friendly and really helpful. The decor is quirky, although it often felt like they're trying *too* hard with it (external sign orientation illegible unless you're standing under it, claustrophobic completely astroturfed lift etc). Our room was tiny, which isn't unexpected given the price and location, but it just wasn't at the level you'd expect for a 4 star hotel. Only one small mirror in the very dimly lit bathroom, too far away from any plug sockets to use an implement like a hairdryer in front of. Dodgy exposed wiring for the LEDs in the shower. Could go on, but overall we still thought the hotel was good value for the area - just could do with a few improvements!

I was in London for business.  My room was OK. In particular I liked having the balcony which was a good size and at the rear of the hotel, hence peaceful.  However in the room there was no proper desk and chair that I could use for work.
Super bien ubicado.
reviews.textTranslated: Super well located.

reviews.text: Gisel made the most stunning drinks and the whole staff was extremely friendly. Highly recommend and ask for Gisel for the best drink of your life.

החדרים מעט קטנים
אין מיני בר בחדר - משמעותי מאוד בעיקר למשפחות
בעיני המלון מיועד יותר לזוגות ופחות למשפחות.
חבל שצריך לשלם עבור קפה אספרסו  וקפוצ׳ינו בארוחת הבוקר, מעולם לא הצטרכתי לשלם על קפה בבית מלון במסגרת ארוחת בוקר.
reviews.textTranslated:
The rooms are a bit small
There is no minibar in the room - very significant especially for families
In my opinion, the hotel is intended more for couples and less for families.
It's a shame you have to pay for espresso coffee and cappuccino at breakfast, I've never had to pay for coffee in a hotel as part of breakfast.

reviews.text: Great hotel design and service. The location is amazing too in the posh Kensington neighborhood next to great restaurants and stores. The rooms are a bit tiny though.

We booked a 6-night stay in a superior double with balcony, and it was a great experience. The staff were kind and helpful (one of the front desk folks even gave us breakfast at 5:00 a.m. while we were waiting for our car to the airport), and we loved our room. It was, unsurprisingly, a little on the small side, and it would have been helpful to have had more storage space for our long-ish stay. That said, the bed was incredibly comfortable (even for my 6'4" husband), the room was dark and quiet at night, the balcony was pleasant, and the bathroom was wonderful. I'm going to miss that bathroom for a while--a deep tub with a seemingly never-ending supply of hot water, great water pressure in the rainfall shower, and I think the floors were even heated. And of course, the art makes this place extra-special. Location is excellent--nearby access to the Underground, easy walking distance to the Royal Albert Hall and museums, and a number of good restaurants within a stone's throw. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.
Beautiful hotel nice clean . Love the CUBAN style of decor.  Very friendly staff .
Really great staff and service, great location 4 mins from South Ken station. Rooms are nice although a bit tight, but everything else amazing.

Very welcoming stay for a weekend in London. 5 minutes from tube station. Area around hotel was quiet and Hotel was well presented and modern. Continental breakfast was the only option but plenty of choices. Bar was reasonably priced and you can order pizza throughout the night. Rooms were quirky and spacious. Proper coffee machine also. Will book here again.
Great room and location. Also 24hr pizza😀😀
Gorgeous and so friendly!
Fulfilled all our expectations

Amazing hotel! Perfect location for Royal albert Hall and museums. Welcoming staff and excellent rooms and breakfast. Highly recommended!
Perfect location for our event at the Royal Albert Hall. We stayed in a super deluxe double and it was perfect in every way.
Staff are superb and location is perfect- rooms though are noisy and not that great
Excellent staff service and super location for exploring central London

Cool hotel
They have a set cocktail menu
Room great but very tight
Amazing staff beautiful rooms

The rooms are lovely, the ambience is always unique and it is one of the best hotels in London. In particular, the staff are amazing and a special thanks to Eleha who made mine and my son’s stay so memorable.

A nice customer friendly hotel, well suited for short-term business travellers.  Room (superior) was very well stated with lots of cupboards, excellent bathroom (but needs a proper window privacy blind), and nice large comfy bed.  My room was near the only lift in the hotel, so on occasions, it was noisy as people congregated or moved luggage. Next time, I'd pick a room further away.  Bar and hosting were good.  I was a little disappointed with continental breakfast, for the price I expected a cooked buffet breakfast, but the continental was adequate.  Overall, based upon the price, room quality, and location, I would stay again.
A great location on a quiet street but close to the museums,  the tube and a great range of cafes and shops. Lovely staff and a very well appointed room. Will come again.
Обычный 4* отель,без холодильника в номере и с плохой шумоизоляцией номера и платным капучино при включённом завтраке,но месторасположение хорошее
reviews.textTranslated: An ordinary 4* hotel, without a refrigerator in the room and with poor soundproofing of the room and paid cappuccino with breakfast included, but the location is good

reviews.text: Looking tired! We stayed in the Penthouse suite and whilst the facilities are on the surface commensurate with the award it is official given, that test was obviously done some time ago. Room décor is looking tired, little consideration for how things are installed, missed items of house keeping and stupid mistakes like stretching a double sheet onto a super king bed. Better than a Travelodge in London and you can certainly do better for the costs involved. All points raised at check out, but as is so often the case I will not be fed up the chain of command for any resolution or feedback.

Beautiful & quirky hidden gem
Good location for tourism or site seeing, 24 hour parking available over the road, friendly & very helpful staff
Beautiful rooms with unusual but stunning decor
Clean & well maintained all round
Bathroom is gorgeous & beds are like heaven!
Lovely bar to enjoy if your wanting to stay in the hotel for the evening
Elena on the bar is wonderful, friendly, kind, very attentive & an asset to the hotel
We will be back!❤️

Lovely place to stay but:
- No Bell Boys for the bags
- Kinda tight and small room
- Nearest car park is £48 a day (including their %20 discount coupon) 💸💸💸💸💸

Such exquisite surprising design!  Room is a bit small but that is to be expected.  It had a balcony and the decor is so fantastic and cozy you forget it's small.  I felt VIP there!  It is definitely a Good Vibe feeling hotel!   Good value and great location.  I really love this hotel and will stay here again!  The only food option is pizza which is really cool....  But..... The pizza isn't very good.  If they changed the pizza chef it would be awesome!

Fabulous little hotel! Excellent service. Friendly. Spotless. Great location.
Definitely recommend!
The room was great couldn't complain at all was a nice touch having chocolate on the bed each day and the bottle of bubbles was a lovely gesture.
La habitación extremadame te pequeña
reviews.textTranslated: The room is extremely small

reviews.text:
Die Lage ist gut. Laufnähe zum Hyde Park und den Museen.
Das Zimmer war klein und eng, dafür war das Bad riesig. Die Einrichtung ist ab gewohnt und das Bett durch gelegen. Alles sauber und aufgeräumt.
Der Service war gut, Personal freundlich.
reviews.textTranslated:
The location is good. Walking distance to Hyde Park and the museums.
The room was small and cramped, but the bathroom was huge. The furnishing is worn and the bed is worn out. Everything clean and tidy.
The service was good, staff friendly.

reviews.text: Excellent.

Lovely hotel, very quirky decor. Hot tub in the room was amazing and the Halloween decorations shown in the photo were very cool- a mixture of vodka and food colouring to create the rainbow jars behind the bar! The pizzas were delicious as was the lychee and Disaronno drink I had. Great location, just around the corner from the natural history museum and walking distance to tube stops. Would recommend a visit and would definitely stay here again.

Lovely hotel. Probably wouldn't say it was 5 star but still a very pleasant 2 night stay. Continental breakfast was spot on 👌
Room facilities weren't 5 star, paintwork in bathroom wasn't done to high quality and paint missing in places, but it was clean and serviceable.

A boutique hotel in South Kensington. The first thing that struck me was a picture of Che Guevara in the reception. I assume that the irony of an image of a communist revolutionary in a supposed 5 star hotel has been lost somewhere...
Anyway the hotel itself is a quirky little place full of artistic flair. My room was a little on the small side and the foot or so space either side of the extremely comfortable bed made access to the wardrobe very difficult. They gave me two bottles of mineral water each day plus chocolates, biscuits and crisps which was a nice touch. Unfortunately there was no fridge. The room was very well serviced but strangely half a pack of gum had been left on the safe.
Somewhere to hang your jacket would be good and there's ample space behind the door.
The shower was hugely powerful and the bathroom was spotless with high quality toiletries.
I very much enjoyed breakfast. Well worth a visit. All the staff that I encountered were first class.
Amazing exhibition going on at the moment,  absolutely love the artwork. Looking forward to breakfast there and seeing more exhibitions in the future. Perfect place to meet up for a coffee or brunch.
Great location, confused check in, bedrooms a bit small. No way to easily restock room supplies, coffee, tea etc, when room not serviced.
Spent a week here. Exceptional service! A quirky 5-star hotel in decor. Couldn't have had a better location.
Room was somewhat smelly and worn down. Not sure about 5 stars, but it's totally fine for the price. They have a bathtub in the room, which is great. Noize isolation is poor, unfortunately
Just attending for an art exhibition though was able to get a feel for the friendliness and chic aspect of this hotel hidden away in South Kensington.
Very good Hotel... you will feel you so good to stay there... lovely staff... a very great and nice place to sleep when you visit London... you are very fast at every point from there...

Special but verry nice. rooms are cleen and nice.
Big Bathrom for london

I think they have decent rooms and the specific room I had was the "Drop dead gorgeous suite" that's usually booked months in advance... All I can say is Wow! Superb experience and I've started all over the world, the room was roomy considering the size of most rooms in London, there is service of needed, the bar has an happy hour in the evenings, it Ajayi has your typical London breakfast either enjoyed downstairs or brought to your room. The only downfall to be was using stays to actually get to your room but I do believe that's typical once again for the country. My room has a jacuzzi inside with a TV and unique sound speakers, well lit, shower wit multiple points of splash, rainfall, mist, and handheld sprayer. It's expensive but fit a special occasion, worthy. The staff is helpful even with recommending local restaurants and there are many eateries ask within walking distance. The museum is also about a 5 min walk but it wasn't easy leaving the room. My a/c writhed fine in the room no issues. It's definitely bin and stay here again.

Major noise issues at night from the next room, and a neighbouring property. (ie. a private flat with very loud music blasting through the wall right next to the bed at 11.30pm. Of course the hotel can’t control the neighbouring property occupants, but I explained the situation to the night manager, who came in to the room, heard the noise and told me there was nothing he could do as he didn’t have any other rooms. This meant the only option left was to book another hotel and move across London at midnight. The night manager confirmed I would receive a full refund that would take 3-4 days to go through. After a week, I still hadn’t received that. I followed up to receive a reply from Sarah, the general manager telling me that the night manager had not offered me a refund (lie) and she instead offered me a £30 voucher towards another stay at the hotel from my initial £300 booking as a “goodwill gesture”. Are you actually serious?

They will undoubtedly refute these claims as they have proven themselves to be consistently dishonest.

I don’t like leaving negative reviews, in fact this is the only negative review I’ve ever left - but I felt I should warn others about this situation.

Do not trust them.
Always excellent. Always a great night sleep. Friendly team, always look forward to returning. Elena, a gem, as always!

Really enjoyed our stay. Room was very clean and provided everything we needed.  It was small - but many hotel rooms are in London.  All the staff were very attentive. Great location - lots of cafe bars/restaurants close by, tube station  is only a 5 minute walk.  I would definitely stay here again,
Really a good option in the center of the city
Quase tudo maravilhoso Só a cozinheira não sabe receber os hóspedes bem
reviews.textTranslated: Almost everything is wonderful Only the cook doesn't know how to welcome guests well

reviews.text: Location was excellent, staff helpful, rooms unique and quirky. Room was a bit small but that’s expected in central London.
Хороший отель , отличное расположение , спокойный квартал. Спасибо большое за завтраки Марине и Елене  !  Приеду обязательно в ноябре!
reviews.textTranslated: Nice hotel, great location, quiet area. Thank you very much for the breakfasts Marina and Elena! I'll definitely come in November!

reviews.text: Perfectly located! Kind, helpful staff and clean rooms!
Convenient for solo travelers
it’s okay. the location was great, but definitely not up to the 5 star standard

An interesting hotel… was not sure that it was 5 stars, but certainly wasn’t too bad. The location is great, but the rooms are tiny. The air conditioning for the room didn’t work too well so it was a bit stuffy in the room.
ادارة محترمة وترحيب طيب ولاكن الفندق لا يليق في فندق 5 نجوم لا يوجد فيه جم ولا مسبح والاصانصير سيئ والغرفة صغيرة
reviews.textTranslated: Respectful management and a good welcome, but the hotel is not suitable for a 5-star hotel. There is no gym or swimming pool, the elevator is bad, and the room is small.

reviews.text: Perfecta ubicación junto a The Natural History Museum, atención exquisita, preciosa habitación, muy buena insonorización, espectacular baño.
reviews.textTranslated: Perfect location next to The Natural History Museum, exquisite service, beautiful room, very good soundproofing, spectacular bathroom.

reviews.text: This is a pleasant enough hotel, but it's no way 5-star like it claims. It's more like a quirky, arty B&B. It lacks the usual hotel services (e.g. restaurant)and is a bit DIY in its quality of interior/rooms etc. To be honest, it's overpriced and a bit overrated.
Loved it. The shower is a little funny to operate. Staff are excellent, friendly, helpful and professional.
Very Luxurious hotel booked the squint splash room wonderful room with hot tub jacuzzi that had 2 tvs and a smaller tub just below very good for the price
Hotel looks amazing but the staff are extremely rude and unprofessional.

Excellent boutique hotel in a fantastic location.
Quirky artwork adds a touch of fun.

El hotel, pequeño pero "coqueto".
Las habitaciones pequeñas pero bien diseñadas, cómodas. El detalle del agua, café e infusiones gratis (cafetera de cápsulas y kettle), que reponen diariamente.
Limpieza perfecta.
La ubicación tranquila, bien comunicada y a 50m del museo de historia natural.
El desayuno muy completo para ser inglaterra
El personal atento y discreto.
Mi único pero: el ascensor estaba estropeado y nuestra habitación en un cuarto piso al que se accedía por unas escaleras muy estrechas y empinadas.
reviews.textTranslated:
The hotel, small but "coquettish".
Small but well designed, comfortable rooms. The detail of the free water, coffee and infusions (capsule coffee maker and kettle), which are replenished daily.
Perfect cleaning.
The quiet location, well connected and 50m from the natural history museum.
Very complete breakfast for England
Attentive and discreet staff.
My only drawback: the elevator was out of order and our room was on the fourth floor, which was accessed by very narrow and steep stairs.

reviews.text: Staff are so lovely here, rooms are compact but nicely equipped. Location for museums and tube station is spot on
Camera minuscola.
reviews.textTranslated: Tiny room.

reviews.text: Great location but very standard room.

Super friendly attitude towards a customer. I had to cancel 2 rooms in a very last moment. Giving a full explanation, I was reimbursed in full.

Very professional and will be me definite choice for the next time!
Fabulous!!

We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights in March 2022. The hotel was querky and very interesting. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The room we had was spacious and clean and very comfortable.  Had the best 2 nights sleep in this place. I would 100% recommend this hotel  . Thank you
Fantastic service from the team at this hotel , Zita and Elenha were very welcoming and helpful to us during our stay and the room was amazing!!! 😊😊😊😊😊😊😊

Just wow! Just want to start off by saying have lovely and attentive all the staff were! The vibe and feel of the hotel was on another level. This was a birthday treat for my partner. When we were all checked in we headed up to our beautiful room. Safe to say we were blown away. The room had been decorated for his birthday. Thankyou for making us feel so special.

Good price for the quality of the room.  Staff need some training. On their personal mobile phones on the reception desk not paying attention to guests. Not great customer service. Rooms are 5 star, service 3 star. Great location
The place looks fantastic with its cool decor, the staff are friendly, the breakfast is delicious, the beds are comfy, the showers are perfect…..just one drawback: the smallness of our room.
Great place to stay!!!🎸
Excellent hotel. Lovely deco and room. The staff and service are very good.  Great location. We will stay again.

The experience from beginning to end was outstanding.  It was my 60th, a surprise birthday from my partner, hotel in on it and made up the room with a few surprises. Hotel Staff fabulous, friendly and helpful.  Hotel decor loved it quirky, imaginative, unique and attention to detail exquisite. Bed and pillows so comfortable I had the best nights sleep in months, no alcohol involved either just pure comfort. The shower was fantastic, heat of room to your own taste easy to use. Very clean. The best hotel I have stayed in. We will be back. I did not want to leave. Great access to London, lovely little market shop round corner beautiful and can recommend Rocca Italian restaurant 5 min walk away, fresh pasta, great staff. Best hotel experience ever. You will not be disappointed. Thank you to a great team.

Save yourself the misery of this place. One imagines this was a chic boutique when it opened but it's clearly now an effort to squeeze maximum profit from a fading glory

Even in a £39 premier Inn the service includes a room turn down each day

Shocking. Avoid
Great friendly staff, comfortable, cleverly decorated rooms. Loved it!
Excellent service, location and decor. Thoroughly enjoyable stay

Great stay extremely comfortable beds and lovely room layout. Very close to cafe, bars and restaurants. Cost around £13 black cab to get into Haymarket. £40 24hrs parking located 2 min walk from hotel. Continental breakfast is fantastic and all the staff were so helpful and nothing was to much for them.

Do not go to this hotel. Unfortunately, by the time I realised my mistake, I could no longer get my money back and I had travelled a long way. The first issue occurred when I went to check in. I asked for some assistance with my bags as I didn't think I could carry them to my room. The manager, at the time I didn't know this is who they were, told me to help myself as they "don't get paid enough".  One of the workers, I don't want to expose who as it could get them in trouble, complained of a similar issue and it made me wonder where my hard earned money was going. On top of that, my room had a mouse problem and they just put down one of those sticky mouse traps and said I'd probably attracted them with my room service. That was my last straw and I ended up having to leave early and find new lodgings. Anything is better than here.

similarHotelsNearby.name: The Montcalm at The Brewery London City
Point A London, Shoreditch
similarHotelsNearby.description: Modern budget lodging with free Wi-Fi

similarHotelsNearby.name: Malmaison London
similarHotelsNearby.description: Chic hotel with a trendy restaurant

reviews.text: Staff are helpful polite and attentive
Lack of help on check in, no one show us where was our room, ripped curtains and also the curtains where to smaller for the window so 6am have light from outside straight to my face.
Die Lage des Einzelzimmers war gut, dass war es aber auch schon. Das Zimmer wies schon erhebliche Abnutzungen auf. Kein warmes Wasser in der Dusche, schwarzer Schimmel auf den Fugen
reviews.textTranslated: The location of the single room was good, but that was it. The room already showed considerable wear and tear. No warm water in the shower, black mold on the joints

reviews.text: Fantastic 5-star hotel. For the money I paid it was more than worth the value. Only criticism is, is that the windows need to be double glazed, as I heard all kinds of noise out on the street which did disturb my sleep. The staff were very professional and polite, and the food was excellent too. Would recommend, especially if it’s a last minute booking.
מלון נהדר, לא יקר. נקי במיוחד והשירות נפלא. מאוד אהבנו
reviews.textTranslated: Great hotel, not expensive. Extremely clean and the service is wonderful. We really liked it

reviews.text: Stayed a couple of nights, the room was a good size, had air conditioning which worked just fine, small fridge, tea and coffee making facilities, there were packets of biscuits but one was open and partially eaten, not a huge problem but bugged me a little, bottled water both days, clean room and very quiet at night, we had a room with a bath and rainfall shower which could of been more poweful but again not a problem, bed was big and comfy so slept well, the staff were friendly and as we were celebrating a birthday they had filled the room with balloons which was a nice touch, great location for exploring London so overall a pleasant stay.

Two elements to my stay, the staff in the actual hotel were great and the room was small but comfy. They had plugs sockets for European chargers/electronics which was a nice touch and I had a good nights sleep.
The  issue was with the pub associated with the hotel called the Jugged Hare, the attitude of the staff there was terrible. I had got to the hotel and once I was  in my room it clearly has a card in the room saying food is served until 10:00 (as you can see from the picture uploaded). I was in the Jugged hare at 21:35 and they told me that they weren't serving any more and the kitchen was shut. Fine, I ordered a quick drink, confirmed with them that the pub shut at 23:00 and went to the Tesco up the road and got a sandwich. I got back to the bar 22:35/22:40 went to order a drink and I was told the bar was now closed and they would not serve me despite it being very quiet and I could easily have got a drink and finished it before closing time. I don't know any pub that calls last orders so far before closing. I don't really think you can call yourself a 5* hotel if you can't even feed your guests and get them a drink during the times of the day you say you will.

I had a wonderful stay at Barbican Rooms in London. The room was exceptionally clean and incredibly comfortable, and the mattress ensured a restful sleep. The hotel's location was fantastic, offering convenient access to the underground through Barbican, Liverpool Street, and the Elizabeth line. Check-in was a breeze, and I appreciated the option to store my luggage. The air conditioning in the room was perfect, making my stay even more enjoyable. I highly recommend Barbican Rooms for a comfortable and convenient stay in London.
Excellent location. Everything touristy is nearby, if not the train station is super close. The staff is friendly and the room was great

Very good hotel. It's 5 stars hotel. Has all the amenities.
Excellent staff service. Very helpful. Full value for your money.
Rooms are a bit small.
Location is so so.
Finally,
I recommend !
For the price you pay= it's still a bargain. Full value for your money.
It's 5 stars in total.
27 july 2023

I had a great stay here on 23-Jul! The night team were extremely friendly, specifically Imran & Azher! They upgraded my room and improved my evening as I had a long day prior to arriving to The Barbican Rooms.

Thank you to the night team, it was much appreciated!

No hot water at night.

When checking in at noon, there was hot water to shower but every night when returning to the room towards midnight there was no hot water to shower.
Very unfortunate.

The location of the hotel is amazing, but that’s about it. I’ve travelled there with a group of colleagues and I have to admit we have made a big mistake when booking this hotel. The state of the rooms do not justify the price tag.
In my room, the air conditioning did not work. Or if it did, then it made very little difference to the temperature in the room. The bed was also so soft that I woke after one night of sleeping with pain in the back. Having gone through the day with pain, I thought I would sleep it off. Little did I know that a white night was waiting for me. I tried all the tricks in the book to make myself fall asleep only to give up around 1.00 am and I went down the reception of Barbican rooms to ask for painkillers. The guard/receptionist did not have so he called the main reception, but they did not have any as well. The amount of effort they put in was minimal, even though I made it clear that my back pain is caused by the bed. I ended up walking around London trying to find painkillers without any instructions from the receptionist. I can navigate myself, but given that the hotel prides itself as a 4 star hotel, the service is really missing.

From my colleagues, I’ve heard the following:
* one bathroom had broken tiles and the shower head was ducktaped. The tv was not working and the air conditioning was just as faulty as mine.
* another colleague’s tv set would inly show a single channel which had a wimbledon match from 20 years ago
* another colleague could not use the usb charger from the room because it was faulty

All in all, I can only recommend people to stay away from this hotel.
A bit expensive, because of holiday season. Nice staff and clean place
A/C in the room was insufficient, but everything else was great

¡Peor experiencia! No es un hotel de 4 estrellas. 3 con suerte.

El primer día llegué sola y el que me atendió me dice que me ofrecía una habitación “mejor” a la que tenía reservada sin costo adicional, si le dejaba un comentario con su nombre en TripAdvisor. Le agradecí el gesto. Cuando llegué a la habitación, efectivamente era grande pero estaba en el primer piso, frente al acceso del bar, por lo que sentí el movimiento de las personas que entraban y salían durante toda la noche. Además,  la habitación daba a la calle. El olor a humedad era muy fuerte y toda la ropa de cama y cortinas tenías manchas, y/o en mal estado. Al otro día, ya había llegado mi esposo, por lo que pedí que nos cambiaran de habitación y si bien la ubicación mejoró, me di cuenta que el estado de TODO es PÉSIMO. Este debe ser un hotel que se construyó a inicios del 2000 y, desde ahí, no han renovado ni mantenido correctamente nada, salvo algunos espacios comunes. Todo manchado, los muebles saltados, la ducha en el baño no funcionaba bien y, la guinda de la torta, el olor de los ascensores. Algo se había podrido (ya que lo usan para la comida del bar) y el olor era para vomitar.

Jamás volvería. Un asco.
reviews.textTranslated:
Worst experience! It is not a 4 star hotel. 3 with luck.

The first day I arrived alone and the person who attended me told me that he would offer me a "better" room than the one I had reserved at no additional cost, if I left a comment with his name on TripAdvisor. I thanked him for the gesture. When I got to the room, it was indeed large but it was on the first floor, facing the access to the bar, so I felt the movement of people coming and going throughout the night. Also, the room faced the street. The musty smell was very strong and all the bedding and curtains were stained and/or in poor condition. The next day, my husband had already arrived, so I asked to change our room and although the location improved, I realized that the state of EVERYTHING is TERRIBLE. This must be a hotel that was built in the early 2000s and since then nothing has been properly renovated or maintained except for some common spaces. Everything stained, the furniture jumped, the shower in the bathroom did not work well and, the icing on the cake, the smell of the elevators. Something had rotted (since they use it for bar food) and the smell was to throw up.

I would never go back. disgusting

reviews.text: Can't give any ratings (other than couch for its location) as such because the Brewery (opposite the road) decided to put us in the main hotel instead of the Barbican Rooms, so we never got to find out what the stay would have been like
Loved all about the stay - location, staff, comfy bed...good value for money too. Will definitely come back.

Great location, lovely room, historic and interesting building, great rain shower, comfy bed. Mr Ciprian our concierge was gracious and helpful, Sardor the bellhop was attentive and always had a smile in spite of being kept very busy by many guests needing help. I’d have liked a folder in the room with information about the facilities, and housekeeping didn’t show up until after 4 (perhaps with Mr Ciprian’s encouragement?) by which time I’d straightened up the room and washed the teacups myself, but we were generally quite satisfied with our stay.
I’ll add that we’d booked online at the Barbican Rooms (which are across the street from the Brewery), and I was disappointed that we couldn’t book at the Brewery, but when we checked in we were pleasantly surprised to be given a room at the Brewery. Seemed to be a drunken wedding party at the Rooms across the way but with double windows shut it was quite quiet. I would be delighted to be able to return to this charming hotel.
Nice location, clean rooms. Value for money

Hotel mediano. Não faz jus a 4 estrelas. Quarto legal, mas sem janela, se tinha não deu pra localizar, achei que os quartos são pequenos e não oferecem uma experiência única. De qualquer forma achei legal que dão chá e café no quarto e também pantufas e roupão para banho
reviews.textTranslated: Average hotel. It doesn't deserve 4 stars. Nice room, but without a window, if there was one, I couldn't find it, I thought the rooms are small and don't offer a unique experience. Anyway, I thought it was nice that they provide tea and coffee in the room and also slippers and a bathrobe

reviews.text: Really good services and rooms are very spacious vow suites are a classic example.

I recently stayed at this hotel for a weekend getaway and overall, I had a pleasant experience. The hotel's location was fantastic.

Upon arrival, the check-in process was smooth and the staff were friendly and helpful. My room was clean and well-appointed, featuring a comfortable bed, ample storage space, and a modern bathroom.

Having seen the negative reviews on this hotel, i can only concur. The positive areas are that the room looks good, location and that even though the windows are single glazed, its actually fairly quiet. The negatives are everything else. I would remark the incompetence and rudeness of staff - few exceptions here- and the terrible breakfast. A true two star hotel , at most

Generelt et noget slit hotel der måske en gang var et 5 stjernet hotel men absolut ikke er det mere.
Fik tildelt et værelse med baggårds udsigt og støjende fra en kompressor eller noget. Heldigvis kunne et af de ca. 8-10 forskellige og uoverskuelige lystændinger ikke slukke og efter flere forsøg fra personalet med at fikse det med tape fik vi tildelt et nyt værelse.
De 3 nætter måtte vi så døje med først støjende fra baren lige under og den sidste nat gik ventilationsanlægget amok og støjende så meget at vi igen måtte tilkalde hjælp denne gang forgæves idet det åbenbart skyldtes at naboen havde tændt for sin blæser. Så vi måtte sove med ørepropper.

Maden var middelmådig.

Venligt personale selv om der ikke var meget hjælp at hente.

Kan ikke anbefales.
reviews.textTranslated:
In general, a somewhat tired hotel that maybe once was a 5 star hotel but definitely not anymore.
Was assigned a room with a backyard view and noisy from a compressor or something. Fortunately, one of the approx. 8-10 different and unmanageable lights did not turn off and after several attempts by the staff to fix it with tape, we were assigned a new room.
The 3 nights we had to put up with noise from the bar just below and on the last night the ventilation system went crazy and noisy so much that we again had to call for help this time in vain as it was apparently due to the neighbor turning on his fan. So we had to sleep with ear plugs.

The food was mediocre.

Friendly staff although there was not much help to be had.

Cannot be recommended.

reviews.text: Wonderful hotel, next to the Barbican centre and a short walk from Liverpool Street station.  Can highly recommend.

Rooms are nice but avoid room 605, it does not have proper heating. After one freezing night, I was given a heating device, but that was not enough. If you are given this room, check temperature first with someone from the hotel and do not hesitate to ask for another one.
Disappointed   房間出現問題（沖涼🚿水制安裝出錯。），處理了近1小時，安排轉房間，都係出現問題，入住另一日，燈光全消失，處理和修理兩小時，無房轉。horrible experience!
reviews.textTranslated: Disappointed There was a problem with the room (the installation of the shower 🚿 water system was wrong.) It took nearly 1 hour to arrange to transfer the room, but there was a problem. On another day of check-in, the lights all disappeared. It took two hours to deal with and repair, and there was no room transfer. Horrible experience!

reviews.text: Great location, very friendly and accommodating staff and a lovely hotel itself.
We paid over £100 for a night and I was surprised to see that it was very basic. I was more displeased by the £50 deposit that took quite a while to be refunded. The location is quite good.

Hotel is very nice in general but the rooms are very small with small windows that don’t open. The room is also quite dated. Our AC was broken which became quite uncomfortable during the night. As people mention in the reviews, it’s not 5 star hotel but nice and cost effective for London.

Not as advertised.
A little miss leading kitchenette has no plates or cutlery just a microwave. Nothing to wash up with and only the hotel fridge which was tiny.
The gym wasn't really a gym. More of a cardio room with a few dumbells.
Rooms need updating.
Trying to park to book in was a faff. As we wanted to unload car before parking.
On a plus the staff were very friendly and helpful. Wouldn't stay here again though.
Fantastic hotel, we booked the superior double room, it was very spacious, large bath room. It was perfectly located for our requirements for the weekend.
Excellent staff, clean rooms and a great location.

Great location but overall a poor hotel. Staff were miserable and unprofessional.
Air conditioning did not work and the hotel is in desperate need of updating
Hola! Me gustaría saber si tenéis adaptador para el enchufe? Gracias!!
reviews.textTranslated: Hello! I would like to know if you have an adapter for the plug? Thank you!!

reviews.text: Room was tiny and not like the photos, was in a different building to the one which we thought was booked. TV didn't work and no idea where the two restaurants and bar were, apparently in a third building and not the one stated on the website. We stayed in two different hotels in September with similar prices, one was a large room the other was a huge suite. Very disappointed and will not be using again.

I've stayed in nicer Premier Inns at a 10th of the cost.

Tiny room with a bathroom and shower I could barely stand in. Very posh entrance but the room felt like it was falling apart.

Paper thin walls and single glazing. I was woken up throughout both nights by the hallway doors (loud enough I thought people were trying to get into my room), draining flushes and showers from other rooms, what sounded like a boiler spinning up in the early hours, glass collection in the courtyard. Once awake I could easily hear neighbouring room and the courtyards conversations.
Very clean and great bed ..
No Room service heaters in the bath was not working

Easy to walk from the tube to the Hotel but there’s no lift at Barbican station if you are traveling with a suitcase. The room was spacious enough, and the hotel tries to provide everything you need to make your stay convenient. The bed was super comfortable!!

Absolutely disgusting had this place booked for a business trip and what a shocker ..: this is no 5 star trust me what a mistake disgusting and used products left in the room for the next person checking in to use …

I would strongly recommend you steer clear
so bad hotel, they don't work well.

Definitely not a 5 star hotel. I have been to 3 star hotels infinitely better than this one. We were put in a different room than the one we booked and when we complained they moved us to a room that didn't seem to get cleaned since the 80s. Broken window, letting street noise in, fire alarm going on for no reason several times in a row preventing me from sleeping. When I complained at the reception desk, I was told that this fire alarm problem had been going on for a few weeks, that there wasn't much they could do, but that during the night it would stop (!!!) We were exhausted before the trip even started. With the exception of one polite employee (new, apparently started two weeks ago) all the employees extremely arrogant and rude. As if they were doing us a favor and not their job. We even had to listen a concierge making an extremely racist comment about how the heat wave in London was Morocco's fault and that "they could have this horrible weather, we (English) don't want it!". I asked for an plug adapter as the only plug close to the bed did not fit my CPAP machine, and even though I had borrowed an adapter during the afternoon, now the concierge was saying they did not have such a loaner and suggested I should have bought one earlier. Because of the deafening fire alarm going on for no reason, I also asked for earplugs, and the concierge's response was to say that no, I would not need those because, as they had mentioned before, at night the alarm should stop and turned away. I will definitely never go back to this hotel again and would not recommend it to anyone. Any Ibis can be better than this supposedly 5 star, full of staff with no professionalism.

Not a 5 star hotel. We checked in and were escorted us to a very tiny room with a crib that we didn’t ask for. We changed to a club room which was suitable but the drapes could not close in our room. The drapery track was missing in the middle. (Note at this time of year daybreak is 4:30 am) Our Concierge went looking for Eye masks for us to sleep 😂🤣 but he couldn’t find any!  Check our solution to close the drapes using pant hangers.  🤣 The 2nd picture shows drapes closed as far as they can.

Negatives:
-Nespresso coffee in the room, but only decaf pods available.
-Complimentary water is given, but there was only one small bottle
-Hairdryer was missing and never came when asked for one
-Bed runner was frayed

Positives:
The bed was very comfortable and bathrooms modern.
Avoid. Rude staff, rubbish rooms with windows that dont close that overlook a pub. Everything was broken in the room and it was filthy. It was also not the room I booked.
Check-in time took ages. We arrived on time and we been kept waiting for more than an hour. Keeping in mind this is not a cheap hotel, I think the service is terrible. Wouldn’t recommend!

We find the room design lovely. The room was spacious even the toilet. The room was also well ventilated and they have air condition perfect for summer time. The service is just okay. Most of the time there is no one at the receptionist and front so thats why I gave it 3 stars only.

They took our door off the hinges mid stay, charged us a deposit they said was half as much on the phone and then told us it would be instantly refunded on checkout. It took days to return. Barbican rooms front desk really unprofessional, mont calm main desk fine. Rooms were cramped and poor for a 5 star hotel.

A 5 star rated hotel that is worse than a Premier Inn.
Old buildings and rooms which could do with updating. I stayed in a tiny club room that cost £300 a night and didn't include breakfast. Despite the Google description stating "free breakfast"
Will not be staying again.

Shame that it was an event night in the Barbican. Outside in the courtyard I can understand  noise but the rooms don't stop the noise from an event. Rooms have strange layouts and poorly designed to have excess space in bathroom. Location is central but you get noise as a trade off.

Extremely helpful and kind staff. Nice size room and quite clean. There are 2 sites belong to the same hotel on the same road just across the street and you need to check in at the main building before going to the room, but that wasn't a problem.

Hidden gem in the City near Barbican, Moorgate and Liverpool Street. Friendly and efficient boutique hotel. Quiet rooms despite busy location. Very clean, well appointed and excellent value for money. Even as a Hilton Honors member, I shall be choosing Montcalm London from now on!
Excellent birthday trip. Impressive hotel with huge modern rooms and lots of facilities. Reception and concierge were friendly and helpful. Would recommend.
Beds are great. Location is perfect. Polite people...

While my parents enjoyed their stay here and said the place was really nice, I had messaged the hotel when I booked it asking them to ring me when my parents were checking in so that I could pay for it. I never got a call and then they charged my mum for it after they had flown home. She got charged €14 more than it was supposed to be and I have spent the last 2 weeks trying to get in contact with them about it, but I'm not having much luck.
Tried to contact a guest about an ongoing emergency but nobody was at reception or answered the phone for about an hour, Hardly 5 star customer service

Very nice place. Very nice people.
I am Dorina.
Room 101.
Thank you
Very basic rooms, and a generally tired looking hotel. Well situated though.
Poor cleanliness, unhelpful staff, small rooms, no water pressure, very bad wifi. Very unhappy with the experience. Definitely not coming back.

Myself and partner booked to stay here 16/17 April. Supposedly 5* hotel with a nice grand entrance.. the room was pokey at best and not at all clean. The bathroom especially was so poor. Peeling sinks and handles, mould all around shower, no power to wash properly in shower. We asked for more than 1 towel and if someome could please change bedding after night one and was told by the house keeping they speak no English and was rudely passed of.. we were so disappointed and quite frankly disgusted with how bad and unclean room was we booked travel lodge and didn't stay for the second night. They wouldn't pay us back for the second night we didn't use room and only offered 20% to say sorry that wee didn't have a nice clean 5* stay so basically all our money was used on 1 uncomfortable night. Thankfully travel lodge has normal showers and clean rooms and bedding. I do not recommend anyone spend their money at this establishment. Spend your hard earned money somewhere that actually is 5* and enjoy that actual 5*star experience. Wee will be posting pictures and videos on trip advisor. Terrible experience

The Booking.com confirmation page states you must present the credit card it was booked with to check in. I had booked the stay for 3 colleagues and would not be present myself, so I needed to check with the hotel that it was going to be OK not having the credit card it was booked with at check in.

I tried the only phone number available for the hotel at 7am, mid morning and early afternoon, ringing for several minutes each time. There was no response. I also messaged the hotel via Booking.com's chat system which usually results in a response from a hotel rep. Nope, not this time, absolutely nothing, even to this date.

A 5 star rating with posh amenities is all very nice, but I won't be using this hotel again if they can't afford to have someone answering the phone for customer queries.
Very cool hotel. Beautiful luxury rooms. Great team.

Checked in to our room and not up to standard so we were moved across the road to the west wing my wife opened the door of the room to be greeted by the the image of a couple in the mid throws of passion 😳 obviously room was occupied and they didn't know eventually got another room no one in it this time 😀 very tired room mirror hanging off wall stained bedding had a small kitchen with no cutlery or plates of any description so fairly pointless
Checked out in the morning and woman next to us was complaining that someone came into their room at midnight just as they had got to sleep
Laughable but very wrong not 5 star by any stretch would not return !
Treble stay there rooms need up dating running of breakfast cracked glasses in bathroom can go on & on

The rooms were out dated but the mattress in the bad was ok.
Big like on the water bottles every day.
And the location was perfect.
Agree on the stars. This is not an 5 star hotel but could be.
I've stayed in many premium London hotels, this was by far the worst. Incompetent staff, disgusting mess, I could go on.
Amazing hotel for bargain price. Room was huge, bed very comfy. Excellent facilities. Would definitely stay again.

WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!

This is not a 5 stars hotel at all!!

I arrived at 7 pm, took ages to check in so I was late to a work meeting. They gave me a smaller room than the one that I booked, they were saying that was upgraded, which obviously was NOT as I could see in my booking. I booked a studio room as I need to work and I wanted to be comfortable. It was 23 pm and I was moving around with my bag changing rooms (Never the studio I booked) They said someone will pick me up to my new room, never happened. I have to the reception because I was completely ignored.

The bathroom is broken and they said someone will come and again NO ONE CAME EVER! :(  The rooms are old and run down.

Never an apology, and they gave me an attitude.
Run somewhere else if you can.

I'm dreading staying here 2 more nights.

Lovely comfortable beds. Had a great sleep. Liked the style of the Jugged Hare Bar. Doesn't warrant five stars however, no room service and no teas tray etc in the room. If advertising as five stars i should able to get a cuppa
Awful for a 5 star hotel. Dated rooms, bad bed, very small rooms

Hard to find as the name Barbican Rooms not obvious, reception through an archway adjacent to the Jugged Hare with Montcalm as main name showing.  Wasnt impressed with room faults had to move to another room which wasn't a whole lot better.
