Beautiful place, big rooms, but that’s all. It’s unclear where to check-in - Booking and Google Maps indicate different entries on different sides of the street. Bed was extremely soft - disaster for the back. It was super cold in the bathroom.
Apart from the really annoying key cards that needed resetting every time I arrived back... it was very clean, comfortable and reasonably priced.

Hi, totally not worthy of being a 5star hotel. Small rooms congested will never book again. Too cold rooms,Smelly bed , although bathroom was good with heated floor thats only the good plus point which i can give 1 star.
Nice ,quiet bolt hole ,clean and relaxing

SCAMMERS be careful. 1 hour waiting to be checked in because they couldn't find our booking. Never even a simple apology for the delay or issues. Room keys didn't work. Then checked our bank account and they had charged an extra €200. Thankful are flight had not taken off arrived back the hotel.. Told me didn't stay last night from the lady who checked me in! Crazy!! Thankfully we booked with Booking.com and they are holding these scammers accountable for there actions! STAY AWAY

I had the worst experience and left in tears. I generally don't expect too much from hotels just good service, a nice and comfortable room however the bare minimum they cannot provide.
I was firstly greeted by very rude staff who looked at me like I didn't belong in the hotel, they questioned the credentials of my company card which concluded with me having to cover the costs initially for a company trip. I was later escorted to a dingy looking superior room, which looked run down and away from the other rooms. It was extremely cold, with the heater not working and the hot water not working either. I requested for it to be fixed because it was freezing (also considering it was going to snow that evening, how cold it was) or to be moved to another room but they did nothing. I was stuck with this terrible room. I then in the morning tried to fix the payment issue to which I was implied to be a liar and spoken to in the most disrespectful manner.

I would compare the room quality to easyHotel (no disrespect to easyHotel) but with a tad bit of luxury, at least with easyHotel you know what you paid for. I WILL NEVER BE GOING BACK HERE! ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING TREATMENT

Arrived at 8.00pm to be told that they had a system error and could not find our booking which soon changed to the rooms not having been cleaned. Staff incredibly un-helpful and would not talk to us. We were lucky as whilst waiting for someone to do something people who had been told the same thing earlier and asked to go away and come back again were coming back. Some from 2.00pm! After a huge amount of argument we managed to persuade the "manager" to book us rooms at a sister hotel. Absolutely appalling! no way should this hotel have 3 stars let alone 5! Do not stay here!

Certainly not worthy of a five star; I did like the doorman however, he was a nice gentleman who appeared to enjoy his job. The remaining staff were rude and were not happy. They were "fake nice" and not particularly helpful, they also always required help with the check-in. The room was not too bad, with a comfy bed. No special additions to the room you'd expect with a 5*, particularly after telling them it was our anniversary. Won't go back to be honest.
Shocking staff and service
Solid room for the night in a good spot accessible for the City

Hi can I have a customer service representative reach out to get an email? I paid over 200 on Thursday but when I got there you sent me to another hotel and I spent the same again, I want a refund. Please get in touch
Cancelled our booking with 1 hours notice. No reason given, no customer service, leaving us stranded in London.
During quarantine they are very coperative , neat and tidy room,
I rectify my initial evaluation. They have finally agreed to make the refund. Of course, in my opinion they have taken too long, but in any case they have it done.

I couldn't get into the country because of the virus and they're not offering any refund, not even partial! I feel like it is standard service - I had a booking at a different place and they emailed me directly to ask if I needed a refund before I even contacted them.
Below the standard of this type of hotel. Rooms were small and minimal. You were just a number. Could do better

similarHotelsNearby.name: Great Northern Hotel, a Tribute Portfolio Hotel, London
The Rokxy Townhouse -Kings Cross est 2022
similarHotelsNearby.description: Casual rooms in a Victorian townhouse

reviews.text: Stunning outside and common areas. However rooms are quite outdated and in need of renovation...
Absolutely amazing and expensive

Staying here as I write this review – the hotel exterior and lobby are cool and vibey, but the rooms are REALLY underwhelming (stained carpets, dated drapery, small semi-dangerous/leaky showers, dank smell, terrible beds, ONE outlet) which soured our experience. I would NOT categorize this hotel as “luxury”, or give it anywhere near 5-stars. Honestly the rooms are worse than you’d get at a Holiday Inn. If you’re like me and care about a clean, updated, well appointed room, I suggest you look elsewhere.
Class
洗練されたホテル。歴史を感じつつ最高のサービスも。ラウンジのご飯もおいしい。電車へのアクセスも良好。
reviews.textTranslated: A sophisticated hotel. Great service with a sense of history. The food in the lounge is also delicious. Good access to trains.

reviews.text: swell

Took us a while to write this review but, we stayed here on the evening of our wedding back in May.

The rooms are absolutely gorgeous, high ceilings and spacious en-suites with room service and the food was so delicious.

We walked around to see the different restaurants, bars and architecture and the staff were so welcoming, polite and warm.

Our favourite part was the breakfast buffet the next morning. Wow what a selection. Highly recommend to anyone. Thank you St.Pancras Hotel for making our stay so special.

We will definitely stay with you again.

All the best,

R & C
Amazing facilities for business event. Great location by St Pancras International. I enjoyed a nice breakfast buffet before attending event. Beautiful architecture and we'll taken care of.
Amazing

酒店不論外觀內裝地點都讓人有一個很好的經驗，但是千萬不要相信官方訂房網站，因為我為此付了兩倍的價錢住宿體驗。
於住宿體驗前約一個月，我先用會員在官方系統訂了一晚不含早餐且不可退款的訂單，過幾分鐘後覺得五星酒店應該包套吃個飯店早餐，根據訂房訊息中表示若在訂房當天當地時間23:59前取消是不會收取任何費用的，因此我取消第一筆訂單，之後立刻下單第二筆訂單同天含早餐，於是我的信箱只有收到第二筆的確認訂單訊息，我就理所當然認知為第一筆訂單可成立時間太短就直接取消，所以我預定成功跟取消的郵件等沒有收到，後續也只有收到第二筆訂單通知詢問是否要加入個人行事曆。但是直到住宿前幾天，我收到第一筆及第二筆訂單的歡迎入住信件便向客服人員反應此狀況，他們表示三個工作天後會回覆我此狀況的處理。我入住時因為管理階層尚未回應，所以櫃檯人員就先備份我跟客服的談話，之後到退房隔天我收到第一筆訂單的取消信件，但是並沒有收到退款，於是我詢問飯店，後續得到的是因為本身就是不可退款訂單，所以無法退款。想要反應的是，這樣其實飯店一開始當天午夜前的取消政策無需付款這個服務可能系統上的登錄問題，再者若是確認無法退款，是否能在房間還能入住期間告知，而非等住宿時間已過，才告知管理階層決議無法退款，這樣我連轉讓或是贈與朋友的機會都沒有，住宿就直接被取消，且飯店就直接得到這筆款項。
reviews.textTranslated:
The hotel has a good experience regardless of its appearance, interior or location, but don't trust the official booking website, because I paid twice the price for the accommodation experience.
About a month before the accommodation experience, I first used my membership to make a non-refundable reservation for one night without breakfast through the official system. After a few minutes, I felt that a five-star hotel should include a hotel breakfast. According to the reservation message, if There will be no charge for cancellation before 23:59 local time on the day of booking. Therefore, I canceled the first order and immediately placed a second order including breakfast on the same day, so I only received the second order in my mailbox. After confirming the order message, I naturally understood that the first order could be canceled immediately after being established for a short period of time. Therefore, I did not receive an email indicating the success of the reservation or the cancellation. Subsequently, I only received a second order notification asking if I wanted to join. Personal calendar. However, a few days before my stay, I received the welcome letters for my first and second orders and reported this situation to the customer service staff. They said they would reply to me in three working days to deal with this situation. When I checked in, the management had not yet responded, so the front desk staff backed up my conversation with the customer service. Then the day after I checked out, I received a cancellation letter for the first order, but did not receive a refund, so I asked the hotel , and what I got later was that it was a non-refundable order, so it could not be refunded. What I would like to respond to is that in fact, the hotel's cancellation policy before midnight on the first day does not require payment. This service may be a login problem on the system. Furthermore, if it is confirmed that refunds cannot be made, can we inform you while the room is still available instead of waiting for accommodation? After the time passed, I informed the management that the refund could not be made. In this way, I did not even have the opportunity to transfer or give it to a friend. The accommodation was directly canceled and the hotel received the money directly.

reviews.text:
Hotel location is fantastic. Nothing is better than this hotel if you are going to take Eurostar the next day. Literally the station is downstairs!
Room is extremely expensive but interior is more of 3star local hotel style. Everything is old and dated. Shower area is small and you have to take shower in the bathtub which is potentially very dangerous. It is still very slippery even though we place the bath matt on.. whewww....
Lobby is amazing though, its like a dreamy place especially with all the lights on.

Impresionante edificio tanto por fuera como en su interior.
Estupendo trato y profesionalidad en recepción y gran servicio de limpieza.
Habitación amplia y bien dotada ("chaise longue", mesa redonda, dos sillas, televisor grande, armarios amplios, hervidor, cafetera, cafés y tés, galletitas, agua de cortesía todos los días...), cama enorme y muy cómoda, excelente insonorización.
Baño grande con ducha cómoda y perfecta presión de agua.
Muy bien desayuno en un salón precioso con personal atento y amable.
Varias zonas de restauracióna cada cual más recomendable.
Imprescindible para celebración especial o viaje capricho.
reviews.textTranslated:
Impressive building both outside and inside.
Great treatment and professionalism at reception and great cleaning service.
Spacious and well-equipped room ("chaise longue", round table, two chairs, large TV, large closets, kettle, coffee maker, coffee and tea, cookies, complimentary water every day...), huge and very comfortable bed, excellent soundproofing.
Large bathroom with comfortable shower and perfect water pressure.
Very good breakfast in a beautiful room with attentive and friendly staff.
Several restaurant areas, each one more recommended.
Essential for a special celebration or whim trip.

reviews.text: Stayed here multiple times and generally doesn't disappoint. However for the best room experience you need to stay to the rear of the hotel, nicer, more luxurious rooms. Checking flawless, and the reception area a busy delight as it is combined with a cafe that is open to all. Definitely a go to if you have onward rail travel.
the building looks amazing

Don't get me wrong, the St. Pancras hotel is beautiful and we had a lovely time there. It is upscale, clean, and conveniently located next to King's Cross / St. Pancras stations. The staff service left much to be desired, however. As an example, on our last day we asked for our luggage to be held for a few hours, an otherwise common request than much lesser establishment offer by default. The front desk at first said "there is no space." (This is a gigantic hotel with whole empty floors.) Then that holding our bags would be a "security issue." (A security issue which would magically go away if we had an upcoming reservation and we were planning to return.) Even when we politely explained that we would miss our train if we had to find alternative luggage storage, as indeed we did miss our train, the hotel remained inflexible. This profound lack of hospitality renders this no longer the lovely five-star hotel I had in my memories. (We had stayed there several times before.) I will be looking for establishments in which thousands of pounds actually translate to high-quality hospitality in the future.
Nice hotel on train station, great breakfast and service.
Loved this place
Outstanding location and outstanding service. Highly recommend.
What impressed me the most was the accuracy of the rooms according to the photos!
Great location, nice atmosphere but unpleasant check in experience.

Went for the day spa and massage that was absolutely amazing I would probably say it’s the best I’ve had , the service is outstanding and everything you need is provided, the pool was perfect temperature, the steam room and sauna was brilliant, just everything about the place is everything you expect from a 5* hotel and the price for 2 people including an hour massage as a couple was around £140 pp bit pricey but definitely worth it !  Thank you very much St Pancras

Ik was in de lobby voor catch-up en drink met een Londense kennis. Heel toffe locatie, super aangename service. Het ligt tussen Sint Pancras en Euston station dus een gemakkelijke plaats om af te spreken.
Aangename en hoge ruimte. Fijne zeteltjes, rustige sfeer en achtergrond muziek.
reviews.textTranslated:
I was in the lobby for catch-up and drinks with a London acquaintance. Very nice location, super pleasant service. It is located between St Pancras and Euston station so an easy place to meet.
Pleasant and high space. Comfy seats, quiet atmosphere and background music.

reviews.text: Top top
Не съм отсядала в хотелът. Бях за малко, но бях удивена от това приказно място, където не случайно е сниман Хари Потър. И хората бяха много приветливи.👌👍😍
reviews.textTranslated: I haven't stayed at the hotel. I was there for a while, but I was amazed by this magical place, where it was no coincidence that Harry Potter was filmed. And the people were very welcoming.👌👍😍

reviews.text: Outstanding hotel
Ok, we’ve only been here 5 minutes, but we are utterly blown away at how amazing this place is!  Our check in Agent, Irene, fixed a glitch with our check-in and we couldn’t be happier!!
Beautiful building with lots of history.. I've eaten here, had drinks and used the spa, all were top notch 💖💯🙏🏽👍🏾
Ridiculously expensive bar.

We took the París to London train that goes under the English Channel and it drops you off at the International train station which is also within the same building this amazing hotel. Amazing experience.
ジュニアスイートに泊まり風邪引きました(笑)天井高い高い６月で外３０度だけど夜寒い寒い⛄ユーロスター乗るためだけ泊まるならありですが値段高い上に設備は古く傷んでますが(当然ですが)古城ホテル好きなかた以外薦めません。駅はほんと近いです。でも駅前にもっと綺麗で安く広い部屋のホテルはたくさんあります❗
reviews.textTranslated: I stayed in a junior suite and caught a cold (laughs). It's June with high ceilings and it's 30 degrees outside, but it's cold at night. I do not recommend it unless you like old castle hotels. The station is really close. But there are many hotels in front of the station that are cleaner, cheaper and have larger rooms.

reviews.text: Just wonderful hotel and staff cant fault it well worth the cost

Cookies for breakfast are to die for
The service is perfect and people are very nice

We had such an incredible stay here, the hotel is beautiful and the staff is amazing. A VERY SPECIAL shout out to Peter worlds best bellmen! He was so accommodating, kind, and helpful. He made our trip! Thank you, Peter and the rest of the staff!

I stayed at St Pancras in the Barlow House and had a premier king bedroom, large guest room from Sept 12- Sept 17, room 433 with continental breakfast for two people. The hotel's location gives easy access to travel anywhere in London and boarding Eurostar. You can walk across the street to King Cross station and walk 7–10 minutes to Euston station. As well as very convenient access to the underground.
The Hotel building is beautiful. The room was nice and spacious; however, the room was not well kept. The window curtains, the chaise lounge chair and the bed pillows were stained and dirty (the sheets and pillowcase were clean, but the pillow itself was not). I advised the front desk on the first day I arrived there was mold in the shower wall however it appeared that someone made a mere attempt to clean it off by just wiping the shower wall because it did not remove the mold. The mold from the shower wall was fully cleaned off one day before I checked out. I also ended up with a rash in my neck because I fell asleep hugging a pillow and without knowing during my sleep the pillowcase slipped off. This resulted in an big ugly and painful rash on my neck. I ended up going to the pharmacy to get ointment cream for the severe rash that lasted until the end of my UK trip: Sept 24th. The room needs a full deep cleansing because it ruined my experience in London, and I do not wish this upon anyone else. Especially for the price of the stay; Sept 12 629.00, Sept 13 589.00, Sept 14 629.00, Sept 15 409.00 and Sept 16 409.00
- Carolina Aguilar

I spent a week there with my family and I didn’t want to leave. The hotel is very whimsical and spacious which is difficult to find in london. The chambers lounge is a must, I spent most of my days there working and munching away. I’m saving the best for last the team there is absolutely amazing and the best thing about the hotel. Ankur and Aisha were absolutely incredible with making sure we were happy and comfortable at all times, through out the day they would check on us ask if we needed anything. Mercedes and Patrice checked us in and they were also incredibly welcoming, took us to our rooms and helped us settle in well. This hotel has definitely gotten a regular for life

Let's start with the positives... excellent location you can literally get to it from the main station, as it was originally part of st Pancras. The building is stunning. Rooms was spacious and well equipped. However other than when booking in, the staff were aloof, and not one of them smiled. Service is poor and slow. Not what you would expect for 5star accommodations. Also the food was overpriced and again quite a limited menu for a 5star hotel. The same with the drinks, far overpriced. But what really caused the low score was the staff. Must do better here.
My favourite hotel in London. I try and stay here every time I’m in town.
Wonderful hotel cant fault anything about it
Just wonderful. Great location.

The service was a disaster from start to finish. My room was given away even though I had called ahead to make sure they were aware I would be arriving in the morning and to not give away my room. This led to wifi that didn't work, daily cleanings that did not come, and delays on basic requests throughout the stay. A couple of misunderstandings or oversights would have been fine, but the repeated incompetence was astounding, and I cannot state strongly enough how disappointing the stay was.

This property will not disappoint in its convenient location, the beauty of the building not really fantastic front desk staff. The lounge, has a great selection of services throughout the day, however we did find that there were great variations in the hours that the services were provided between what was posted and what we were told. None the less this is an excellent addition to your stay should you have access. Our room, a suite, was very generously proportioned, with a glorious washroom, very comfortable (fluffy)bed, beautiful views and a lovely seating area.
I visited the hotel only, hopefully so day I'll book a room there.
Service is great. They have picked the people who work here. All helpful and smiling.
Amazinggggg!!!!

Such an embarrassment for a five star hotel. Like a joke! I got a room on the 7th floor basically facing a wall, then changed to a room with broken furniture. Such a welcoming experience. Awful view, not worth a penny of your money, not even a comfy bed. Basically the worth five star hotel that I have been as a frequent traveler.

Great location, easy access to almost anywhere we needed to go in London.

The rooms were comfortable and a decent size.

Really enjoyed the Chamber's Club and especially Anthony, he was great. His customer service is excellent, he went above and beyond and he's very knowledgeable about the hotel.

Amazing position in the center of London, mainly inside the St. Pancreas station. The building is astonishing, great use of the spaces that were part of the station once. Rooms are fine, but there is a complete lack of electric outlets, that is a problem when I n these days we travel with many of them. In the bedroom that was only one for a double bed, very disappointing. People working there are nice, but I tried to call both reception and concierge for around 30 min, but none ever answered. The in the end I gave up and just went to bed. Price/quality is just okay, but not sure worth the price.

Lovely hotel but way overpriced. We were on the Barlow house end and boy did it feel dated. The two bed room was huge which was a great perk. However the chair in the room was horribly stained and the design of the tub was very difficult for short people and water leaked everywhere.

We loved the garden bar and the staff was friendly and accommodating. Easy access into St Pancras and Kings Cross is a huge perk.

One thing I did love was the walkway to the roof garden and Barlow house smelled lovely with the plants
Imprescindible visitar-lo si vas a Londres.  Antic hotel al costat de l,antiga estació de trens
reviews.textTranslated: A must visit if you go to London. Old hotel next to the old train station

reviews.text:
Still on night number 3 of 5 so may update.

Definitely missing Antony in the Chambers Club tonight. He was there our first two nights and is the absolute epitome of fantastic customer service. Super friendly, interesting to talk to, and even went way out of his way to take us up to this secret staircase which has been featured in several films and music videos. He even climbed the stairs with us and told us about the building's history. Was going to give 4 stars but Antony's hospitality easily makes it 5⭐s.

The room is pretty good. Shower/tub combo is a bit dated but works. Comfortable beds and the room size is great for central London.

Location is excellent... Walking distance to loads of things and easy access to the tube and longer distance trains.
Amazing architecture!!!

Beautiful hotel. A 15 min walk to granary square, a 30 min walk to the theatre district and a 25 min cab ride to the Tower of London. Not only that but it’s right by Kings Cross and next to St. Pancras Station (which has shops and an Alice Liddell installation; just beware of pickpockets and don’t let anyone take your picture in the station if they ask you).

The hotel has wonderful service and kind people at the front desk. The room I stayed in was spacious and clean. The room service was divine (highly recommend the parmesan truffle fries and trout salad if they have it). The complimentary Drury black tea in the room was delicious!

What used to be a magical hotel  has now been reduced to American mediocrity. The service was indifferent, towels are old, lights came on in the middle of night and could not be switched off, broken refrigerators, no extra blankets, and more. The only service with  standards was the Spa.  Maybe it's the pandemic and things are still climbing back to what they were. I can only hope.
Fantastic hotel .

Incredible hotel with phenomenal service! The rooms could DEFINITELY be better, as they don’t match the exterior or beauty of the rest of the hotel. I recommended eating at the Booking restaurant on-site, as Rosario and Peter were hilarious and attentive! There was an error with my meal, and it was quickly corrected. Peter and Rosario were the highlights of our stay!

Absolutely stunning hotel. Beautiful in every way. We stayed in the heritage rooms with access to the Chambers club.
The room was large with a view over the station concourse & had a huge comfortable bed and a separate bath room and toilet. The most impressive feature of the room was the ceiling hight, incredible!
I prefer a stand up shower to the shower in a bath tub that this room had, but it wasn’t really an issue.

Breakfast was lovely, as were the drinks and nibbles provided in the club lounge.

Exploring the hotel was incredible and I will be back to dine in the Grand Midland dining room when I can!

Super easy access to the tube to get around the city and some nice pubs within a short walk.
Bottle of wine and macaroons to recognise Marriott gold membership was a nice touch.

Sadly they let me check out, I was hoping they would force me to stay another night! Thanks for a great stay
Posh. Eerie. Almost hypnotically dark. Longest walk to a hotel loo in ages. Almost didn't make it in time!
Room was very bad, not clean. Never worth the money. Its near to the train station and the entramce looks nice. Rest is not better than in an average 3* ibis hotel.

Stunning building and one to stop and see.

I stopped here for a drink in the bar. Great place to spend the time waiting for a train.
Great service, great drinks, and an exceptionally accommodating team that were so lovely to our baby girl that we had with us. However, no baby changing facilities!?
Great Hotel, Very Clean, great size rooms  staff brilliant 5⭐️

I stayed 330 times in Bonvoy and this is for sure the worst experience ever. They don’t bother with any service as they are always fully booked and don’t care. I had 5 bad issues and the worst took me a whole afternoon to sort out. I had a package delivered to the hotel and the were 100 % sura it didn’t arrive. After half a day they finally found it ! They still haven’t made any apologies. This was just one of many issues for example I booked and got confirmed a double room but got a twin room
Embarrassing experience

Lovely afternoon  with friends
Only there for the afternoon didn't stay but will one day

Absolutely fabulous place to stay and wonderful breakfast and lovely staff .right in the middle of everything. Our room did not have a walk in shower so older people need to be careful. Otherwise top notch would love ❤️ to come back and stay.
Só estava de passagem apreciando a beleza da arquitetura deste lugar!
reviews.textTranslated: I was just passing through appreciating the beauty of the architecture of this place!

bathroom is so pretty
what about the room

reviews.text: Square st Pancras Google company

Be treated like a royal. Quintessential British imperial service in a spectacular setting.  Starting from the front desk, Kevin and Nick both were available at a moments notice to provide what was needed including finding a crutch for me in a few minutes when a back injury made it difficult for me to move.  The location next to  the Kings Cross station with its famous platform 9 and 3/4is the envy of most visitors to London.  The hotels built around there St Pancras International station which can whisk you to Paris in 2 hours.  Rooms are done very well with all the modern conveniences.  Room and maid service were exemplary.

The perfect stay!
Beautiful obviously,  but some staff went above and beyond, notably Irene on the front desk who was patient and incredibly helpful and Aaron in he Chambers lounge who put a huge amount of effort into making our special occasion perfect!
Thank you

similarHotelsNearby.name: Sloane Square Hotel
similarHotelsNearby.description: Elegant rooms & brasserie in chic spot

similarHotelsNearby.description: Plush, modern hotel with chic dining

similarHotelsNearby.description: Polished lodging with free cream teas

reviews.text:
Horrendous.  The refurbishment following their sale to Iconic Luxury Hotels has removed every ounce of charm and character this hotel (formerly the Draycott) used to have.
What is worse, the service is beyond terrible.  Where to start? No tea or coffee (or anything) served after 10am.  No porridge served at breakfast (in an Iconic luxury hotel?).  The fire alarm goes off and nobody knows where to turn it off for over 15 minutes while the guests wait on the street.
The phone in the room does not work for the entire 4 day stay, forcing a couple in their 80s to walk down 3 steep flights of stairs every time they need something.
The "garden suite" has no window (but is priced palatially).
And so it goes on.  Having been loyal guests of the Draycott for over 10 years we are going to have to find another place to stay in London.
This was a once-in-a-lifetime disaster!
Great staff and well appointed rooms.

Wonderful one night stay. Could not have wished for a better place. Lovely room which was more like an apartment. Comfortable, traditional and fabulous setting. Staff were helpful and courteous. Due to undergoing refurbishment we were able to get this room at an excellent price. We did not feel compromised in any way by the facilities. A very positive experience.

We had an outstanding experience,  the hotel is in the perfect location that ticked all the boxes for us: close to Sloan Square, 10 minute walk to Harrods, 15 minute walk to Hyde Park, close to the tube, walking distance to great shopping and dining. The staff here were so friendly and helpful, we don't travel light and have our 2yo daughter with us on a world trip, so from the moment we arrived on the door step the staff took our very heavy bags straight up to our room. As others have mentioned the hotel is under new management and undergoing some renovations initially we were a little worried reading this, however we could not have been happier with our stay, we had an amazing room, it was very quiet and peaceful, everything worked well and even the hot water was instant! The beds were very comfortable and the staff kept the room well appointed and amenities stocked up. We ordered in some Thai food and the staff brought up plates and cutlery along with the delivery, they certainly went the extra mile to make our stay as comfortable and memorable as possible. We certainly will stay here again when we next travel the world in 12 to 24 months. Thank you!

Merveilleux séjour, joliment décoré pour les fêtes de fin d’année, accueil agréable et professionnel, suite Rattigan ,chambre coquette et spacieuse avec cheminée, bien situé, très bon petit déjeuner, cadre luxueux et agréable, seul bémol ( salle de bain petite).
reviews.textTranslated: Wonderful stay, nicely decorated for the end of year celebrations, pleasant and professional welcome, Rattigan suite, pretty and spacious room with fireplace, well located, very good breakfast, luxurious and pleasant setting, only downside (small bathroom).

reviews.text:
I'm extremely sad and disappointed with the management of The Draycott. My family and I have been staying at The Draycott for over 25 years (at least one trip per year) beginning when my two daughters were kids (and now adults). Every experience was always perfect, with afternoon tea, an evening glass of champagne and, of course, hot chocolate in the late evening. The staff has been and still is terrific. They watched our kids grow up! The Draycott has been our "home away from home" in London.

We are booked to stay in mid-February, a reservation I made last August.Two days ago I received an email informing me that the hotel had been sold to the owners of 11 Cadogan Gardens Hotel around the corner and that the hotel:
"...........will begin a series of refurbishments on the 3rd January 2023 [note: I received this email after 3/1].The hotel will be operating with altered facilities and services to normal while the works are undertaken.  Houses 26 and 24 will be closed, meaning you will need to use the entrance of House 22 to enter/exit the premises. There will be a scaffolding in House 22,24 and 26.  The Drawing Room, Library and Dining Room will be closed and the complementary Tea, glass of English Sparkling Wine and Hot Chocolate unavailable.Unfortunately, breakfast will be room service only and limited to a continental offering."

In short, it will be a construction site and they will not be providing the quality services nor have the amenities that have historically defined The Draycott.I asked the reservationist why they had not offered to honor my reservation with comparable rooms at Number 11 (given the common ownership), especially given it's the slow season. I didn't get a satisfactory response. I asked that the manager, who's been with the hotel a long time and knows we are a longstanding and regular hotel guest, call me to discuss. I have not heard back from anyone.

I would think the owners of Number 11 would be interested in keeping longstanding guests of The Draycott and I'm pretty sure they would be surprised that no one has followed up with me.

Sadly, we will likely cancel our reservation at The Draycott and look for a new "home away from home" in London.

We spent five days here right before Christmas.  Wonderful Victoria setting - very warm and homey.  Great staff and very nice breakfast - although the menu could be more varied. Fireplaces in all room provided a wonderful holiday atmosphere - as did the
Attractive holiday decorations.  Our room was spacious with a working fireplace (gas).  Bathroom was on the small size but adequate. Amenities included tea at 3 PM, mulled wine at 6 PM, and hot chocolate at 9 PM. Will stay here again.  Highly recommended.  Did I mention the great location? One block from Sloane square and Pavillion Road and a 10 minute walk to Elizabeth Street in Belgravia.
Boʻladi
reviews.textTranslated: It will be

Típico hotel inglés en Chelsea. Acogedor y donde se cuida a la gente.
Recomendable

Typical English hotel in Chelsea. Cozy and where people are taken care of.
recommendable

reviews.text: Terrific hotel and rooms with attentive staff

The Mantis Draycott hotel is absolutely beautiful with its gorgeous English style. The service during my stay was great, and the afternoon tea is a nice touch.

However, the room I stayed in had a broken A/C unit and one of the windows would not open, so the room was very hot at night.

We stayed here for my Birthday and this was the second time. My wife made a real effort and payed and asked for balloons to be left out with special gifts in which not only was the room made up when we arrived they lost one of the gifts. Their is no room service on drinks and I also had to pay for water which is a first time for me. The breakfast in which was late also was cold and very expensive was not worth it. Unfortunately we would not be staying in this hotel again. Sorry they need to do better. Adam Upton
Fabulous hotel in a perfect location for visiting Chelsea and the surrounding area

I stayed here 2 years ago and it was one of the best hotels I have stayed in. With the gorgeous rooms and access to the beautiful central garden making it very special.

It is also situated in a very central location
A place you feel like home
Lovely hotel with great staff in a fabulous location. Very comfortable and classically English
Lovely staff ,very helpful. Great breakfast
Staff are friendly
Excellent!
Lovely place
very cosy and lovely staff!
Great to be able to stay in this lovely town house. Business trip during COVID closure else where. Felt very welcome and enjoyed walking around London whilst it's so quiet
Requintado, acolhedor, confortável e bem localizado
reviews.textTranslated: Refined, welcoming, comfortable and well located

reviews.text: Bellissimo hotel in uno dei quartieri più belli e tranquilli di Londra , stanze grandi e molto accoglieti con arredamenti tipici inglesi , come sentirsi a casa propria, il pomeriggio dalle 16 pm alle 17 pm viene offerto il tè, dopo viene offerto un bicchiere di champagne e la sera si può gustare una buonissima cioccolata calda , un toccasano dopo una giornata di passeggio , consigliatissimo
reviews.textTranslated: Beautiful hotel in one of the most beautiful and quiet neighborhoods of London, large and very welcoming rooms with typical English furnishings, like feeling at home, in the afternoon from 4pm to 5pm tea is offered, after which a glass of champagne is offered and in the evening you can enjoy a delicious hot chocolate, a panacea after a day of walking, highly recommended

reviews.text: Un gioiello. Ottima location, personale grandioso e bellissimo...
reviews.textTranslated: A jewel. Great location, great staff and beautiful...

reviews.text: Maravilhoso. Pessoal muito atencioso. Extremamente limpo e muito calmo para descansar.
reviews.textTranslated: Wonderful. Very attentive staff. Extremely clean and very calm to rest.

reviews.text: I agree
Stunning old fashioned real English country hotel.

Impressed in so many ways with this hotel! Not only was it in a cute part of London with shops and restaurants all around, it was also close to the Tube. I felt I was in some Victorian movie with the eloquent room, ample space inside (hard to find in EU), and helpful, friendly staff. We even went down for champagne hour and met some lovely guests from other parts of the world and had a wonderful chat. Can't wait to stay at this hotel again when I am in London.
Great old fashioned English hotel

A brief visit to London was made all the more enjoyable by the reception, staff and accommodation at the Draycott. Spacious bedrooms, private garden access from the ground floor suite, excellent room served breakfast, decently stocked honesty bar, pleasant and charming staff. Good price for well positioned and well appointed accommodation, ideal for enjoying London, Chelsea and knightsbridge, etc. They took special effort to care for my mother who travelled with me, much appreciated. Having stayed in various hotels across Europe, this was a very pleasant experience in London.

My husband and I visited the Draycott yesterday for afternoon tea and I would like to offer a rather mixed review about this. The drawing room where it was served was lovely, the gentleman attending to us was fab and the food was lovely and very generous however the drawing room leads onto a garden and there was some rather large issue with a family staying there that made our visit really uncomfortable and stressful. The woman kept running in and out slamming doors and shouting and the it child was doing the same and kept coming to our table and staring at is. It was quite cold and as the room is small it was very disruptive and noisy and the relaxing ambience of afternoon tea was ruined by this. The staff didnt do anything either until we complained and it was too late. It's a shame as it's a lovely place to visit but it was tainted by this family's behaviour.
Amazing owners, friendly staff, beautiful area of London, old charm
Excelente sitio .
reviews.textTranslated: Excellent site.

reviews.text: Pequeño hotel con una atmosfera muy agradable, en  la zona mas chic del barrio de Chelsea. Es un hotel donde experimentar el gusto clasico ingles
reviews.textTranslated: Small hotel with a very pleasant atmosphere, in the most chic area of ​​the Chelsea neighborhood. It is a hotel where you can experience the classic English taste

reviews.text: Old, stuffy and tiny tiny beds.
Great service from start to finish and brilliant food
Beautiful hotel, very well located and the service is very good!
E4

Sehr schönes, sehr gemütliches Boutique-Hotel, sehr freundliches Personal, zentrale Lage mitten in Chelsea, sehr gute Anbindung an ÖPNV(u.a. U-Bahnstation Sloane Square), breites Einzelhandels- und Gastronomieangebot in unmittelbarer Nähe (inkl. Lebensmittelladen und Bäckerei um die Ecke). Wir hatten ein großes bequemes Zimmer, mit Detailliebe im englischen Stil eingerichtet. Sauberkeit auch top. Nach unserer Einschätzung auch ein einwandfreies Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis (für Londoner Verhältnisse)
reviews.textTranslated: Very nice, very cozy boutique hotel, very friendly staff, central location in Chelsea, very good public transport connections (including Sloane Square underground station), wide range of retail and restaurants in the immediate vicinity (including grocery store and bakery around the corner ). We had a large, comfortable room, furnished in English style with great attention to detail. Cleanliness also great. Also, in our opinion, excellent value for money (by London standards)

reviews.text: I liked this hotel especially my room!
Wonderful room and excellent service.
Quintessentially  english. Charming hotel lovely helpful staff. Loved my room. The bed was so comfy, had the best nights sleep. Will certainly  stay here again.

Lovely small old fashioned hotel, full of authenticity and soul. Excellent service and attentive staff. Comfortable bed and beautifully renovated bathroom. Super location in quiet street near Sloane Square. What a pleasure reading the paper by the chimeny looking at the garden... I did not want to leave!
Excellent hotel . Like being at home

What a wonderful hotel! Every detail here is precious and I could not be more pleased with starting my honeymoon here. The staff are helpful, kind, and patient (my wife and I were not the most put together after our ten hour flight), and the little touches they've given are truly special. Not to mention that the public rooms are cozy, and food is nice, and who can complain about a free glass of champagne every evening? The tea and cocoa are sweet freebies, too. What a gem of a find!
Had a great time lovely home from home place

Very British... Das beschreibt das Draycott aus meiner Sicht am besten. Ich habe einen sehr freundlichen und kompetenten Service erlebt. Mein Zimmer war sehr besonders, siehe Bild. Badezimmer sauber und ohne Beanstandung. Einen Stern Abzug gibt's für den Teppichboden im Zimmer und für die anhaltende Geräuschkulisse verursacht von Klimaanlagen unterhalb des Fensters.
reviews.textTranslated: Very British... That describes the Draycott best from my point of view. I experienced very friendly and competent service. My room was very special, see picture. Bathroom clean and without complaint. There's a star deduction for the carpet in the room and for the persistent background noise caused by the air conditioners below the window.

reviews.text: We are having our last night at the Draycott tonight and what a wonderfull surprise. Perfect location outside of the traffic yet close enough to everything that matters in London. Comfortable rooms and very friendly and helpfull staff with great little restaurants scattered around the hotel. The Village Ridge Boutique Hotel in Pretoria, South Africa is a similar niche luxury stay. With such nice offerings, the branded chains are sure to lose some regular business!
Top class. One of the best Hotels in London
Amazing service and beautiful rooms
Had a nice stay here. Staff very receptive and rooms very clean however bed  was a tad small and the room fridge didnt work
Nice hotel.
Very nice stay in a cosy, homely environment. Excellent staff and good service. Would stay again.
We had an excellent stay and would definitely stay again.

We loved the quaintness and the amazing staff at the Draycott.  We live in Surrey and have lived in London before and know the town very well.  We decided to stay in Chelsea as we are looking to move back town in Chelsea and thought a new experience at a boutique hotel would be a nice change from larger hotels like the Mandarin etc...  We had an issue the first night because the heat was not working in our room when I checked in during the afternoon.  Unfortunately the technician was gone for the day. The only complaint is that everyone somewhat avoided my request to change rooms and never addressed that query.  A couple of different people came up to tell me it was in fact cold in the room and did not seem to be working  However, they did come up with space heaters to our suite.   The following day our heat was fixed and the room was warm. The staff are VERY friendly and welcoming. They try to make the hotel fell like a home which it very much did. There are definitely renovations happening and I can see where they are needed.  One thing I will note is this........  they have an area where all of these travel guides and cards are displayed.  I would advise to not have these displayed as they do make things seem a bit on the tacky side.  Having these discretely put in the back office and available for tourists looking to explore is far more appealing.  We shall definitely try staying here again as we house hunt.
Hôtel de charme très agréable avec une ambiance très chaleureuse et un personnel aux petits soins.
reviews.textTranslated: Very pleasant charming hotel with a very warm atmosphere and attentive staff.

reviews.text: Excellent
Maybe the best Hotel in London. Incredible friendly Staff and a cosy atmosphere. A real Home, away from Home.
We go here every year and it's magical each time. More staircases than Hogwarts but it's just wonderful at Christmas. Highly attentive staff and lovely decor and rooms.
Nice place
Outstanding stay. Very quaint. Very British.

The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that the staff were very friendly. I was allocated what I considered to be a child's bedroom at the top of the building. It had a small single bed complete with a teddy bear! For £200 a night it represented poor value in my opinion.
Great service
Absolutely amazing, nothing short of countryside bliss in the inner city
old school charm and luxury. nothing is too much in terms of service

Great hotel! Great location near Sloane Square (right by it, a blocks walk) where you have the subway station, many bus options and some great stores.
Staff was perfect and so acomodating!
My room was very good and clean. I loved te decoration and thought into every little detail.
Do not miss in the PM: tea at four, champagne at six and hot chocolate at nine :)
Traditional hotel with amazing rooms and service. I would recommend to colleagues, family and friends.
Very comfortable old style hotel..lovely staff.
價格昂貴，而且沒有折扣。打七折會合理很多，不過還是很貴。
reviews.textTranslated: Expensive and no discounts. A 30% discount would be much more reasonable, but it's still expensive.

reviews.text: Good, nothing special
Classic feel, wooden fire 🔥 on a cold ❄ night...  Loved it
Best hotel in London. Friendly staff, ready to please but not obtrusive. Many details done right.
Quaint & cosy with a great location
一家坐落于安静社区的令人惊叹的精品酒店。每一间房间都独一无二并且很舒适。每间房都有一张写字台，酒店必备的物品，一本供客人留言的留言薄，以及一个美国电源插座（120伏）。无线网速度很快。毛巾、洗漱用品还有其他一些东西都很好很舒适。
reviews.textTranslated: A stunning boutique hotel in a quiet neighbourhood. Each room is unique and comfortable. Each room has a writing desk, the essentials of a hotel, a guestbook for guests to leave messages, and a US electrical outlet (120 volts). Wifi is fast. The towels, toiletries and other things were nice and comfortable.

reviews.text: Traditional and comfortable hotel.  Interior are decorated with a lot of antiques.  There is nice restaurant and you can eat snack or drink in the library or the garden.

similarHotelsNearby.name: Georgian House Hotel
similarHotelsNearby.description: Bright rooms & apartments in a townhouse

similarHotelsNearby.name: Best Western Buckingham Palace Rd.
similarHotelsNearby.description: Simple rooms in a Georgian townhouse

similarHotelsNearby.name: OYO Townhouse New England, London Victoria

reviews.text: The service here is superb and everyone goes out of their way to make sure you're comfortable. The rooms are big for London standards. They have tea and coffee and nibbles at the reception for guests. It's close to Victoria Station which makes it very accessible. I needed a kettle in the room and it was delivered even though they have coffee makers provided. I really enjoyed my stay at Eccleston.

Not usually one to post reviews, I am nevertheless compelled to acknowledge and express my heartfelt thanks to the front desk staff who were extremely helpful and kind throughout my stay.

Hats off to Luigi and Victor for heading an awesome staff! A big “thank you” as well to Akash, Diego, Sam, Camilla, and Adrijana, who expertly answered my questions and greeted me with a ready smile.

Finally, the hard-working housekeeping staff who were so very accommodating and understanding also deserve a mention. Coming back to a freshly-made bed and a tidy room was always comforting after a long day of sightseeing.

It was our first time traveling to London and this was the perfect place to stay! The hotel is very centrally located to just about everything. We walked to Westminster Abbey, Buckingham Palace, and the London Eye! There are also lots of yummy places to eat within walking distance. The rooms are very clean, just very small. It was a bit difficult for two people and all of our luggage to take up comfortable space. But the hotel is lovely and the staff is so friendly and helpful! Highly recommend this hotel if you are traveling to London.

The staff went out of their way to make us comfortable after a late check in.
Great location close to Buckingham Palace.

Great location, just a tiny walk from Victoria train station. The room was very nice and even had european sockets on the wall. The bed is probably the best I've ever slept in. Very nice and friendly staff, all in all a five star experience.

This hotel is an oasis providing a serene and peaceful respite for busy travelers but yet is conveniently located for visiting the main attractions. The room was clean and comfortable and the advanced technology of the electronics and lighting were a above and beyond any other place we stayed in our travels.

This was a perfect spot for our trip to London in August. From the rooms, to the staff, to the location, we had a great visit at the Eccleston Square Hotel. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to London!

This hotel ws potentially brilliant but Inhave not had a worse nights sleep onan hotel for a long time. There was no air conditioning, and the replacement units were as loud as a plane taking off in you room. the choice was be absolutely boiling or overwhelmed by noise. Mattress was  good, pillows ok, duvet alright, technology was confusing ( can we just have a light switch? ) but ultimately a hotel is judged on how you sleep.
Room was small but it had an adjustable bed.

We stayed at Eccleston Square Hotel in London for five nights and it was one of the most delightful experiences of our travels over many years. We departed on Tuesday, August 29 which was our 59th wedding anniversary and the hotel employees surprised us with a card and beautiful balloons on our bed. Everyone was so helpful and kind. They helped us get tickets for some of our sightseeing, gave great directions and great information. We would love to visit them again soon. London was awesome and Eccleston Hotel was the best place to stay. Thanks for a wonderful five days and nights. Mac and Judy Weaver
Very good location, amazing bed and very cool room. Overall very nice stay, feels very secure that the door is locked !
Overall very  nice
This place is fantastic   location clean 👌 just stunning we loved every moment

Great location right near Victoria Station. Very efficent checkin and checkout. The automated appliances and room technology was great.
The bathroom was not up to the hotel's price tag standards. The pillows and mattress weren't particulary comfortable. Our room was right next to the house-keeping closet and they made a lot of noise early every morning. It should be placed somewhere where it won't disturb the guests' rest.
A beautiful hotel, good service and a comfortable bed.

I loved this hotel. It's ideal for the solo traveler because the rooms can be a bit cramped for more than one, but even so the staff and the atmosphere more than make up for that. The common areas are comfortable and inviting. The high tech stuff in the rooms is fun (huge television) with lots of places to charge your own tech gear.  But mostly it was the staff that made the place great. They were extraordinarily helpful and welcoming. Definitely in my plans for next year in London.

NOT A HOTEL FOR TRAVELLERS WHO MORE THAN 1 CABIN LUGGAGE.
The staff at the front desk asked us "Are you at the right address, even after I gave my passport", which I felt was like have you really booked here. Then he said the room is fully automated so please see the video before using it. I said sure. He again insisted, I had to retort I have home automation at my place back in India.
There is no Kettle in the room for you to make tea, if you are tea drinker. You have to ask for one and the person who brings it does not speak English.

The bathroom is too small and cramped, I hit myself in the head (should not be more than 5 feet, on the towel drying stand on the wall next to the door).  There is no place to keep your luggage (not even a luggage collapsible stool). The photographs are misleading.
It is 9 mins walk from Victoria station. Do not get mislead by kilometer distance mentioned, you cannot walk to those places from here - check the time it will take for example Westminster Abbey will take you 20 to 25 mins that is the shortest.
I booked because my agent recommended it. I have stayed in Radisson Blu Edwardians, Park Plaza's and all of them are way to better.
If you are someone who are enamored by Gizmos and have not seen them, go for it and waste your money here. Otherwise lot more good hotels at this price.

Clean sheets, clean floors and Nice exterior look (Row houses Victorian style architecture) are the only plus.

Booked this on a whim because it was reasonably priced but we absolutely landed on our feet. The location is perfect, you can walk to all the big touristy stuff but it's in a lovely quiet part of town. The room is awesome and the touch free techy angle is exciting. We even had put own little terrace for morning breakfast. We kept to ourselves so didn't try the food but the staff were lovely and friendly every time we interacted with them and the foyer always smelt spectacular

I love this hotel so much.  This is our second stay here and it's seriously the best. The first stay was 7 days and it was great. This stay was 14 days and it was just a fantastic.  The price is fabulous.  The hotel is beautiful.  The rooms are so wonderful to come back to after a busy day out.  Everything is so clean and lovely.  They have air-conditioning, enormous beds that adjust and vibrate. The bathrooms are wonderful. The staff is so friendly and helpful.  It's so close to Victoria Station. You really couldn't ask for more.  They also have a late check out time which is rare and much appreciated.
The room is so wonderful.  I could live here forever.  The amenities are wonderful.  Little bits in the morning with coffee downstairs. Coffee in the room.  Love love love.  We love London and we will definitely be back.  When we do we will be staying here.  It's our home in London.

I stayed here during the coronation weekend. It was my first time staying at this hotel and i highly recommend it to anyone looking to stay nearby. I loved the vibe of this boutique hotel. I was delighted to be given excellent customer care by Catia.Thank you for taking care of me. I will visit again soon.
San Pawar
Beautiful hotel with friendly and helpful staff. I hope to visit again soon!

Everything about the hotel is great.

Staff were very welcoming and accommodating

Will definitely be back next time we’re in London

Nice clean hotel with friendly staff and fancy automated rooms, but the perfume scent running throughout the hotel is WAY TOO MUCH.

If you’re allergic to, or just don’t like, those plug-in scent things then this hotel is not for you. It’s everywhere. Like someone got 10 new plugins and got carried away.

Unfortunately I can’t tell you anything more as I spent as little time in the hotel as possible and preferred the ‘fresh’ London air outside instead.
Great staff, excellent rooms with the most comfortable beds and fantastic shower. The breakfast was also awesome.

I stayed for 2 nights at the Eccleston Square Hotel. The Hotel is very good located in a quiet Settlement. The Hotel is very beautiful and everything was clean. The room i stayed in was a cozy little one, perfect for 2 people. The room interior is great. The Staff was very friendly and i felt very welcome all the time. The breakfast is good and you get all important stuff you need.
The check out was very quick and you even can do it online. I’m looking forward to my next trip to London at the Eccleston Square Hotel

Very nice hotel in a quiet location not that far from public transport. Room was very comfortable but a tad small bit expensive for one night but I think the price is due to the name of the hotel and the location. Staff are very friendly and welcoming. Only warning is when you pay for a room there is £100 extra fee that they hold encase you accidently damage the room or want breakfast.

Really like this conveniently located hotel close to Victoria. From the outside it looks yet another neighborhood house, which gives it the feeling to going to a friends’ place. The staff is very friendly and professional and the rooms are very modern et well equipped. While they are of decent size, they are not very spacious but the reason I like it so much is that they are well thought about, modern and very well equipped.

the staff are absolutely amazing, really go above and beyond to make your stay comfortable. so many great features and little touches which elevate the experience. they can’t do enough to help you. the rooms are lovely , location is perfect and we will absolutely be back. thank you so much for having us.

I am usually not one to leave reviews for hotels, but I just had to for Eccleston because it was literally one of the best hotel stays I've ever had in my entire life. My friend and I stayed for 3 nights and we mourned when we had to leave, no joke. The staff were so kind and accomodating. The room itself was a great size for two people. The shower was really great. But the best part of the room was the bed. It's the most comfortable bed I've ever had at a hotel and the massage feature and elevation features were phenomenal after having walked all around London. I wish I could've taken the bed with me to our next hotel. The location was also super convenient because it was close to Victoria Coach Station and Victoria Station. We didn't have to take a single taxi. All in all, I cannot recommend enough; I would not stay at any other hotel in the price range, Eccleston is it.
Tiny rooms and horrible management. Do not recommend.
On a quiet street but near great transportation options this modern hotel made me feel great about my choice. Close to great food and friendly staff I would definitely stay here again.

Hotel en edificio tradicional pero con habitaciones muy modernas, con domotica y detalles como zapatillas, albornoz, amenities de L’Occitane y hasta tele incorporada en el espejo del baño. Te sorprenderá la opción de la cama con masaje. Lo unico es que el tamaño de la habitación es reducido
reviews.textTranslated: Hotel in a traditional building but with very modern rooms, with home automation and details such as slippers, bathrobe, L'Occitane amenities and even a TV built into the bathroom mirror. You will be surprised by the option of the massage bed. The only thing is that the size of the room is small.

reviews.text: I had a wonderful experience at this stylish hotel. Such a close walk to Victoria station made  my travel by train and my flight so easy. There is a beautiful private Eccleston square park just across the street so it was a perfect place to decompress from a busy trip. Belgravia and Sloan square are a quick walk so I found it easy to spend the day just walking the neighborhoods. My room was gorgeous, with many thoughtful design features and a lot of amenities - morning coffee, a beautiful bar, room service not to mention a massage bed, and smart TV with screen mirroring. The bathroom especially was stunning. Check in and check out were so easy, an the staff could not have been more friendly  and ensured I had everything I needed. So glad I found this gem and will definitely be back!
Great hotel and friendly team, highly recommend the Eccleston Square Hotel!

The hotel is very modern with a lot of tecnolgies in the room.
But the room are small, not well cleanded.
Breakfast is standard. The staff is nice but not very helpfull we ask to help us for orderdering food they  was helpless.
The location is perfect.

It was a great experience, Ali and the other staff at the front desk were very friendly. The problem was solved very quickly. The stay experience is very pleasant. The environment is very clean and warm.
Fantastic hotel, great location, very clean and comfortable. Couldn’t have been better.

This hotel needs to look after it’s returning customers like most hotels do hospitality industry with bad service wanted to stay almost a month again but was refused to be seen by management to discuss price my money is now else where

Rooms were great, but with limited space, and though they tried to make it high-tech, it ended up being more complicated to control the amenities than a traditional old-school setup. I would not recommend staying here in the middle of summer as they allow you no control over your room's AC unit. Luckily, we stayed in the wintertime. Overall, we had a great experience as the staff are very welcoming and kind. They provide electric adapters and offer free tea.  The location in regards to seeing London is fantastic and close to Buckingham Palace and a few doors down from where Sir Winston Churchill had lived.
Sehr empfehlenswert. Jederzeit gerne wieder.
reviews.textTranslated: Highly recommended. Again any time.

reviews.text: We had a great stay at this lovely hotel, perfect location and very comfortable room! We will definitely be back next year! The staff are so friendly and accommodating, thank you Ali for your amazing hospitality!
It was a great stay in this hotel. The location is perfect to visit London. The staff are really kind and nice. The room is  pleasant.

Really lovely hotel, extremely comfy bed and cute bathroom - only issue was the credit card hold fee, it wasn’t mentioned anywhere when booking and the only hotel I’ve ever stayed at that holds £100 a night
Idéalement situé, personnel très agréable, chambre et sdb un peu petites. Éviter de prendre le petit déjeuner sur place, pas terrible.
reviews.textTranslated: Ideally located, very pleasant staff, room and bathroom a little small. Avoid having breakfast there, not great.

reviews.text: Great location close to major transportation hub and decent restaurants. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Major negatives centre on the tiny rooms and high price. Typical London Hotel where the actual room is substandard and over priced but you pay because of its location. I will search for another alternative when I visit London again.

I had a reservation for 2 nights. The first day, the hot water in the shower didn't work. I alerted the staff who went and fixed it quickly. Next morning, I was surprised when the hot water still didn't work. I called the reception and they sent someone to check on it, this person could only confirm that it wasn't working and left giving me no solution. I had to take a frozen shower for the second day in a row.
Later during my check out I got to speak with the manager and I asked for a refund. The answer was positive but I still have neither news from the hotel nor answer to my emails.
I would certainly NOT recommend this hotel, the attention received does not correspond to the price paid.

This is a most stylish property, with very friendly staff and beautiful rooms. The designers have shown great taste and the property offers a wonderful atmosphere as a result.

While rooms were perfectly appointed, they did not offer a good opportunity to get work done, which sadly is important to me.

Still, if you don't mind the cost, the hotel will offer a great location, wonderful environment and fantastic staff to make for an amazing vacation!
No complaints at all. Easy to check in & out, good room and a great location with good restaurants close by. Eccleston Sq has a wonderful garden, even in November !

After realizing that our night was booked a year out, the hotel did have a room available, unfortunatley is was more than double in price :( We had to take it as we had been travelling all day and not knowing where else to go.  Once we got to the room it was beautiful and very comfortable!  I would highly recommend this hotel, I just would recommend you book it in advance to get a much better rate!

Proche de Victoria Station, idéalement situé pour visiter Londres et ses environs, l'hôtel est chic et high-tech avec un personnel très agréable et professionnel. Les chambres sont assez petites mais très fonctionnelles, aménagées avec goût et une vue sur un charmant square verdoyant. Nous reviendrons.
reviews.textTranslated: Close to Victoria Station, ideally located for visiting London and its surroundings, the hotel is chic and high-tech with a very pleasant and professional staff. The rooms are quite small but very functional, furnished with taste and a view of a charming green square. We will come back.

reviews.text: Eccleston Square Hotel was amazing.  The staff was friendly and fulfilled all of our requests. The hotel was spotless. The hotel is very high tech, lots of bells and whistles.  Also, the hotel was in a great location, plenty of restaurants and stores in the area.

Very modern, very comfy beds but rooms a bit small. Smart windows (that tint automatically) & smart curtains made it a fun stay.

Breakfast is probably better at a pub nearby.

Very friendly and helpful staff.
the room was quite small, and with an unpleasant smell. the location and the neighborhood were very good and your desk service was very kind and always ready to help

Pulito, tutto domotico, rete regolabile e più cuscini.
Di contro non ha abbastanza spazio, non danno qualche campione di crema, l'asciugacapelli e le ciabatte da camera sono da cercare tra i cassetti, la doccia/bagno sono piccoli. Per asciugarsi i capelli devi uscire dal bagno poiché non ci sono prese.
reviews.textTranslated:
Clean, all home automation, adjustable bed base and more cushions.
On the downside it doesn't have enough space, they don't give some cream samples, the hairdryer and bedroom slippers have to be looked for in the drawers, the shower/bathroom is small. To dry your hair you have to leave the bathroom as there are no outlets.

reviews.text:
A wonderful location. Small but perfectly equipped rooms.
Friendly staff. Powerful showers & stylish decor.
Superbly efficient but quiet air conditioning.
Extremely comfortable bed... but would have liked a feather pillow.

Voor een zeer hoge prijs werden wij gestald in de kelder; geen plaats om een koffer te plaatsen, geen ruimte om in de kamer te bewegen zonder de medebewoner lastig te vallen. Geen zicht op buiten of mogelijkheid tot frisse lucht, omdat de sigarettenrook van de buren onmiddellijk de kamer in stroomde. Kamer werd niet dan na uitdrukkelijk verzoek opgeruimd. geen schone glazen.
reviews.textTranslated: We were stored in the basement for a very high price; no place to put a suitcase, no space to move around the room without bothering the roommate. No view of the outside or possibility of fresh air, because the cigarette smoke from the neighbors immediately flowed into the room. The room was not cleaned until after an explicit request. no clean glasses.

reviews.text: Excellent!!

Such a lovely stay - hotel is so beautiful and I loved the hi-tech features in the room. We had a gorgeous view from our balcony which was a cute spot for breakfast. Lovely staff, and cleanliness was perfect.
Sachin was amazing

Tolle und perfekte Lage.
Microzimmer die nichts für Menschen mit etwas Körperfülle sind. Das Bad ist so klein,  daß der Zugang zur Dusche für füllige fast ausgeschlossen ist. Selbst in der Dusche geht es eng zu. Wer in der Dusche ist und das Wasser aufdreht,  bekommt erstmal den kalten Vorlauf ab.... man kann halt nicht ausweichen.  Einseifen erinnert dann auch eher an die Vorführung eines Schlangenmenschen.
Die hochgelobten Betten sind einfach nur Betten.  Bequem..... Ja..... aber auch etwas zu schmal für 2 Erwachsene.  Mehr Bett ginge aber auch schlecht,  denn der Platz um das Bett herum ist so gering,  dass dort ein normaler Koffer jeglichen Durchgang blockiert...... ja Koffer..... wohin damit? Es ist kein Platz dafür.  Die wenigen Schränke sind mit Safe, Kühlschrank, Bügelbrett etc. voll. 2 Schubladen und fertig..... mehr hat man nicht.
Die Klimaanlage funktioniert dafür tadellos,  es gibt keine Schwankungen beim Wasser wenn man duscht...... Die Zimmer sind eigentlich sehr ruhig.......
Kann man buchen.... wer aber mehr Platz braucht,  sollte sich weiter umschauen
reviews.textTranslated:
Great and perfect location.
Micro rooms that are not for people with a bit of body. The bathroom is so small that access to the shower is almost impossible for overweight people. Even the shower is cramped. If you're in the shower and turn on the water, you'll first get the cold flow... you just can't avoid it. Soaping is more reminiscent of a contortionist's performance.
The highly praised beds are just beds. Comfortable... Yes... but also a bit too narrow for 2 adults. But more bed would also be bad, because the space around the bed is so small that a normal suitcase would block any passage...... yes, suitcase... where to put it? There is no room for it. The few cupboards are full of safes, refrigerators, ironing boards, etc. 2 drawers and you're done... you don't have anything more.
The air conditioning works perfectly, there are no fluctuations in the water when you shower... The rooms are actually very quiet...
You can book... but if you need more space, you should look around further

reviews.text: Beautiful hotel lovely and clean, staff where very friendly and helpful would definitely stay again

Very nice boutique hotel in a great area close to activities, restaurants and public transportation.  The hotel has been updated with very nice amenities throughout and the staff is friendly, courteous and are very helpful to assist with your accommodations. Be sure to ask the front desk to visit the private park across the street. Beautiful area for walking, having a picnic and has a grass tennis court. Wish I had brought my racquet!  Would definitely recommend.

similarHotelsNearby.name: Holiday Inn London - Oxford Circus, an IHG hotel
Radisson Blu Edwardian Bond Street Hotel, London
Radisson Blu Edwardian Sussex Hotel, London

reviews.text: Ich bin beruflich sehr häufig in London und besuche praktisch ständig ein anderes Hotel. Nach meinem Aufenthalt in Marylebone allerdings werde ich garantiert wieder kommen. Der Standort ist excellent, das komplette Gebäude ist in einem hervorragendem Zustand, gerade in dieser Hinsicht enttäuschen viele andere Hotels in London. Beim professionellen Check-In bereits wurden meine Vorteile durch meine discovery-Mitgliedschaft sofort umgesetzt. Die hauseigene Bar, die angeschlossene bekannte Brasserie und das für Hotelgäste zugängliche angeschlossene professionelle Fitnessstudio "the third place" haben meinen überaus positiven Gesamteindruck nur noch weiter bestätigt. Kurzfristige Reservierungswünsche in externen Restaurants wurden trotz schwieriger Verfügbarkeit umgesetzt und nachträgliche Änderungen meiner Hotelbuchungen wurden vor Ort kulant behandelt. Dieses Hotel verdient meine absolute Empfehlung und ich freue mich bereits heute auf meinen nächsten Aufenthalt.
reviews.textTranslated: I spend a lot of time in London for work and am almost constantly visiting a different hotel. After my stay in Marylebone, however, I will definitely come back. The location is excellent, the entire building is in excellent condition, especially in this regard many other hotels in London disappoint. During the professional check-in, my benefits from my discovery membership were immediately implemented. The in-house bar, the well-known brasserie connected to it and the professional fitness studio "the third place", which is accessible to hotel guests, only further confirmed my extremely positive overall impression. Short-term reservation requests in external restaurants were implemented despite difficult availability and subsequent changes to my hotel bookings were dealt with on site in an accommodating manner. This hotel deserves my absolute recommendation and I am already looking forward to my next stay.

reviews.text:
The venue sourcing team at Flavour Venues and Events find that first-hand experience is the best way to recommend the right venues to our clients. Our September 2023 London research visit brought us to The Marylebone. This handsome property near Bond Street, Mayfair and Soho offered luxurious tranquillity in a popular part of town. With excellent travel connections and a wealth of nearby shopping, dining and entertainment, The Marylebone is perfectly positioned for leisure guests, plus business stays and corporate events.
The Marylebone houses a premium collection of 252 bedrooms and suites set across 7 floors. Ours featured a gigantic and extremely comfortable bed, in a room which was well insulated from any outside street noise. Such features as a workspace, safe, smart TV and minibar are a welcome touch for business travellers like us. Luxury toiletries, robes, slippers, and premium technology made our stay even more special. The room was spacious and lavishly decorated to a timeless fashion, ensuring a great sleep and a relaxing stay.
We were given a comprehensive tour of the communal areas and event spaces by Stephanie, MICE Sales Manager for The Doyle Collection (to which The Marylebone belongs). We were totally smitten by the décor of the Cocktail Bar, which is inspired by the four seasons of the year. The space fills with natural light during the summer months and offers fireside warmth in winter. The hotel offers an impressive range of meeting rooms and versatile event spaces. A highlight for us was Number Six. This stunning, multi-purpose space has a private ground floor entrance, with its own cloakroom and reception area. The space is bathed in daylight, with mirrored surfaces reflecting the rich colours of the furniture and wooden floor around the room. There’s capacity for up to 250 standing guests, with moveable walls and even a lavish concealed bar which transform the space for a multitude of uses. Other impressive spaces include The Courtyard, an internal terrace featuring a retractable roof and striking fireplace for year-round events, such as private dinners under the light of the stars. The Blue Room, as the name suggests, is vibrantly decorated, and offers configurations to suit events from 8 to 80 guests. Every space we viewed had been furnished and finished with loving attention to detail.
Our stay included breakfast, which gave us the opportunity to sample one of the best full Irish breakfasts I’ve enjoyed. The food was of excellent quality, and service was warm, friendly, and attentive, giving us confidence that event guests would be well looked after too. The delicious calories offered at the table were well spent at the onsite Third Space luxury health-club and gym. Featuring cutting edge equipment, great spa facilities and an energetic vibe, I can honestly say they were the most impressive hotel fitness facilities I’ve used.
With their collection of top tier event spaces, luxuriously comfortable bedrooms, plus the five-star hospitality we enjoyed, we’re delighted to recommend The Marylebone to our clients. To plan your corporate events at this excellent hotel, contact the team at Flavour Venues & Events.
Good hotel and staff very helpful.
One of the best steaks I have ever had in my life! Great ambiance too.

Our home whilst we were in London was The Marylebone Hotel. Amazing location. The Loft suite is huge and very luxe. Attention to detail is very apparent in all the little touches, including linen and bathroom amenities. Indoor swimming pool, gym, bar and restaurant all top notch.  We will be back!

Nice boutique hotel for a company event. Event organisers invited too many people though and so service suffered accordingly, and event came across as a little disorganised. But when we did eventually get some finger food and small bowls, it was generally very good. One disappointing pice of charred beef on a stick, needed a sauce, and I had to return the meat 'semi masticated' as it was surprisingly pure gristle- not up to the hotels usual standards at all, and embarrassing to attempt to eat it amongst work colleagues. 😕. Nobody's perfect though and I love the ambience in the hotel,  and I would always recommend them.
פעמיים ביום מסדרים את החדר , מיקום נהדר ,אוכל טעים ומפנק אבל מלון לא זול .
reviews.textTranslated: The room is cleaned twice a day, great location, delicious and indulgent food, but the hotel is not cheap.

reviews.text: I stayed here from 14-19 July and I have been sending them emails regarding the refund of my security deposit but no response!!!

Lovely boutique hotel in a great location. I was pleased with almost everything about it—including the continental breakfast (and waitstaff) at the hotel restaurant.

Best thing: the shower pressure is divine! I say this as a person who is 5’2” with thick hair. It’s so rare I get to enthuse over the water pressure in a hotel.

Worst thing: the bathroom layout. Getting out requires somewhat dangerous contortions (stubbed toes on dry feet, potential slippage on wet ones). Whoever designed these bathrooms should try using one.

My wife and I stayed at The Marylebone last week for five nights.

We were in town for a business conference and a little sightseeing afterwards. We booked the hotel through American Express Fine Hotels & Resorts collection and found it to be fairly central to everything we needed to do.

Unfortunately, upon arriving in England, my baggage was lost and I was actually told by British Airways that it was stolen. I had a business conference for two days immediately following our arrival, and we were in a panic to begin replacing my suits and other items.

Once we arrived at the hotel, we went to our assigned hotel room. Frankly, we were not enthralled with the first room we were presented with because it had an odd shape, and we had booked a larger studio suite. The staff accommodated us by showing us other available rooms we could possibly move to, but we needed to go shopping to replace my items.

Adrian, the concierge, had been discussing with my wife where to go to get suits and a tailor. Adrian went so far as to locate a tailor that he knew and had them on standby for me, so no matter what, I could have my suits tailored immediately.

To make a long story short, we ended up purchasing the suits at the store he recommended and had them tailored immediately so that everything went smoothly with my conference. When we returned to the hotel, the staff had located a room on the seventh floor to move us to. That room was far superior to the others and came at no additional cost.

That night, we sat at the hotel bar, spoke with the wonderful bartenders from Italy, and finally got to relax and start enjoying our trip.

From the front desk staff to Adrian at the concierge, the doorman, and the cleaning staff, our service experience was exceptional. I am very impressed with this hotel and will stay there again on my future trips to London. Thank you, everyone at The Marylebone!
Excellent service, great location.
