A stunning hotel in a quiet location in the big smoke. Rooms were clean and tidy. Only suggestion I could make is that they need new doors on the rooms as you can hear quite a bit if you have noisy neighbours down your corridor. Didn't quite help that there were people shouting at 3 am and then 6am.
My first choice to stay when visiting London again. Many thanks to Mr. Nasimul Haque for his support during my stay.

Great room size for middle of London. Service by staff was amazing and they truly did try and make our stay as good as possible. Bathroom was slightly small but possibly similar to other hotels in the city. The products they used in the bathroom were luxurious. Breakfast was included in the room and it was a good quality breakfast where they had a continental buffet but we could still order the main which was freshly cooked.
Nice staff

I had a great time staying at the hotel, the best thing about it is that the it’s close to most shopping stores and restaurants, yet in a quiet neighborhood.

I had an excellent experience, as by the time I checked out leaving to airport, Adrian helped me measure the weight of my luggage in the hotel before heading to airport, as that helped me not go through the struggle at the check in desk!

We had to move stuff from one bag to the other up to 3 times to insure we don’t exceed the limit.

Staff are super friendly and helpful. Didn’t have enough time to try the restaurants and other facilities.

But Adrian was always nice, and although I’m always in a rush. I can still remember his face, he never hesitate to say hi and have a quick chat.

I would definitely love to stay here again.

I've stayed here a few times, the staff at the entrance and throughout the hotel are really good. Some rooms have been a little small but the suites are really nice. Attached to a good bar and restaurant and a nice pool.

Personal story, I left my phone charger here one Christmas, when I returned some months later they had kept it for me.

Terrible service. I have told the service counter that if it will be alright if I leave my bags in my room later than 12pm. They agreed but conveniently forgot and locked the room. They also tried charging me for the mini bar, which I did not use.
Sehr schöne Umgebung
reviews.textTranslated: Very nice environment

reviews.text: Terrible experience. Not only I was given a tiny room by the service elevator, where the hotel staff are extremely noisy talking to each other since early in the morning and doing nosies charging the elevator with their trolleys. But I left some important gifts for my customers staying at the same hotel to the concierge, so that they could deliver this to their room… they never did, the customers never received my gifts and no one informed me. I got to learn from my customer…. After 10 days they gave me a solution, however they sent by courier part of the gift, and they kept the other half. PATHETIC!

Great surrounding area and very nice lobby/common areas of hotel. Bar and staff were rude and it was a total dud and exercise in frustration. Brasserie was also a dud and rude staff.

Rooms (we had 3)  were very average and not on par with a 5 star hotel, other Doyle properties or the very elegant common areas- especially the showers. We actually changed rooms b/c the first one was extremely worn and outdated. Second room was nicer, but shower and bathroom were Lilliputian. Shower literally sprayed several streams of water on the sink when on.

Gym access, and gym set up, was amazing.

Overall, pretty average to above average. Rooms a 3. Lobby and location 5. Gym 5. Service a 3. Restaurants/bar- 0. Really not a 5 five star hotel and so look elsewhere if that’s what you are expecting.
فندق جميل ونظيف وطاقم لطيف ومهذب وقريب من شارع اكسفورد والهايدبارك
reviews.textTranslated: Nice and clean hotel, nice and polite staff, close to Oxford Street and Hyde Park

reviews.text: Veryy chick Hotel, recomended

What a great hotel with world class service. Nice touch when the waiter addressed us by names.

The gym and pool are one of the best ive been to, very modern and fancy.
Nice hotel in London

We stayed for four nights and came to really appreciate the excellent service and location of this hotel. Our room (a studio "suite") was very good but lacked storage and the furniture was oddly configured. The Chromecast was a plus. The hotel has an outstanding bar and health club on site. The restaurant was also very good. We would gladly return.

Very very highly recommend!

The service was impeccable with all staff pleasantly going the extra mile. Our concierge Alba set us up with two incredible dinners same day for a party of 10 (one w a Michelin chef at one of the hottest new restaurants in the city)

The bars are just phenomenal- classy, hip, fun with true professional bartenders with flair and a knowledge of mixology.

The gym is very nice and high end with all equipment, lots of space for plyo, a lot of personal training going on. My family hit it every day as well as pool and steam room.

Location steps from so many cool restaurants bars cafes and 5 mins to the tube.

Beds are very comfy, room not the largest but big enough and with such great amenities no need to stay in the room!
Always chic and nice vibes and clean
Accompanied by my son's,spent few days at this very British institution.
Tolles Zimmer und vorallem guter Service! Gerne schaue ich privat auch mal vorbei.
reviews.textTranslated: Great room and above all good service! I would be happy to take a look privately.

reviews.text:
Me and my partner were attending a private special conference event held by my company at The Marylebone hotel recently.

Arrival:
I pulled up outside in my own personal vehicle, a 13 year old Mondeo but to my pleasant surprise the door staff still treated me like a VIP and carried my bags in for me. Compared to all the other cars in the area I wouldn’t have blamed them for ignoring me or mistaking me for a delivery driver! It was a very pleasant experience and the staff were extremely friendly. They held my bags for me until check in.

Parking:
Unfortunately no parking on site (which is understandable for central London) however they have a discount for a parking garage down the road. This is good, however upon checking the online reviews of the parking garage there is evidence of a lot of car damage (break ins, thefts). I ended up parking my car in Westfield shopping centre for the night as I had been recommended it was very secure and only a 15/20 min tube away from the hotel and also very well priced at £15 a day.

Our bags were brought to our room

At the night of the special event the staff were very friendly and lively, doing a great job making sure drinks were topped up in the private function. At dinner, me and my partners dietary requests were met perfectly, my partner had the best gluten free bread she’s ever had. She is desperate to know the brand! Dinner was done to a great standard and was very lovely.

Checking out was very easy and they held our bags for the day until we were ready to come back and collect. All a very easy process and the staff once again very helpful.

Overall I had an amazing stay and it was extremely luxury and a true experience for me which I won’t forget. Definitely recommend
The room was very spacious, the bathroom was very luxury. I loved that the large television had built in chrome cast which was a great touch, I had tried to cast to TV’s in hotels before with no luck at all so I was ecstatic to have this feature. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The room I had was with a lovely view out onto the street allowing a view of Londoners and especially the night life.

Greeted by a wonderful Irish ☘️ gentleman who helped me out of the cab and took me and my luggage to the front desk started my stay off with style. We chatted about my trip and about our Irish heritage. Upon checking in to my Classic queen room, I found it to be a little small for my preferences and called down to reception who were able to offer me a Deluxe king for a supplement each night. I was shown to room490. Stunning views on to the decorated views of Marylebone through a huge window. A newly renovated room - perfect. I enjoyed breakfast at the hotel, had afternoon drinks in the bar and had a lovely steak dinner in the restaurant. Throughout my whole stay I was treat impeccably. The lovely Stan was such a help and a wonderful lady on reception (whose name escapes me but holds a lovely warm smile). I chose this hotel because I had some surgery on Harley Street and needed to be close by, but J would choose it again in a heartbeat wherever I need to be in London. Such a treat. Thank you again, Emma
Excelente estada, porém, quarto muito pequeno.
reviews.textTranslated: Excellent stay, however, very small room.

reviews.text:
La salle de bain est très petite,vu le prix de la chambre
De plus, je me suis fait voler un super sweat pendant le petit déjeuner
reviews.textTranslated:
The bathroom is very small, considering the price of the room
Plus, I had a great sweatshirt stolen during breakfast

reviews.text: Great ambience! Love it

Comfortable rooms, beautiful decoration and atmosphere in the common areas, great location... but, above all, excepcional treatment by the team. Special thanks to Katerina (Reservations), Roxana (Reception) and David (Concierge) for having taken fantastic care of me before and during my stay.
One of my favourite hotels in town!
Fantastic hotel. Like a family run friendly place you've always think you've been to before. Rooms a bit small but staff, food, service are all exceptional

Very attentive Concierge, helpful Receptionist .
Great hotel for families
Busy area at the moment. Lots of roadworks in the area. Lovely helpful staff though.

Merci pour le séjour.
Personnel accueillant agréable
Chambre communicante spacieuse propre literie top

points négatifs : petit dej moyen manque de choix sur le buffet (pain de mie, noix , gâteaux, produits locaux…)
Les premières chambres que nous avons eu étaient mal isolées donc bruyantes car donnaient sur la climatisation de l’hôtel mais l’accueil a rapidement solutionné notre problème.
Chambres communicantes spacieuses mais salle de bain petite
reviews.textTranslated:
Thanks for the stay.
Pleasant welcoming staff
Spacious connecting room, clean, top bedding

negative points: average breakfast lack of choice on the buffet (sandwich bread, nuts, cakes, local products, etc.)
The first rooms we had were poorly insulated and therefore noisy because they overlooked the hotel's air conditioning, but reception quickly resolved our problem.
Spacious connecting rooms but small bathroom

reviews.text: Excellent Hotel in the centre of London. Outstanding staff. One of the best breakfasts we ever had. Will be our new "port" in the city.
Used as a corporate event venue. Excellent. We'll looked after. Great facilities. Good food. Recommended.
Beautiful decor
Over priced and underwhelming. Cocktails served with colomns of ice and minimal drink.
Too expensive and food not worth this time
Excellent hotel & super service
Great rooms and nice location. Room service is good.
Room are too good location was awasome
Great ambience and must visit
Awesome ambiance and delicious food.
Fabulous hotel . Each and every thing neat and tidy .best place to stay

Exceeds expectations. I have stayed in five star hotels around the world and can confidently say that they do deserve the five stars.
Our room was very spacious and bright with a lot of attention to detail.  The most important element in any hotel room is the bed . My mattress was superb as were the luxurious down filled pillows. Room service was outstanding, fast, friendly and very professional . ( it had, surprisingly, the best burger that I have ever eaten) .
The doormen , concierge and everyone we encountered bent over backwards to be of assistance . It was amazingly consistent throughout our stay .
The hotel is located close (one minute walk) to Marleybone high street ( try the outstanding fish restaurant) and the Wallace Collection .
There is a cab always outside the hotel door and will whisk you away to wherever you
wish .
So , we stayed for a week and shall definitely be returning.
Congratulations to the management for running it so seamlessly.

It was a fabulous Ambience I really enjoyed my stay with this greatest hotel in Delhi and it was very nearest to metro station and very beautiful place in aero city good stay ... staff was very good Especially Front office department very professional
Luxury felicities on valuable package good package
Lovely

Comfy rooms
Neat ambience
Nice food
Timely service
Loved it 😍✌️
Very good place

We had our conference here, good food and staff very tentative.
Love the feel on the locations we were located in the blue room 💙
Bedding is amazing😀

Habitación limpia y la gente del hotel amable. y ubicación bastante buena.
Pero las habitaciones extremadamente pequeñas, habitacion (31) al menos, baño demasiado pequeño y las escaleras para subir hasta la tercera planta, digamos que complicadas, a parte de la inexistencia de ascensor.
No nos dijeron que debiamos solicitar limpieza y nadie nos limpio la habitación la primera noche, algo curioso para ser un hotel.
No repetire hotel en mi vuelta a Londres.
reviews.textTranslated:
Clean room and friendly hotel people. and pretty good location.
But the rooms are extremely small, room (31) at least, bathroom too small and the stairs to go up to the third floor, let's say complicated, apart from the non-existence of an elevator.
They did not tell us that we should request cleaning and nobody cleaned our room the first night, something curious for a hotel.
I will not repeat the hotel on my return to London.

reviews.text: Not bad but can't figure out how this is a 5 star hotel. Rooms you can't swing a cat in, bathroom tiny and cramped, dated interior in the hallways, smelt like sewers on our floor. Doormen were great but the rest of staff average. Bar and brasserie were the best part - breakfast was great. More like a 3 🌟 all in all
Nice hotel, great location, friendly staff
We were there for office dinner....loved the ambiance n food.
الفندق جميل وقريب من selfridges وقريب من شارع Oxford Street
reviews.textTranslated: The hotel is lovely, close to Selfridges and close to Oxford Street

reviews.text: We had a conference room booked here for a course and we’re really well looked after. Lunch was delicious both days
Room was overlooking a mass of air con units.

Great location and clean room! I had a few minor problems though. The heating system wasn’t working in my room on the first day(I thought it would eventually work, but it didn’t) so I went to bed feeling pretty cold. I called the reception the next morning, and they told me that their mechanics were coming. I waited for roughly an hour, which delayed my schedule. I wish the reception had told me approximately how long I would wait. The mechanics guy was very polite and helpful. He asked for my permission to enter the room and assured me that I didn’t break anything. I guess they couldn’t fix the problem so gave me a heater. My room was a little claustrophobic, so I nearly tripped on this really hot heater several times.  Unfortunately, my amenities were not changed the next day, so again I called and asked for them. I waited for 20-30min, but didn’t receive them. When I came home I had a lovely amenity bag though. Just a lot of waiting for things to come, so maybe it’s better to ask how long you would wait.
I felt that this room was not architected well. There were no plugs for hairdryer in the bathroom, and the toilet paper holder was not in the best place to use, for example.  Quite inconvenient regarding these. Otherwise, pretty nice place :)
Wow, what a nice hotel- dropped in for some team, super great service.
Nice

The Grove should treat it's chefs better. Not allowing a chef to attend an urgent hospital appointment and then charging him with gross misconduct when he does is unacceptable. Refusing to pay that chef what was owed thus creating financial hardship compounds what is appalling treatment. The Grove should be ashamed of this treatment of a loyal, hard working, skilled chef.

Beautiful setting, fantastic rooms and great service.  The buffet breakfast was fantastic, and we loved the spa!
This was our first time travelling with a baby and the hotel did everything to make that easier - providing a cot, a baby bath, helping us carry the baby gym...
Quite pricey, but made for a very relaxing long weekend.
Only stayed 1 night but all was very very nice. Will visit again. Plenty to do
Amazing rooms, service and food! Definitely a repeat visit is required.
Lovely golf course and very friendly staff . Very good condition although the bunker sand be is very gritty.Expensive so should be reserved as a treat.

Really enjoyed our stay at the grove - brilliant spa, breakfast and the staff made it very relaxing with our five month old baby. The only let down was the meal at the bar before we left - I was charged £7 for a bowl of white rice. I don’t mind paying extra but it felt a bit greedy to charge so much for something so basic that I would have expected them to have included in a bento box. So left feeling pretty disappointed.

Pre covid this was a go too destination for a special occasion and business lunch.
In recent times some of the pricing is harder to justify.
Lovely location
Beautiful interior design
Good service
Delicious food
The Grove is always exceptionally good. Lovely place. Great staff.

Absolutely an amazing place to visit. The grounds are so well designed and maintained that it has a lasting impact that will draw you back and again. With the sun shining, the beautifuly manicured lawns and carefully planted shrubs, flowers and historic trees will keep your mind actively absorbing positive thoughts well and truly long after you leave!
Lovely atmosphere, superb service!
Attending a business event at the Grove.  Staff were very helpful, grounds and the buildings were all to a high standard.

Only went there to play golf. Can’t discuss rooms!
Had breakfast in stables. It was average and very expensive. Food is good but does not warrant such a high price! I get it they charge a premium.
The service at the club house is impeccable and everything is available in the pro shop. Staff have a satisfying can do attitude though slightly with an arrogance. Nothing is reasonably priced but everything is impeccable. In comparison with other superior golf clubs in the country and Scotland, you pay a premium for round without the views you may enjoy in other courses! Everything is manicured to the highest standard and catered for a great experience. Driving range has everything you need. Overall superb course ( less the views) and service (at a premium) and a great experience all round. My only let down was that they don’t have a hotel van service to bring people without cars to the near by train station! Almost impossible to get any Ubers unless you pay their incredible high arranged cab service !
For the course, I highly recommend a round.
One of the best hotel spas I’ve stayed in. Food was absolutely exquisite and the staff are all very friendly. Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend!
Beautiful location and top quality service.
Beautiful location
Just a golf day and a short one at that as the weather was very poor, but I enjoyed what I got to see of the course and facilities.
I'm sure it's all very wonderful but I was only there to fix an extract fan. It was a lovely fan though. Thanks to the maintenance team for making the job go smoothly .
What a lovely, tranquil and well designed place with huge green area around. I just booked another treatment.
Exquisite, serene and amazing customer service delivery!

I booked a stay to celebrate my husbands birthday.
The grounds and the hotel are impeccable, however upon check out I had forgotten my jewellery box in the room and for my surprise, these were never reported to lost and found by the housekeeping staff.
You wouldn’t expect to get robbed by a 5 star hotel and even though I was the one who forgot the jewellery behind, you’d expect that staff who works in hospitality in such well renowned hotel, would have it reported and not just put it in their pocket.
I’ve spoken to numerous members of staff, and although they said they did everything within their power to investigate, I never even received an apology on behalf of the hotel.
It’s obvious that whoever stole it, would never come forward and admit as they’d face potential police charges and losing their job.
The hotel should do more to guarantee that all staff working there is honest and guests can feel safe leaving their belongings in the room.
The jewellery I lost was expensive and had sentimental meaning for me and the hotel did nothing to try and compensate me which I think was really cheap and disrespectful.
Although the rest of our stay was great, this experience left me feel betrayed.
Would I recommend it - sure! Just make sure you keep all your belongings in a safe and do not leave anything behind as you’d never see it again!
P.S. the lady at breakfast was kind of rude too saying I haven’t filled my plate enough and I should go for more as it’s a free buffet!
It was said in a sarcastic way and I think she should have kept her opinion to herself!
Home away from Home! Excellent service delivery!
Best golf in the area in my opinion
Beautiful hotel, great Spa and Gym facilities. Golf course in superb condition.
I forgot how great the Grove is!! Grounds are beautiful staff on point…. Fresh Luxury feel…. ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️🩵
There for celebration tea, where catering was fairly average. Parking was horrible and there is a lack of privacy with guests / visitors peering into the celebration

Great grounds and restaurants. We came here with my wife (her birthday) and our 2 kids. Unfortunately the room we had was an adjoining room separated by a thin door….where essentially you could hear everything next door and the movie that was being watched. The fundamental basis of a hotel stay (of this price point where everything should be perfect) is the quality and privacy of the room- this was not met. In addition, they had essentially put 2 twin beds together rather than having a king which also ruined the experience. A real shame to what would have been a great weekend treat. Very disappointing. They should prioritise sorting this out urgently.

This is our second time at the grove and this was after a complimentary offer after my first stay in the deluxe sweet with a free dinner.

It was better this time so well done and I would give it a 3.4.

It's not so close from being great and far from being fantastic.

Something like Coworth Park which is a similar price i would still greatly recommend.

This is for couples however as I can see that the hotel does work as a higher class children club.

The Grove is mostly designed for events,  golfers or families with kids. It has nice parts and it has damaged parts. I attach a picture for the room.

The hotel gym is now renovated and pretty great, kudos. The Sequoia Spa is nice and would recommend even if some of the pictures inside are damaged.

Tye staff are still a complex bag here and I would say are mostly good. Still there is a tendency for being told "no." or  first "yes" then "No" and even "let me check that for you, sure yes." then finally back to "no."

This included asking for a towel at Ralph's beach club and being told "no, and your order will be £6"

Or asking for the ft in the morning and being told "yea of course." and never seeing it.

It's just not great hospitality. Obviously hospitality is hard because people expect great at all times but I would just hope that the staff are being paid well enough to feel they should. And for the prices to go to the hotel there is money for it.

However shoutout to pool attendant who we asked after who tracked two towels  down for us and brought them himself. You should be promoted but it would be at the cost of losing one of the only staff that went above and beyond.

We ate at Madhu’s at The Grove, was great. Food is tasty, some dishes really so and servers are attentive.

"Ralph's beach" is part of the property, promptly closes at 6 and is a pit of screaming children, still no table service and a better selection of food or drinks.

In the main garden at night the fire pit is done well and it's a beautiful grounds. The landscaping has been done great.

The breakfast was very average especially the chicken sausage is tasteless and a bit "mystery meat" for me.

Overall a a hotel it's probably a 4.5.
Overall experience is 3.4

But I think it's going in the right direction!

Captions to photos
1)Hallway ceiling water pot (this is now gone)
2) Views from room bay window
3) "balcony" from deluxe west wing sweet.
4) general room wear
Amazingly enough

Great outdoors, garden and scenery. VERY poor service everywhere, and staff appear quite clueless about anything (orders, directions, you name it). Additionally, it is essentially a massive kids club with no peace and quiet aside from the golf courses. Room looked worn out and not worth the price. The food was average as well as very expensive. My partner had also booked an activity, which the hotel forgot about, the instructor did not show up. In my opinion, it is not worth 5 stars and is ridiculously overpriced for what it’s worth. If you’re a family, it’s probably a great place, but not for couples or adults.

We booked the glasshouse restaurant for a birthday party. 5 adults and 2 children.

To be honest we were very disappointed, we had high expectations given the name.

The drinks were very slow, a member of our party was unable to walk up the steps to the Buffett so we had to take pictures of the food and make up a plate for them.

£80 a head for essentially a Buffett is very expensive, given the restaurant was nothing special.

We spent over a £1,000 including drinks for mediocre service and food.

We will certainly not be returning.
Had only Sunday brunch. Very large selection of food, with lots of meat, sushi, fish. See photos 😉

This is a tricky review... The Glasshouse Restaurant was packed and buzzing... Great atmosphere.  The venue is superb.  The service was very good with a couple of flaws.  The food was very good... In parts.  This was the buffet dinner with some live cooking stations.  It all just seemed a little forced.... I asked for still water to be brought 3 times... Request ignored.  The grill station was average, especially the herbed salmon and not refilled quickly enough.  The carvery section was average with good beef wellington and average slow roasted lamb.  The Asian section was excellent with great chicken tikka and the pad Thai was excellent too.  Desserts were excellent too.  The tricky bit is the price per head.  For the amount paid, I would expect a higher quality of food, even for a buffet.    The company we were with was brilliant and actually made the meal feel better than it actually was.  I may be wrong... The food seemed that it had been brought in and reheated rather than prepared fresh on the premises, particularly the sushi (obviously not reheated!), the beef wellington...the desserts too.  I apologise if I'm wrong!

All in all, a good experience and I just feel there's room for improvement.  I have been to hotels with similar offerings and much better quality because you can see it all being prepped and cooked in front of you...

For me to go again, something would have to change... Probably the price paid...
Loving ❤
Amazing hotel, golf, spa, pool, restaurants. Family friendly. Less than 1hr from London
Excellent. Celebrated our wedding anniversary. Service, second to none. Staff friendly and professional. Food delicious. Atmosphere and setting perfect.
Wonderful food at madhus and outdoor cinema
Lunch at the Stables. Great service. Lovely food. Good value. Amazing setting. Not stayed at the hotel ..

Absolutely incredible.  I had a spa day in the fabulous Seqouia and another day lunch which was outstanding.  I've been here so many times and it's because you get treated like royalty on EVERY visit. The Spa is spotlessly clean and attention to detail is amazing.  The lunch at the Spa was faultless I enjoyed it immensely.  The lunch at the hotel was superb we had the buffet. My daughter is coeliac and our outstanding waiter "Diana" I THINK that's how his name is spelt couldn't have done anymore to accommodate her. He helped her choose food at the buffet and made her feel extra special.  He was professional,polite and very kind. He brought her a gluten free birthday cake too which was perfect.  I highly recommended you stay here and/or eat here and have a treatment or spa day.
Visited for a birthday buffet. Excellent ambience, atmosphere, and food to satisfy the most discerning. Sushi specialities a real delight

Went for cloud 9 afternoon tea.
Great selection of savoury and sweet treats, who would have thought that a salmon scotch egg would taste sooo good. Sweet treats beautifully presented in a suitcase of foliage, with an edible chocolate flower pot. Luckily the sun came out so was a fantastic afternoon in a hot air balloon setting.

Friend had a buffet at their Glasshouse after their wedding registration.
Staff are attentive and service is immaculate.

Beautiful settings, with the most lovely landscaping.

Buffet spread has a big selection,  and would rate 7/10 for taste.

A lovely evening spent.

Did not stay here but was invited to a birthday party at the  Indian Restaurant called Madhus.  Food was good service was good and on the whole The Grove does do rooms and stays and there are other restaurants on the whole worth a visit
Me and my girlfriend visited the grove, we both had a wonderful experience. Our waitress Telise was very attentive and went above and beyond. We will be visiting again

Went there for a wedding ...
Food was wonderful....service was ok..
Great wedding reception though...

We celebrated our anniversary here. The staff were attentive without being overbearing, and they were very helpful and friendly. The reception, waiting staff and house keeping staff all made our stay special. Thank you 🙂. The hotel is beautifully kept, the gardens and grounds are stunning, the food at the restaurants is great too. The walled garden is a highlight, the spa and treatment rooms are also excellent. We felt that for the price we paid, that our room was beginning to look a little tired. It was otherwise a big bright room, with big windows and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom and shower were very good, and the bathtub was huge. The view of the garden from the 'garden view' room was an obstructed view which was not made clear at booking. There is a high wall on the balcony that means if you're sitting in the room, you can only see the tops of the trees.
We enjoyed our stay enormously and would return
Beautiful location

I only wandered around the grounds to see what was on offer. The place is kept immaculate with woodland walks and a pool and beach sauna and outdoor eating areas that are very classy. At about £500 for the cheapest room a day you'd hope it would be perfect.
Amazing hotel and facilities
Had the time of my life. Amazing place and just a stone's throw away from where I live (next door).

Amazing hotel! Really kind staff working there. Great bedrooms and service. You can go there to relax and enjoy the  peace and quite this hotel and the grounds around it offer. The breakfast is AMAZING and to die for. A lot of choice and there is something for everybody!  My boyfriend had a nut and seed allergy and the staff was incredibly considered and really paid attention for it.
The hotel is easy to get to from the airport. We had a great golf initiator (Sam Miller) who really made the initiation wonderful. The Woodland Hawking acitivity was lovely! If you want and love a personal experience with birds of prey, you really should book this activity. Grant, the owner of the birds of prey, was amazing! A really passionate, kid  and fun person who will tell you anything you want know about his job and the birds. Just amazing experience! We highly recommend it ! There are so much fun things to do outside the hotel that is provide by the hotel in a form of partnership. We also did the feast and foraging experience. It was a magical experience and perfect to end our weekend trip. We learned new things about plants in nature and the food was incredible. As co-organiser of our trip I can definatly say that The Grove and all the activities it offers is and are really worthy of visiting this hotel! We had a wonderfull time here and we would definatly go back there! Incredible hotel and experience! We really recommend it for everybody who want a peacefull and fun get away with family (and or friends)! (Ps: dogs are welcome to!)
Nice place for a function

Attended a function here and the venue was magnificent. Exceptional outside area and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. Golf course on the grounds and the drive up is picturesque.

Didn't stay over and the food was from an outside caterer so cannot make any comment on those

Absolute joke! Went to book and even thiugh screen shot they upped the price by £400!  Saying no upgrade to superior room available for tomorrow! Greedy place! There prices are all over the place! How can you also charge more for 1 adult and a small child then 2 adults!
Waiters could be more attentive otherwise great place for a drink
Absolutely fantastic. What a beautiful picturesque place. Staff were so friendly and the Donner buffet was exceptional
Excellent food In the Glasshouse Restaurant.  Very pleasant evening.
Good food but expensive
Always a pleasure staying here

Lovely venue
Very modern and stylish

Firstly I want to highlight that if it wasn’t for the absolutely outstanding, kind caring customer service of the duty manager Debbie Austin-Morgan I think I would have given this hotel a 1 star rating.

We stayed for 2 nights in the heatwave in June. The experience didn’t start well as the staff at reception seemed miserable and actually sighed at me when we went to check in! The young man behind the counter seemed terrified, awkward and obviously didn’t know what he was doing. He made no eye contact and kept walking to his colleague. When tried to clarify that breakfast was included he said he didn’t know and he advised to go to the glass house and ask then! We asked were the glass house was and he nodded to his left and said ‘over there’! It was not the best start.

We got to our room, which was boiling hot. We put the air con on but didn’t seem to make a difference but as we were off to Harry Potter we decided to leave it on and hopefully to come back to
a cool room. We got back to the room approximately 8pm and it was like an oven! We called reception and they sent the engineer to look at the aircon. He stated it was not working and he would let the duty manager.

This is where we met Debbie. She showed us to two other rooms, however one of the rooms the electricity wasn’t working so we went to the second room.
Again it was very very hot but the air con was set. We also had some windows to open to get an initial breeze. We had room service and alcohol from the free mini bar.
2:30 am. So hot. The air con again was not working. We didn’t sleep well. We had the windows opened but at 6am the gardners started using power tools so no sleep!

We went down for breakfast and on the way we were going to speak to reception but they seemed very busy so went to breakfast. We were sat and then it took 10 mins for anyone to come explain the breakfast or offer tea and coffee. The breakfast was very lovely though.
We went to speak to reception after breakfast and the member of staff eye rolled at me and said she would ask the maintenance department to look whilst we were out for the day.
Our day out was ruined to be honest as we were so tired and this so far has not been the relaxing luxurious stay we expected.
On our return about 4pm the staff on reception told us that ‘you hadn’t set the air con properly so we set it’. I said ‘I did set it. It didn’t work. I am aware how to set an air con’. All I got was a rude smirk and advised to call back if any other issues.

Guess what?? Yes, the room was an oven. I burst into tears. My husband went back to reception and again maintenance came up and after 3 hours, where told the air con was not working and hadn’t ever worked - newly refurbished room.
Debbie then appeared again. I was very upset. We then, with all our luggage, me with wet hair in a dressing gown then walked to the other side of the hotel to a beautiful freezing cold suite.
Debbie then offered to refund the previous night and put a bottle of prossecco on our table at dinner along with a late check out.

The glass house was lovely and our table waiter was very lovely and apart from Debbie the only person who was polite and kind to us.

We were so tired that we took advantage of the late check out and missed our Windsor castle tour.

In the end the one night was lovely with a lovely room, lovely food a nice member of staff.

But am very shocked that this is a 5 star hotel - the service, attitude of the staff, air con maintenance were so below the standards expected.

Debbie Austin -Morgan though really should be paid extra and asked to give lessons about kind, compassionate customer service to everyone but mostly to the reception staff.
Beautiful

Great location, really good service. Attended a business event. The grounds are beautiful we had a tour by the head gardener Tash. Very knowledge and the gardens are a credit to her.
The catering was excellent and the room was again excellent with some nice touches. Slippers and robe for the spar if you needed it. Would definitely go agafor a more romantic reason.
Breakfast in the morning was outstanding.
Great dinner and service in the stables restaurant

similarHotelsNearby.description: Refined all-suite lodging with a spa

similarHotelsNearby.name: DoubleTree by Hilton London - Chelsea
similarHotelsNearby.description: Stylish hotel with a European restaurant
