Holiday Inn Express London - Wandsworth, an IHG Hotel
The Alma (Hotel)
similarHotelsNearby.description: Classic hotel rooms above a gastropub

similarHotelsNearby.name: Barclay House London Boutique Bed & Breakfast

reviews.text:
Lovely Hotel,  but I didn't stay,  just came for a 60th birthday celebration dinner.
Food was great and the venue it's self lovely in the inside and outside.

Great position right on the River.

The spectacular views of helicopters landing on the helipad.

Mould, mould and more mould!!! (See pictures) Ruined our wedding night! Wish I could give it less than 1/5.
Worst stay of my life, we booked the Emperor suite to celebrate our wedding and stay for two nights. The Emperor suite was disgusting, the ceiling was riddled with mould and dust and it was very obvious where they had just (badly) painted over it. My wife's asthma was triggered by the mould and has had to start using heavy medication due to this. I told the staff and they offered to move rooms, the next 2 rooms were full of mould again. The 4th room did not have any visible mould. Staff were very unhelpful and made it seem like I was the problem for complaining about mould. I raised a complaint to management on 2nd September and no response still, we are now 13th October. They do not care about the conditions of their rooms. They do not care about you as a client or your stay. Do not spend your hard earned money on low quality fake prestige, £400 something a room, not even worth £40.

I cannot stress how awful the conditions are in this hotel. All of my images are time stamped and geotagged. This was in August 2023. I've given them a chance to respond but they have not even acknowledged a single email or call.

Please for your own health and mental well being, do not stay here under any circumstances!

Awful hotel, terrible service and an all round cheap and tacky experience.

I have video as well but can't upload them on google reviews. (Edited review on same day to update cost of room and the dates mentioned above)

I was there in May and broke my foot and ankle visiting a relative nearby. When I came back to the hotel they immediately rendered first aid and then drive me to hospital. I had quite a bit of food delivery during this time too. They were very kind and supportive throughout my entire (and extended) stay - something I will never forget. The restaurant was good and the manager just adorable.

Rafayel is one of the best places in London for a good meal or to sip a drink at the sunset.  The quality of the food has been consistent and excellent for many years now.. The premises are very well looked after and the staff does a really great job. I love to spend time with family and friends there.

Have been to better 3 star hotels. Myself and my partner are not a hugely fussy couple when it comes to customer service or luxury treatment, but we booked this “5 star” hotel for one night as a rare treat. We should have realised the hotel was questionable when we first arrived to a door labelled “hotel reception” which lead us into a cleaning cupboard.

The decor can only be described as headache inducing and the rooms have seen better days, maybe 30 years ago.

Staff were nice but disinterested and unhelpful.

Breakfast…we should have just gone to Wetherspoons.

We were pretty tired and keen to leave so didn’t bother complaining. But wish we did as we’re gutted that we spent money on something that was falsely advertised.
Went to the restaurant for a meal, service was good as well as the food.
Very friendly staff, and clean rooms

DO NOT go to this hotel is it extremely dirty and staff are extremely unprofessional and rude. The food is absolutely disgusting the spa is dirty and tiny the jacuzzi is quite intimate if you are in there with someone else you don’t know it’s quite awkward due to it’s size, it’s not a diverse place the manager called Dillsa I believe has such a foul attitude I can’t believe they hired people like this to manage a hotel. The beds are dirty and smell rooms look old and run down like they haven’t been renovated for 15 years it’s just a run down over expensive hotel that apart from the view if you are on the right side of the hotel had nothing to offer the other view is facing the street as my friend had that room and you can’t have curtains open without people peeping inside no privacy at all.

All in all I do not recommend booking this hotel staff are rude and dismissive
Amazing food. Best I have had in a long time. Amazing view.
Had a lovely meal here. The service was great with lovely views across the Thames.
Cool hotel and great stay

The place offers an incredible location and breathtaking views. The person in charge of making Shisha is exceptionally friendly and skilled, and the Shisha he prepared was incredibly smooth and flawless. Additionally, the food served there is delicious. I'm looking forward to returning to that place.
Stayed here 3 times now and just love the place warm and friendly staff beautifull hotel

I stay here regularly on my business trips. The rooms are super big and super clean. You don’t find sunsets like this in London . There are no obstructions and the Emperor suite that I prefer has an unobstructed view of the River Helicopter and sunsets.

Stayed here recently their was a stain on the sheets 1 tea bag and rude staff just wouldn't recommend it also the sauna smelt a bit off can't lie rooms advertised in a way of which didn't add up when I arrived door key didn't work either
Very good hotel. The owner his self come up to us and asked if everything was OK a very polite chap. Looking to book again for Friday

I would like to share with you my delight in finding this amazing restaurant. We were served a delicious starter and main course of salads, salmon and chicken tikka masala which I would definitely recommend. Not to forget, the most amazing cocktails (pina colada and passion fruit martini) that I’ve ever had to date! If you plan to go out to eat this is your best choice in Battersea.

I go to Hotel Rafayel and the restaurant very often, I love the view and the service and the food are amazing. I personally enjoy the sunset there with a glass of wine by the river and the atmosphere is so cosy and i can’t recommend it more.
I attended a retirement party the food was excellent to match the outstanding service

الفندق رائع وهادئ مع اطلالة وتمشية على النهر في منطقة باترسي بعيد عن صخب المدينة
مناسب لمن يحب الهدوء ومناسب للأطفال
الحمامات والغرف واسعة ومساحتها ممتازة
يمكن الذهاب بكل سهولة عبر الحافلة الى وسط لندن
هذه ثالث مرة اسكن في هذا الفندق
reviews.textTranslated:
The hotel is wonderful and quiet, with a view and a walk on the river in the Battersea area, far from the hustle and bustle of the city
Suitable for those who love calm and suitable for children
The bathrooms and rooms are spacious and of excellent size
You can easily go by bus to central London
This is the third time I stay in this hotel

reviews.text: Never received a booking confirmation. Stayed for our wedding night and looked for some special touches which only extended to rose petals that we had to pay for. My wife left her expensive washbag in the hotel room and they refuse to have seen it. They refuse to recall receiving our call about it only hours after we left and have deleted my wife’s reviews. A quick response to owners feedback on reviews tells you all you need to know about this hotel.

Edit!
This is a terrible hotel, staff are unhelpful, borderline rude and are thieves, stole my wash bag that I left in the room when we stayed the night of my wedding, room was small but sufficient. Nothing special, I’d avoid like the plague!

The booking was under Charles Hatcher on 06.05.23. We called up twice to be told their was no wash bag found, I know this not to be true the contents of the bag were very expensive. How dare you excuse this of being a fake review when you must have on record us calling up, if you do not it proves the incompetence and untrustworthiness of your staff. I don’t care if other people have written good reviews you made our honeymoon night awful, the service was terrible and your hotel have stolen hundreds of £s worth of skincare. I am genuinely horrified at your response taking no responsibility at all! And urge anyone that is considering staying here to think again as this service was abhorrent!!
Internet is terrible
The Banyan restaurant is one of my favourite places by the river in London. Beautiful decor, very helpful and efficient staff,  great location with a great view. I super reccomend!
This hotel always had a special place in me and my wife's relationship from the very beginning. Perfect with everything.

Stayed in Rafayal Hotel for an extended weekend break and my opinion is the hotel is it's fairly nice however overall, it certainly isn't 5* standard as described.

The in room packages were very good, definitely recommend if you're staying as a lot of effort was put in on that but the service was rather poor, which is the reason behind the low rating overall.

I can't speak for every staff member, but unfortunately the ones who we encountered did not provide a great level of service... Firstly we went to the restaurant one evening as we only got back late and had some dinner, but the staff were more focused on cleaning down and rushing us out rather than actually looking after us, I will give a fair assessment of the situation, it was late (21:45) however being rushed is also not ideal, my advice would be just don't take the reservation if you aren't prepared to provide the service, it felt very rushed, to the extent they were locking the doors as we were eating, the meals served were like Microwaved meals... but no questions were asked when the waitress came over and both plates were still full, the most frustrating thing was she had the card machine before even clearing the table, clearly wanting us to leave.. it just felt very rushed for an overpriced shoddy meal.

This bad taste was then followed the next day by an aggressive bar man when I went to get two coffees. I ordered, a gentlemen then asked me have I been serve, to which I explained the bar man had taken my order. He then came over telling me to wait and that he's serving somebody, very agressive, he clearly realised he was in the wrong as he gave me the coffees for free once I asked who he's speaking too, this combined with the previous evening left a bad taste on the hospitality side of things to which I'd go as far as saying to avoid the restaurant.

On two occasions we returned later on, to which 2 of the staff members are just sat around in the café bit in the dark, not even an acknowledgment at any point.

we opened the drawers to the mini fridge to make a coffee this morning, to which the dirty cups were placed in there from the day before.

To add to the service above, We were then further charged for parking today on check out which again was annoying as the lady who checked us in on Friday clearly stated the parking was included on the Monday aswell when we paid for that! We just paid today as we couldn't be bothered arguing but just both agreed it's an experience we won't be revisiting, especially with the other 5* hotels charging the same price.

The manager today came out with some belongings that were left behind, to which I'd say it's an honest run hotel, just rated far too highly for the level of service they provide.

If somebody would like to contact me to discuss this further, I am happy with that 👍

Rooms are ok than expected on the pics shown.
I didn’t expect even after paying a high accommodation cost both the coffee cups in my room were not clean.

The room I stayed it was very nice 👌
I was there for a week and the staff were brilliant 👏 will definitely be back

My second time visiting here, I was here for 5 days this time round. The staff were very attentive, the food was amazing also! Definitely recommend and I will be back again! 😀
Very nice location with great views etc. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting to stay near the Thames.
We loved our stay in last week of May 2023, had fantastic dinner at their restaurant. Enjoyed the walk with the family after dinner, best place to be in summers.

Went to the Hotel for Buisness meeting. Loved the view and the bar staff were very attentive. I do feel the devor us a little too fussy, but you have the feeling of being on a Botel, well for me it did.

Location nice being right on the Thames, with a nice river walk up to Battersea Park. Parking on site, a big plus and well priced for London.  Only downside to location is long way from Underground.
We used room service and food was tasty, hot and delivered within 30 min of ordering.
Only issue was a breakfast mix up regards our order, but this was sorted the next morning and a charge was struck off the bill so no complaints there.
Rooms a really good size though do show a few signs of wear and tear and in some places a little lack of detail. A small table to eat at would be a great addition to the rooms for in room dining.
Overall a nice stay, all our staff interactions were fine and professional.
Gym was adequate and complimentary.
Awesome experience as always. Room clean and tidy: location spot on. Parking  is gated and secure. Sam and Carmen are absolute stars. Will recommend and come back.
I have been to hotel a few times. Rooms are very nice and cosy. You have use of the steam and sauna and a cold pool and gym.

Stayed for one night, and the room was clean and bed comfortable. I didn't try any food, but there was tea and instant coffee in the room with milk sachets. It would have been nice to have fresh milk in the fridge, a coffee machine and maybe some biscuits at the price.
Unable to adjust climate control from room. Had to call front desk multiple times to remotely change temperature. Essentially locked out from making changes either in error or deliberately.

Most rude disgusting malicious hotel I’ve ever booked. The manager called me when I had important meeting to discuss a breakfast issue I stated I was in a meeting and can’t discuss details I can speak on upon arrival. They kept calling all week for inappropriate questions about things we could of spoke about when I arrived. She didn’t like the fact I said to her that she had a very rude tone and wouldn’t get off my phone despite me saying I’m at work. She then made a offensive comment and hung up. Her name is Kuman Dillsa and claimed to be the only manager available. I told her I was going to complain about her inappropriate behaviour and constantly calling to tell me jacuzzi wasn’t working and things I didn’t really feel were important because I made clear I didn’t want to use the jacuzzi. She then went behind my back and cancelled my booking and lied writing taps wasn’t working. I called back to ask her why she did that and she lied and said she didn’t. It wasn’t only until I stated my calls are recorded for work purposes she confesses. She didn’t realise I had 2 bookings as my parents were checking in day after me and she only cancelled one despite both being under my name. This was a obvious move to be malicious because I told her she’s calling me inappropriate hours of work when I asked them day before to not contact me until arrival. They are all Asian/Indian and not very diverse. She confidently said go and make a complaint as she knows the head office are also Asian clearly she wasn’t concerned. I also sent 2 emails regarding her behaviour and I’ve still had no response. Luckily I booked into another hotel which was way better than this one and I’m glad she saved me £1500 of my money. I also had 4 spa treatments booked at £90 which they also lost the money due to a managers foul attitude. I’ve never dealt with such unprofessionalism and when I told her I would make sure I post the call on social media so people could see how they treat paying customers she acted like she didn’t speak English. She wanted to inconvenience me but leave my parents booking? Her behaviour was erratic and absurd. Extremely unstable and her spiteful move to cancel one booking making a mistake to lie and leave the other as she didn’t notice o had 2 clearly shows this. I don’t recommend this hotel at all and the are unprofessional and have nobody to complain to if there is a issue.

It’s very very chic! And affordable whilst on the road. Thoroughly enjoyed my time there.

The heli-pad was exciting

Not bad, it was not too far from Clapham Station so in terms of location it wasn't too bad. Defo visit Battersea Powerstation which is only a short drive away. Our room was quite nice and big. The shower did have marks in it so we thought it wasn't clean but then realised it was just marks on the shower.  That was the only thing that was a bit off-putting. That and the rather 'loud' and strange decor ! Lol.
Good Hotel , great location,  seems a bit pricey for what it is .
Great place to visit, overlooking the Thames

Went here for my anniversary with my partner and we both loved our stay. We indulged in the spa and found it was designed very nicely, the Sauna, steam room, cold pool and hot tub were all very good. I do wish there was more of these instead of one of each. The rooms were gorgeous and spacious, the large windows offered us a great view of the Thames. the staff also decorated our bed in rose petals which was very nice.

The Dinner was also very nice, we found that it was decently cheap for a 5 star hotel, but it came quick and tasted good, especially the cheesecake severed for desert. What we did find during our dining experience was that a lot of the staff stood around a lot, which we can understand as at the time it wasn't very busy. But one stood on the stairs on his phone which was next to us, and that made us slightly uncomfortable, but nothing that dwells on us. Everything else was perfect and a lovely gateway for our anniversary. I would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone who is considering going here.
very loud sounds from the gym starting at 6 am and you will not be able to sleep. When we complained to the administrator, our request was ignored.

Officially listed as a 4 star it was a disappointment..Attended a party there, The staff are pleasant and thoughtful, it's unfortunate that the hotel itself let's them down..
The decor is a weird not Eclectic (which implies oddity by design) it's just weird..not in a good way. Tacky, unstructured, full of faux flowers in vases..on wall, on tables, on floors) 4 silver prancing dolphins adorn the front entrance set on a rug. There are a lot of rugs. Everywhere.  It's as though a lot of the decorations were purchased on a market stall? There is no coherence or theme. Unless the theme is living in a nightmare David Lynch film set.
Rooms were clean. Bizarre TV hanging from a metal pole in the ceiling? Why? It was at head height and protruded from wall, hit it a few times as the gap between the bed and wall was quite small.
Leaking shower and taps. Lose more points. The cot bed was horrible.  A mattress about 3 inches thick, I have backache today. All for £320 a night. Absolute rip off. There is a travel lodge 5 mins away  choose wisely, do not book to stay here. Its a very poor example of a 4 star hotel.

Went to eat food here and it was the worst food I’ve had for ages! Service was awful and rude, food came out incorrect and had to wait 15 minutes for what I ordered whist my friend ate her food then my food came and was soggy.
Waiter was having a conversation with a friend whist taking our order.
Would never waste my money here again!!!!

Nothing to add … truly deserves 5 stars. The most amazing feature is the bathroom and the bath tub. Room service excellent and of course tidy clean fully technological. Close to transport and great location.
Had to do some work at this hotel today. Extremely helpful staff. Great venue. Friendly owner. Can't wait to come back again. Thank you!
A great little place on the river, with great views ,great food and great atmosphere. I would visit again as  it's in a nicely secluded area with views of the helipad overlooking The River Thames.
I was invited to a birthday party on the 26/3/23.  I had a brilliant evening..The Staff were so helpful and  the food was excellent.. The hotel is so beautiful it has a lovely view by the river.

I did a last minute search for hotel spa and found this place in good location in London. The receptionist was helpful with the reservations over the phone.
I booked for a 60mins deep tissue massage, and I would have to say the therapist is very strong! Stronger than I normally do deep tissue massage. I did communicate a few times to get the pressure right , which I doze off a couple of times eventually. So I would go back if I got very tight muscles again.
The spa ticked all the boxes I was looking for. A jucuzzi & sauna. Pleasant intimate place.
No complain about the changing room.
I am happy for the prize I paid off and bonus on the helpful service to fit in my last minute request. Keep it up!
Loved it.
Really nice room, hotel not in the most prestigious location but very comfortable.

My partner and I stayed in this hotel and we loved it. The rooms were great with a spacious and modern bathroom. The sauna and the steam room were also a nice feature but we opted against using the jacuzzi. I would definitely stay again.

The Hotel itself is a lovely venue, However the sfaff are extremely odd and refused to make cocktails that were on the menu because he didn't like making them and the people serving food were very stingy acting like they wanted to take the rest home for themselves even though the function had come to an end!! Not great service at all.

Our hotel room was robbed we have a crime reference number ! The staff as soon as you check in have no manners , there is mess everywhere around the hotel !! AVOID THIS HOTEL ITS NOT 5 STAR .. will leave reviews on all sites !! Don’t leave a review like the owner asks until you leave  the hotel !!!!

Stayed at the hotel with 2 of my female friends. The receptionist kept knocking at our door and then demanded to come in to see who was inside. As females in a hotel this was very uncomfortable for us! Do not recommend this hotel🤮!
Fantastic hotel. Will certainly stay here again when visiting this part of town.
La decoración no está acorde con un Hotel de 5 estrellas. Y algunos servicios de la habitación tampoco como la falta de elementos en el.baño. El servicio del personal muy bien.
reviews.textTranslated: The decoration is not in line with a 5-star hotel. And some room services as well as the lack of items in the bathroom. The staff service is very good.

reviews.text: A great Hotel in an amazing location with great view near the river bank.

I have slightly mixed views on this. For value for money in London I think it was ok. The view was stunning with a big panoramic view of the Thames and I liked the unique shape of the room. But because it was more expensive I was disappointed with general wear and poor repairs in places, and things like certain lights not working. If it was in top condition I would pay more. We had a few cocktails at the bar late in the evening and the barman was hilarious and so kind, we went off to bed still laughing :)
Went for a spa day it was absolutely brilliant and staff were amazing
Very nice hotel. Excellent customer service.
Great service and by the Thames.
5* hotel? Really?! More like a 3* but certainly not 5! Location is great but everything else is average
Finding a great venue for the venue is key, but it is the professional staff that will make the day run smoothly.
Went for Christmas dinner ...
Great hotel and service with beautiful view

Great location with nice view. Rooms are very nice and you get worth for your money as there is no other place in the area for that price that would look that good. Staff is friendly and helpful. Restaurant is very nice with a view on river. Spa is bit boring for my taste as it has one small pool, jacuzzi and 2 saunas. Overall happy to visit again.
Beautiful spa hotel, great service before and after entering, perfectly harmonious room, cozy, clean and ideal for family or couple. I recommend it for sure!

We came as a group of 26 to celebrate celebrate my mums 65th birthday. The service was exceptional, everyone enjoyed their meals and the bar makes lovely cocktails too. We'll definitely go back and recommend this place to others.

الفندق موقعه مو للتمشية ممكن استجمام يومين لا اكثر
مميزاته كنا حاجزين ( suite ) المساحة ✔️ اطلاله حلوه على النهر بس مو افضل اطلالة بالحياة✔️ الاكل حلو ✔️
عيوبه مافيه شطاف، مو موفرين مويه وبعيد عن السنتر يحتاج سياره او باص
ياخذون 50£ تأمين للحجز ويرجعونها بعد كم يوم
بشكل عام ما يعتبر فندق ٥ نجوم

The location of the hotel is far away from the center
I don't give 5 stars because it is not like the other 5 stars hotel
The size of suite is big and the view good but not the best
No water on the room
The food is delicious
They left notes "don't leave the door of the shower open because the alarm is on?????"
"don't put rose in the bathtub and if you put about 150£" it's a joke?
reviews.textTranslated:
The hotel is not located for walking. It is possible to relax for two days, no more
Its advantages: we booked (suite) the size ✔️ a nice view of the river, but it is not the best view of life ✔️ the food is sweet ✔️
Its drawbacks are that it does not have a bidet, it does not provide water, and it is far from the center, which requires a car or a bus
They take a £50 deposit for the reservation and return it after how many days
In general what is considered a 5 star hotel

The location of the hotel is far away from the center
I don't give 5 stars because it is not like the other 5 stars hotel
The size of the suite is big and the view is good but not the best
No water on the room
The food is delicious
They left notes "don't leave the door of the shower open because the alarm is on?????"
"don't put rose in the bathtub and if you put about 150 pounds" it's a joke?

reviews.text:
Outstanding service from the start to the end.
The hotel manager Masood was very professional, friendly and most importantly willing to make our Christmas party a success. Thank you 🙏 we will be back.

Treated family members to a stay at the hotel for 3 nights and had to pay a deposit on arrival of 50GBP for them, which would be refunded on my card. I never received it back. My family members thought the stay was so so. The decor is dated, with plastic tacky banners put up and chairs and equipment stored in the corridor. Reception area is where the 80s Versacesque abomination. In addition, during the last night there was a technical issue setting off the inbuilt, badly covered tvs in the room and bathroom, causing a lot of noise around midnight. Someone came to look at it and brought in another guy to try and find the source and silence it. It then happened again around 3am. Same story again, however this time the 2 said staff members were fighting in the corridor basically making it impossible for my family to rest. Upon check out, my brother complained at reception about the incident and was given compensation for the night. At no point was mentioned that the deposit was included in the compensation given back to the guests and not to me as the cardholder. I spoke to the hotel, as I am the card holder for the booking and the deposit, but am not being given my deposit back. AVOID AT ALL COST!
It was a little bit expensive, They should have better customer service
Fantastic food and the staff are friendly and the service is excellent we will be booking our Premier windows Xmas party there if they are not already fully booked
Great location for event, now water in evening in room, shower head broken, promised it would be fixed when out. It wasn't.
Perfect stay
Surprise birthday present for my wife . We thoroughly enjoyed Our two night stay
Beautiful hotel next to the river Thames. I was impressed watching the helicopters fly in and out of the helipad. Amazing view.

I just would like to comment about the location.
It is interesting location, near the river, near the massive council flats and massive private flats with industrial estate type of shops.It might be better in a few years but at the moment I found the area really intimidating. Not very close to London central, you can get a bus to go to Victoria in 10mins or so that is good but Clapham is horrible. I am not sure if I can recommend, especially if you are female only party.

The staff locked me out on the roof and then tried to defend their actions on Trip Advisor. They are psycho about trying to defend bad reviews on Trip Advisor, and will watch old camera footage to make themselves sound in the right.

Most definitely not 5*. Not even 4. Something weird about this place. Hardly anyone in and restaurant empty. Food average. Staff odd, not friendly or welcoming just ok. Not a patch on the big name hotels for service, feel etc. Rib -eye med.  rare came overcooked. If you can’t cook a steak you shouldn’t be in a kitchen.
Avoid.
Stayed for a long weekend in this lovely clean Hotel with very welcoming atmosphere. Staff friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay there again.

Who ever gave 5 stars to this dismal excuse for a hotel should be made to live there. The ONLY good thing about the room was the excellent water pressure in the shower.
Torn carpet, warm fridge, horrible bed, death trap getting in and out of the shower, electric plugs in bathroom did not fit the hairdryer, several of the outlets in the room were dead and the lighting in both the bathroom and the room was worse than poor.
Now, onto the food.
We had the "breakfast included " plan. Big mistake.  The "buffet " consists of eggs, bacon, possibly eggs (hard to tell), mushrooms, some sort of potatoes and beans that look like they were leftovers from the day before.  That's why I decided to order from the menu.  Also a mistake.  The eggs Benedict consisted of an English muffin that was "toasted " until it tasted stale, over poached eggs on stringy prosciutto topped with some sort of paste.
After expressing our disappointment in everything the management offered a bottle of prosecco and the opportunity to change rooms. (We were there for 11nights). We turned this down and were basically ignored for the rest of our stay. This hotel is very tired, broken windows, plastic flowers (in vases of dirty water) and some deep cleaning in all areas is needed.
Almost forgot about the fire alarm going off at 1:30am. When asked the next morning, the staff actually said "what alarm?" It must have rung for at least 5min. Other guests were also leaving their rooms and no one from the hotel showed any concern or advised us on what was going on.
All in all my best advice is:
STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!

First of all this is not a five star hotel, more like a three star. £180 was over priced for a room that comes with a small bed, no tooth paste, a tiny bit of toilet roll left. Tried contacting the reception, but then their phone doesn’t work, on top of that £20 parking per night, better of parking nearby for free.

Good size rooms some overlooking Thames and beside River walk. Hotel within easy reach of Battersea and about 10 mins from Clapham Junction. Expensive but best value around for London, we didn't include breakfast so can't comment on food, basic coffees/ tea in room which includes fridge. A/C very loud and controls not all clear, front door not working on our last stay, in general we found staff ok but only that, not particularly warm or friendly. Hotel generally clean and room, bathroom etc were well kept. Would return for location but not facilities.
My wife and I stayed there for one week. Great hotel, very clean, and friendly staff. We have enjoyed our stay, and its great location.

Excellent service, especially from Kiana on Reception,  and Victor from the Restaurant. But also , all the staff were exceptional.  I will definitely  recommend this hotel to my friends.
The food was amazing. Thanks Rafayel!!!!
Lovely hotel. Very friendly staff. Great location for where we were going. Good food and ex emotionally clean

- Nice hotel for an okay price.
- Don't like that their card keys can open multiple rooms, on two separate occasions a guest accidentally walked in my room with their key card.
- Staff was polite.
- Wifi was pretty bad.

Such a beautiful stay. Loved every moment of it, but I did a late check out which was £20 per hour. I check out around 12:50 and the whole £50 deposit was taken. There wasn’t even a mini bar in our room??
Amazing room and hotel, though some staff were a bit short tempered. However lovely hotel would recommend.

title: Tower Suites by Blue Orchid Hotels

similarHotelsNearby.name: citizenM Tower of London hotel
similarHotelsNearby.description: Bright, stylish lodging with free Wi-Fi

similarHotelsNearby.name: DoubleTree by Hilton London - Tower of London
Apex City of London Hotel
similarHotelsNearby.description: Modern lodging with dining & a bar

similarHotelsNearby.name: Hotel Motel One London Tower Hill
similarHotelsNearby.description: Fashionable lodging with a chic cafe/bar

similarHotelsNearby.name: Hotel Indigo London - Tower Hill, an IHG Hotel
Leonardo Royal Hotel London Tower Bridge
similarHotelsNearby.description: Elegant lodging with dining & a pool

reviews.text: Location is really convenient and room was fantastic. The scoring of this review is based on the horrible taxi service we got to go to the airport. Hotel has a kind of agreement with a local taxi driver/company that costed us 105 GBP to go from the hotel to Heathrow airport. They initially said 100 GBP but I didn´t want to discuss about it. We were supposed to arrive to Terminal 5 but the taxi driver finally left us in Terminal 4 without telling us. We had to take 2 additional trains to arrive to our initial destiny. We almost lost our plane after paying such a considerable amount. I really consider should manage much better this type of extras that could have ruined completely our stay in London.

Stayed here in June for my birthday and oh my god what an excellent hotel! So central to tram stations and Tower Bridge. Fantastic room service, staff could not have been more helpful. Breakfast was brilliant too. Room was clean and tidy and view was lovely too. Would definitely come back here if I was to stay in London again!
Good location opposite to Tower of London

Very close to DLR station and and London Tower Bridge. The staff is very friendly. The prices are quite expensive, and cappuccino or latte macchiato is not included in the breakfast price. One of the elevators was down several days.

I had the pleasure of staying at Tower Suites by Blue Orchid for an extended period of one month and four days (Sept-October 2023). From the moment we arrived, it was evident that the staff at Tower Suites prioritized guest satisfaction going above and beyond to ensure we had a fantastic experience throughout our stay.

Initially, we had booked an Airbnb for our accommodation after the first few days we were here. However, upon realizing that it did not meet our standards, we made the decision to return to Tower Suites. The front office team leader, Vi, not only welcomed us back but also personally ensured that our entire month-long stay felt like a true home away from home.

One aspect of our stay that required special attention was our bedding preference. We had requested two single beds instead of a king-sized bed and a rollaway mattress. The front duty manager, Mr. Trevor, and the housekeeping team member, Mr. Jishnu, tirelessly searched the entire hotel to fulfill our request. Their dedication and commitment to guest satisfaction were truly commendable.

The culinary experience at Tower Suites was nothing short of exceptional. Mr. Boris, in charge of breakfast, consistently delivered a perfect start to our day. We also had the pleasure of dining at the hotel's restaurant, where Mr. Mohammad, the supervisor, ensured that every dish catered to our taste buds. The quality of the food and the impeccable service left a lasting impression on us.

Throughout our stay, the concierges, Mr. Yasen, Diogo, Alex were warm, kind and always available to assist us. Their friendly demeanor and willingness to go the extra mile enhanced our overall experience at Tower Suites.

Furthermore, I had the privilege of witnessing a remarkable event during my stay—the Guinness World Record for padel tennis, set by none other than Mr. Tony Matharu himself. This extraordinary event added an exciting and memorable touch to my time at Tower Suites.

While our overall experience at the hotel was positive, there was one aspect that left us perplexed and raised some concerns. We were instructed to vacate our rooms if we wanted them to be cleaned, citing it as a hotel policy. However, the reasoning behind this policy was not adequately explained, and it left us questioning its legitimacy.

Fortunately, we did not encounter any incidents of theft or misplaced belongings during our stay, which was a relief. Nevertheless, the requirement to leave our rooms during the cleaning process seemed questionable and lacking transparency. It would have been helpful to receive clearer information or alternative options for accommodating the cleaning while ensuring the security of our personal belongings.

In conclusion, my stay at Tower Suites by Blue Orchid was truly remarkable. The attentive and dedicated staff, led by Vi, Trevor, Boris, Mohammad, Yasen, Alex Diogo and Raj created an atmosphere that surpassed all expectations. The exceptional service, delectable cuisine, and memorable experiences made Tower Suites a top-notch choice for anyone seeking a professional and luxurious stay. I highly recommend Tower Suites for an unparalleled hospitality experience.

Thank you for reading:)
Price is the only issue with this hotel. Breakfast is good for the price.

Had a great stay here it was a mini apartment with hob. Fridge kettle. Cosy lounge area and lovely sleeping facilities. We went down for breakfast which was included in the price. And there was a great choice, from cooked English breakfast to salmon. Cold meats cheeses. Yoghurt, fruit. It goes on there was so much. I definatly would return.

Had a wonderful stay at the Tower Suites, Blue Orchid. Staff were friendly, welcoming and got involved with the atmosphere. Fantastic experience and rooms were incredible standard. Will certainly come here again!

Good location to local bars and pubs with a buzzing atmosphere surrounding as its near to a DLR station and short walk to multiple underground's.

Tolles Zimmer! Direkt an der Bahnlinie. Manche Zimmer mit Blick auf die Gleise. Tolle Lage - in unmittelbarer Nähe zum Tower of London, U-Bahn Station Tower Hill, Buslinien etc. Zimmer sehr ruhig, trotz direkter Lage zur Bahn. 35 min. Vom Airport London City.
Leider wurde während unseres 4 Tage- Aufenthaltes (3 Nächte) kein einziges Mal unsere Mülleimer (Bad, Küchenzeile, Sitzecke) geleert. Auch die Zimmerreinigung (trotz „bitte reinigen-Schildchen“ an der Tür) einfach vergessen an einem Tag (nicht der Abreisetag!).
Frühstück mit 25£ /p.P. zu teuer! Wir sind dann auswärts zum frühstücken.
reviews.textTranslated:
Great room! Right on the train line. Some rooms have a view of the tracks. Great location - in close proximity to the Tower of London, Tower Hill tube station, bus lines etc. Room very quiet, despite being directly located to the train. 35 mins from London City Airport.
Unfortunately, our trash cans (bathroom, kitchenette, sitting area) were not emptied once during our 4 day stay (3 nights). The room cleaning was also simply forgotten on one day (not the day of departure!) (despite the “please clean” sign on the door).
Breakfast at £25 per person too expensive! We then went out for breakfast.

reviews.text:
Never visit again... A staff and other customer entered my room suddenly in midnight ...A strange voice struck my ears So I woke up with terrible fear. But no one explained about this shocking mistake. We requested front to change our keys next morning..... and the key doesn't working so changed again and again.... the security was a mess.
I stayed here for 6 night but there was unidentified noise so we had to change the room in the midnight. we called several times to front but it had several hours to check our room by manager.
this hotel has nice position but has a shared wall .
So I heard a tumult of noise during 6 nights.
And there were several silverfish also....
I'll never visit here again...
It is not five-star hotel.
とても便利の良い場所でした。スイートなので、とても広かったです
reviews.textTranslated: It was a very convenient location. It was a suite so it was very spacious.

reviews.text: Great hotel with great service. Rooms are large and there are enough facilities to make our stay very pleasant. Huge apartments with washing machine, dishwasher, coffee machine and even a yoga mat. The staff was great. Breakfast was a pure feast with tons of options! The setting is great, close to Tower Bridge. Downside is that party people can be really loud and can disturb  your sleep. Silence during nighttime is not enforced in any way.
Good service. Clean room. They make amazing honeymoon for me. The best choice in London
Great location and service.
Buena ubicación para estar en londre en familia, tiene todos los puntos serca.
reviews.textTranslated: Good location to be in London with the family, it has all the nearby points.

reviews.text: Best view of London tower

Staff called me and knocked on my door and woke me up 3 times. I also extended my stay by one day and it took me 30 minutes at reception to pay upfront for the extra night and then staff came to my room to go to reception the next day. Very poor customer service. No access to rooftop bar like when it first opened. Thousands of hotels in London and this is one to avoid. On checkout I was informed they believe they are a 5 star hotel….  It’s not possible. I’ve stayed at more than 100 5 stars internationally and this is a 3 star.

On checkout I heard 2 other guests complaining.
Brilliant stay. Superb location. Room was ideal for my family and the staff were so attentive and friendly. Would definitely recommend
Views from the top are amazing

Hotel rooms are large and modern. Good facilities in the rooms and overall clean enough

Bathrooms could do with some maintenance(missing grout/dirty and no longer white) and better cleaning of the showers especially to remove all of previous guests hair from the drains.

Found the room to be too hot and the lowest the air conditioning goes is 19 degrees. Can have quite abit of noise at night if on the front, was on the 7th floor and could still hear traffic/people but not overtly bad

Mattress was too hard/uncomfortable for my liking but that’s personal preference

Given the price I wouldn’t stay again as it wasn’t for me but overall it’s a good hotel and would recommend.
Great place, in fact very close to the Metro, and to DLR services. although pretty far from Heathrow, good distance from your apartment to London City Airport.

This hotel's location above the underground station is convenient, and it's exceptionally clean. The staff, especially the concierge, were friendly and helpful. However, the downside is the late check-in at 3 PM and early check-out at 11 AM. Additionally, I was disappointed with the room view, and I share your sentiment about hotels putting two small beds together and calling it a king or queen bed.

런던에서 교통편, 위치로는 최상 입니다.
버스 정류장 호텔 바로 앞
타워힐 언더그라운드 몇분 거리
런던 전지역을 대중교통으로 다닐수 있어요.
reviews.textTranslated:
It is the best location for transportation in London.
Bus stop right in front of the hotel
Minutes to Tower Hill Underground
You can travel all over London by public transportation.

reviews.text: scenic location, staff are very friendly and the room is quite nice

The room was not ready for check in, sandwich and milk were over a week out of date left in the fridge and the balcony door was broken at the top so it would not close properly letting a lot of noise in. On the plus side Check in staff friendly

Overall, OK, it's a general OK hotel. Breakfast is fine, self-service so can be on the cooler side and eggs general firm. However, the room was clean, reasonably tea and coffee facilities with biscuits 😋.

Pas un très bon accueil au moment du check in. La suite n'était pas prête à 15h00 contrairement à ce qui nous avait été annoncé. Au petit déjeuner on nous proposait souvent deux tables de 2 personnes alors que nous étions une famille de 3 personnes. Le room service changeait Les serviettes et les boissons pour 2 personnes alors que nous étions 3, chose que j'ai signalé à mi parcours.
reviews.textTranslated: Not a very good welcome at check-in. The suite was not ready at 3:00 p.m. contrary to what we had been told. At breakfast we were often offered two tables of 2 people when we were a family of 3. Room service was changing towels and drinks for 2 people when there were 3 of us, something I pointed out halfway through.

reviews.text: 酒店位置很好，給升了級，窗戶可以看到倫敦橋，步行到倫敦塔。去大英博物館什麼主要景點，都很方便。推薦。
reviews.textTranslated: The hotel is in a good location and has been upgraded. You can see London Bridge from the windows and walk to the Tower of London. It is very convenient to go to the British Museum and other major attractions. recommend.

reviews.text: Generally a very good hotel, however dropped one star due to housekeeping can be a minor incovenience due to items not being topped up, as needed.
أفضل ما أقول عنه بأنه فندق جميل جداً ومريح جداً
reviews.textTranslated: The best I can say about it is that it is a very nice and very comfortable hotel

reviews.text:
Location is good. The room is good.
The front desk is not that friendly, no smile. But the concierge persons are all nice and always willing to help.
House keeping did not fill the body shower, Shampoo, laundry detergent, dish washing machine powder. I stayed for 8 days and I had to call them to refill everyday.

Very polite staff members, was a pleasure staying with them in 2021. We had an incident where our TV was not working properly and they upgraded our room. It’s a 30 second walk to the tube, so commuting to this hotel is not a problem
Lage, Essen, Personal, Service, Zimmer... alles super. Kann ich mit gutem Gewissen weiter empfehlen.
reviews.textTranslated: Location, food, staff, service, room... everything was great. I can recommend it with a clear conscience.

reviews.text: I had a studio suite.  It's comfy and roomy for 2 people.  I like the air con is quiet and temperature control is good.  Toilet is good size and have a cabinet to stuff, and decor is good too.  I also like the location, with Starbucks, underground station, and a coop express very closeby.  Just that the location is not too close to most tourist places or popular rail stations, so this adds up to the transport costs for the trip.  But maybe because of this, it feels safe at night.

The staff Bright had a very BAD attitude and was extremely impatient with the guests. He did nothing to help and even blame the guests. The performance of the staff Bright almost ruined the experience of this hotel. Very poor service experience.

Misleading  pictures of suites with view over Tower bridge.
Never changed Bed linen in 11 nights. Poor cleaning.
Stains on glasses and cutlery. This I reported to receptionists in person.
-----
When you look room options in some hotels while booking, you might read: (1) room with sea view (2) room with garden view (3) room with city view.

At Blue Orchid suites there were no options like this. Instead there were suites with beautiful pictures overlooking Tower Bridge. It turned out to be so called a russian roulette you can get it or you can not.

Why not to divide suites by options at booking stage, like with view or without and do not make people hope or ask receptionist who were quite polite to say “no” everyday.

This was the main disappointment. Either you split options so people can pay more for view if they want to or pay less if they don’t care.
Or do not put view picture on the suites option, rather on general pictures of hotel.

Also, of course, we stayed for 11 nights and it might be better for them for have 6-8-9-10 people changing nights in room with the view for reviews rather long time residents for only 1 review.

When we came with kids little time before midnight, the bed for kids was not ready and we waited tired another half an hour for them to resolve the issue. To bring missing soap bar and slippers and yoga mat for morning. Quite disorganized when you arrive very late.

When you have shower, water leaks along the mirror wall and it is all wet.

To bottom up: if you specifically choose this hotel for the view like us based on picture: it will be a roulette. You can get it or not. Might be disappointing. Do not reply on it. Pictures are misleading.

Good things: convenient when with kids suites have fully packed kitchette with washing/drying mashing and capsules provided.
With small kids like ours - size of the room is ok to accommodate.
Location is close to must see and to the bank of the Thames.

Fantastic room - like a home from home.  The location is so good for the SAP office in the Scalpel and to get to other central London business locations.  The room has everything I needed to be self sufficient including a washer-dryer and dishwasher.

Sehr sehr schönes Zimmer gut eingerichtet, doch die Lichtschalter sind ein bisschen verwirrend alles an geht was aus bei alles aus nur ein Teil an….
Ist aber ansonsten super, super Lage Bus und Bahnverbindung,sehr freundliches Personal Frühstück einfach nur toll und die Bar auch.
Aber einmal wurde unser Zimmet nicht aufgeräumt.
Egal

Danke für dieses schöne Erlebnis liebes Hotel.
reviews.textTranslated:
Very very nice room well furnished, but the light switches are a bit confusing everything goes on what is off when everything is off only a part is on….
But otherwise it's great, great location, bus and train connections, very friendly staff Breakfast just great and the bar too.
But once our room was not cleaned up.
No matter

Thank you for this beautiful experience dear hotel.

reviews.text:
First time staying at this hotel and we’re pretty pleased. Very good location to Tower Hill Underground Station as well as other popular attractions. Hotel lobby is small but plenty of elevators to go up or down.

Rooms are great sized! It’s nice having some space and room to move around. There’s even a washer/dryer which we used once. Bathrooms are clean and modern. Room service was good as well. I do wish we could crack the windows open for some fresh air though. I wish they had rooms with 2 double or 2 queen beds for families so we would not have to book 2 rooms. The pull out bed from the couch is alright but not very comfortable.
There was also a loud buzzing/humming sound in that side of the room from either the fridge or something in the ceiling.

All in all, a very good stay and I would come back here again.
Great place to stay in London. Rooms are great with great amenities on site
We went there for the Padel Festival and we loved it!

Can't fault Tower Bridge Suites - our stay was wonderful. Staff are friendly and helpful helpful, great breakfast options, from the cold offerings to the hot breakfast, including fresh fruit, individual yogurt in different flavours), to the efficient, fast and friendly service by staff in the restaurant.
Room was clean and spacious, with
well appointed kitchen and spacious bathroom. Very comfortable bed and pillows.
Loved, loved how close to the train station and restaurants the hotel is.
Phantastisches Hotel. Tolle geräumige Zimmer. Großes Badezimmer. Super freundliche und zuvorkommende Mitarbeiter.
reviews.textTranslated: Fantastic hotel. Great spacious rooms. Big bathroom. Super friendly and courteous staff.

reviews.text: Very convenient to use public transportation - literally next to Tower Hill tube station and #15 bus. The room was spacious and clean. Kitchenette was helpful with a few dishes, utensils  and a microwave. Don't miss a stunning view of Tower of London from the rooftop (smoking area)!

房間的打掃不太乾淨，我們入住五晚中有兩晚都能清晰看到前一晚地板的頭髮、衛生紙屑，另外浴巾的補充不夠，這還是我們已經向櫃檯反映的情況。廁所的排氣效果不好，上完廁所的人會很尷尬；浴室的排水系統對於女生不友善，頭髮洗完，整個浴室也要淹水了。
飯店人員給予所需物品的態度很積極，我們成員中有人不舒服需要多喝水，飯店人員馬上又給了一份。
飯店就座落於公車站、地鐵、伊莉莎白線及倫敦塔的附近，對於遊客來說很方便。
reviews.textTranslated:
The cleaning of the room was not very clean. In two of the five nights we stayed, we could clearly see the hair and toilet paper scraps on the floor from the previous night. In addition, the bath towels were not replenished enough. This is what we have already reported to the counter. The exhaust effect of the toilet is not good, and people who use the toilet will be embarrassed; the drainage system in the bathroom is not friendly to girls, and the whole bathroom will be flooded after washing their hair.
The attitude of the hotel staff in giving the necessary items was very positive. Some of our members felt uncomfortable and needed to drink more water, and the hotel staff gave another one immediately.
The hotel is located near the bus station, subway, Elizabeth Line and the Tower of London, which is very convenient for tourists.

reviews.text: Wonderful location, amazing suites, best prices. It was really good
Fantastic rooms for the cost. Good useful hotel

Overall, a pleasant experience with a superb location. Reception and concierge staff very courteous and helpful, especially Dipanjan who went to great lengths to get us a cab.
Housekeeping is a bit spotty. They do a good job but are definitely understaffed.
The roof garden, advertised on their website, is always rented out for events and, therefore, not accessible to hotel guests. There is a so-called Residents Lounge on the 7th floor, but we were not told anything about it.
Excellent location, good room size & service, value for money

It was one of the better hotels I've stayed. Everyone is polite and helpful. Rooms are clean, and they make sure to clean it when we are not here. The location is great, and it's near underground station.

The location is very convenient to Tower Bridge and Tower of London. The room was very spacious. It was for my birthday and they provided a hand written card and chocolate covered strawberries. We had breakfast at the hotel most mornings and the selection was great. Our kids enjoyed the hot chocolate and pancakes/waffles for sure.
It would have been a 5 out of 5 if they were more helpful in fixing their mistake on our charge. Beware of how they charge your card if they simply take it to settle during check in as you may incur unnecessary conversion fees.
1. The biggest issue is that they charged us using US currency when our card had no transaction fees. The staff took our card and never offered us an option to pay in local currency or US currency. We never once had any other vendors do this to us as many times as we've traveled internationally. I realized this when checking the credit card that the amount did not seem right (after using the conversion rate). They insisted that they charged using local currency and said it must be our credit card's issue. After talking to the credit card company and touching base with the staff again, one of their staff said they would pick whatever option. They never once offered to fix it for us so we are not out several hundred dollars due to their mistake. This was highly disappointing to us.
2 As mentioned in several other reviews, the website advertised rooftop but you cannot use it unless for private event.
Very nice place to spend your holidays….good good …well behaved people …absolutely wonderful experience.
Spacious rooms. Right next to an Underground station
اسوء فندق بالندن من حيث النظافه  لا انصح السكن فيه
reviews.textTranslated: The worst hotel in London in terms of cleanliness. I do not recommend staying in it

reviews.text:
The location and hotel is very nice and we had no issues though there were multiple service-related issues while we were there.  Both nights we stayed there, the fire alarm went off and there wasn’t a fire.  When we asked staff, they said that it was because someone was showering with the door open and the steam set it off.  However, if this is a known issue, why is there not signage telling people to keep the bathroom doors closed while showering?

Second, when checking out there was a long line and a huge crowd trying to check in a and out.  As we didn’t make any extra charges, we asked a staff member if we needed to wait in line or if we could just give him the room keys.  He said we needed to wait.  After we waited 30 minutes in line, the woman at the front desk said we hadn’t had to wait.  Very frustrating.

Very high priced hotel with small rooms and cramped style. Staff were polite and passive, did not try to anticipate needs (like 4 people checking into a room with a queen bed and soda bed might need sheets, dovet, pillows, towels...). Fitted refrigerator door didn't shut properly. Wi-Fi worked intermittently. Not all USB outlets integrated into room worked. Views of tower bridge, tower of London, and the shard are very good.
Beautiful place very helpful staff grate location
The Tower Suites in an excellent location for someone who wants to see sites that are within walking distance such as the Tower Bridge or accessible by the subway such as the London Eye.

albergo situato in ottima posizione vicino alle fermate della metro e al Tower Bridge, personale alla reception gentile e disponibile, camere ampie e confortevoli con lavandino e bollitore ma in bagno manca il bidè.
Da un albergo a 5 stelle mi aspettavo di avere una colazione più varia e assortita; la mia prenotazione comprendeva la colazione  e pertanto qualsiasi altra cosa non presente a buffet ( veramente minimal) ho dovuto pagarla come un normalissimo cappuccino che si è dismotrato essere un caffèlatte. il personale di sala poco attento e professionale. Posizione ok ma le 5 stelle anche no specialmente per la colazione
reviews.textTranslated:
hotel located in an excellent position close to metro stops and Tower Bridge, friendly and helpful reception staff, large and comfortable rooms with sink and kettle but no bidet in the bathroom.
From a 5-star hotel I expected to have a more varied and assorted breakfast; my booking included breakfast and therefore anything else not present in the buffet (really minimal) I had to pay for it like a normal cappuccino which turned out to be a latte. room staff not very attentive and professional. Location ok but the 5 stars also not especially for the breakfast

reviews.text:
Located in the financial district, not too many nearby restaurants. The  service has been absolutely awful, waiting four hours for a room that they said had not been made up but had been made up for a day. Elevators that do not work properly, no washcloth or face towels as they were all out of them. Door to balcony handle is broken so no access to the balcony.
I have no idea how they were able to get a five star rating as everyone in our group of 60 has been pretty much disappointed by this place.

Beautiful location. Beautiful hotel. Amazing housekeeping staff!  But do not be fooled by the rooftop photos. We stayed there for nine days and we’re never able to use the rooftop. It is only available for private parties and not for hotel guess. That was extremely disappointing!!!  We were expecting to sit every evening with our wine and look at the view, but never ever were able to do it. Not even exceptions for guests like us.  Not set up like the photos show AT ALL!
Also there is no way to close off the sitting area from the bedroom so our two children on the pull out couch had no privacy from our space.  Very loud.
The hotel was beautiful and the staff were all so accommodating. We will be coming back for sure.

Good:
Excellent location. Updated room but I think it was due to the subway noise, I think they can not offer that for full price in a 5 star.
Bad:
Cleaning service not changing trash bags and not putting detergent.
Bathroom button broken.
Air conditioner only work for seconds and turn off, windows not opening so too hot.
They do not accept cash.

Near the Tower Hill station (for train), so it was easy to transport. They provide the food for breakfast, and it was delicious!!! Many different types of food choices 👍 The room was clean, big, and the bed was comfortable! Not cheap, but I think the price suites the quality.
I really liked the suites it has a spectacular view very nice staff , perfect location for tourists,Highly recommended.

Location is great. Staff were helpful. Close to the tube and a lot of restaurants etc in the area. Hotel is really clean and the bed is so comfortable. There is a rooftop bar but I didn’t get to visit there. Will definitely be staying here again next time I’m in london
Excellent location just by Tower Hill tube station, lovely large room and great service, highly recommended!

Really love the location of this well appointed hotel.
We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment, for 4 persons. The staff set up the sofa bed for us before arrival.
Liked that we have everything we need for a few nights stay: washer/dryer, microwave, dishwasher, Nespresso machine.
Highly recommended.

Great central location, rooms are fantastic (great to have a proper fridge, oven/hob and dishwasher in the room). Lots of space. Staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast is pretty good for a hotel buffet and the gym facilities get the job done. Great spot for a family visit especially if you have kids.
Beautiful hotel in London. If you guys want to stay heart'of London please stay and visit the precious hotel ♥️
Just love this place 🤗

Meine Mutter feierte ihren 60. Geburtstag in London (kommen aus Berlin, DE), sie wollte schon immer mal nach London, da lohnt das schon zu 60.

Zum Hotel Selbst:
- Preis ist hoch... aber hat eben eine 1A Lage und ist ein 5 Sterne Hotel, wer Billig will muss nach weniger Sternen schauen.

- Service: für uns die das erste mal 5 Sterne hatten, TOP, braucht man hilfe, keine Problem, man hat eine Frage, wird dir gerne beantwortet. übrigens, Viele Grüße an Gabriel (Concierge), der sogar das ein oder andere Wort Deutsch hat versucht mit uns zu wechseln (wie auch andere Mitarbeiter im Hotel).

- Zimmer, Top, mit kleiner Küche etc., WLAN gibt es auch und das hat ziemlich gute Qualität (flotter als bei mir zuhause).

- Lage/Umgebung: U-bahn (Tube) quasi um die ecke, London Towers fällt man fast rein, Tower Bridge nur kurz laufen, andere wichtige Sehenswürdigkeiten sind mit der U-bahn (Tube) zügig zu erreichen.

TL;DR: Konto hat gelitten, mir wars egal, wir hatten Spaß und das Hotel ist absolut zu Empfehlen, wir schauen das wir wiederkommen.
reviews.textTranslated:
My mother celebrated her 60th birthday in London (coming from Berlin, DE), she always wanted to go to London, it's worth it at 60.

To the hotel itself:
- Price is high... but has a prime location and is a 5 star hotel, if you want cheap you have to look for fewer stars.

- Service: for us who had 5 stars the first time, TOP, you need help, no problem, you have a question, you will be gladly answered. By the way, many greetings to Gabriel (concierge), who even tried to change a word or two of German with us (as did other employees in the hotel).

- Rooms, top, with a small kitchen, etc., there is also WiFi and it has a pretty good quality (faster than at home).

- Location/surroundings: subway (tube) almost around the corner, you almost fall into London Towers, Tower Bridge only a short walk away, other important sights can be reached quickly with the subway (tube).

TL;DR: Account suffered, I didn't care, we had fun and the hotel is highly recommended, we'll see if we come back.

reviews.text:
Great location. Clean rooms and friendly service.
Get the room with kitchenette…that was what I needed especially travelling on the road for so long we want to cook for ourselves. Restaurant is available downstairs and you can order food to your room if you wish.
Beds are decent. Good size rooms.
Perfect for executive living, basic needs…nothing fancy.

Brilliant Experience at this Hotel! It was my birthday and they gave us a complimentary upgrade, left fresh chocolate covered strawberries and a birthday card in my room. Throughout our stay they looked after us well and even gave another discount to the booking on check out! The room was lovely, very clean and room service was also great! I would definitely choose this hotel again. Excellent location too!
Great place lots of great restaurants and walk about shoppes near hotel
Attended a reception there. Had drinks and snacks.

I highly recommend this hotel for its location, its service, and room layouts. Each room has a tiny pantry, some rooms even have washer dryers, microwaves & hubs depending on what you've booked!
Amazing service!
Everyone is solicitous and service oriented.
The location is amazing, has 3 stations in walking distances, and stops for tour buses too! And the London bus stops too!
Next time you are in London, stay here!

Everything was amazing I have to say. I have stayed in lots of hotels here and abroad but no hotel has good customer service as tower suites. Every single staff member where very polite and friendly. I booked this hotel for my girlfriends birthday, as soon as we arrived we was told that we have been upgraded to there best room. The room was immaculate. I can name so many big companies who  should stay at this hotel and learn about real customer service no joke. The Italian restaurant was amazing. We was given a tour of the rooftop bar and had photos taken this is something the waiters arranged for us when they released it was my girlfriends birthday and all of this was when they where getting ready to go home. Honestly cam not praise them enough

Das Hotel war okay, alles sauber, Personal freundlich und hilfsbereit. Zimmer sind gut eingerichtet und ausgestattet. Für mich war Preisleistung nicht passend, also etwas teuer für die gesamte Ausstattung kein Pool oder Fitness. Das Restaurant machte ein guten Eindruck, wir haben aber nicht dort gegessen.
reviews.textTranslated: The hotel was okay, everything was clean, staff friendly and helpful. Rooms are well furnished and equipped. For me, the price-performance ratio was not suitable, so it was a bit expensive for all the facilities, no pool or fitness. The restaurant looked good, but we didn't eat there.
